   26: # include <conio.h>

   28: # ifndef strcmpi
   29: #  define strcmpi strcasecmp

   42: #define SVN_REV  "$Date: 2015-08-31 10:18:11 -0500 (Mon, 31 Aug 2015) $"
   43:

   45: 
   51: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
   52:  typedef unsigned char uint8_t;
   53:  typedef unsigned int  uint16_t;  
   54:  typedef unsigned long uint32_t;  
   55: 
   56:  typedef char int8_t;
   57:  typedef int  int16_t;  
   58:  typedef long int32_t;  
   59: #endif
   60: 
   65: typedef int BOOL;
   66: #define false 0
   67: #define true  1
   68: enum { FALSE = 0, TRUE = 1 };
   69: 
   70: 
   75: #define CLOCK_PERIOD_SEC   20.0e-9
   76: 
   77: 
  108: enum
  109: {
  110: 	ID_DIN  = 0x8012,  
  111: 	ID_SPI  = 0x8013,  
  112: 	ID_DOUT = 0x8021,  
  113: 	ID_IAI  = 0x8030   
  114: };
  115:

  121: enum
  122: {
  123: 	ID_IDI48 = 0,			
  124: 	ID_IDO48 = 1,			
  125: 	ID_IAI16 = 2,			
  126: 	ID_ARM32 = 3,			
  127: 	ID_BOARD_UNKNOWN = 99	
  128: };

  150: #define ERROR_CODES(_) \
  151: 	 \
  152: 		_( SUCCESS,							0,		""							) \
  153: 		_( EC_BUFFER_TOO_LARGE, 			1,      "buffer too large"			) \
  154: 		_( EC_DIRECTION,        			2,      "direction"					) \
  155: 		_( EC_PARAMETER,	    			3,      "parameter"					) \
  156: 		_( EC_NOT_FOUND,        			4,		"not found"					) \
  157: 		_( EC_PARAMETER_MISSING,			5,		"missing parameter"			) \
  158: 		_( EC_SYNTAX,						6,		"syntax error"				) \
  159: 		_( EC_HEX_DUMP_COUNT, 				7,		"hex dump count"			) \
  160: 		_( EC_INIT_FILE,                    8,		"write init file failed"    ) \
  161: 		_( EC_BANK,		                    9,		"bank not found"    		) \
  162: 		\
  163: 		_( EC_APP_TERMINATE,               10,      "terminated by user" 		) \
  164: 		_( EC_APP_TERMINATE_CTRLC,         11,      "terminated by ctrl-c" 		) \
  165: 		_( EC_NOT_IMPLEMENTED,			   12,		"function not implemented"  ) \
  166: 		_( EC_CHANNEL,                     13,      "channel range"             ) \
  167: 		_( EC_MISSING_DATA,		   		   14,		"missing data"				) \
  168: 		_( EC_BUSY,				   		   16,		"interrupt busy"			) \
  169: 		_( EC_INTERRUPT_UNAVAILABLE,	   21,		"interrupt not available"	) \
  170: 		\
  171: 		_( EC_INTR_ERROR,                  22,		"interrupt error"           ) \
  172: 		_( EC_SPI_ECD_OUT_OF_RANGE, 	   40,  	"SPI ECD range"				) \
  173: 		_( EC_SPI_HALF_CLOCK_OUT_OF_RANGE, 41, 		"SPI half clock range"		) \
  174: 		_( EC_SPI_CSB_OUT_OF_RANGE,  	   42, 		"SPI CSB range"				) \
  175: 		_( EC_SPI_NOT_FOUND, 		 	   43, 		"SPI not found"				) \
  176: 		_( EC_SPI_BUFFER_SIZE_ODD,         44,		"buffer size odd"			) \
  177: 		_( EC_SPI_BUFFER_SIZE,         	   45,		"buffer size out of range"	) \
  178: 		_( EC_SPI_OBJECT_SIZE,         	   46,		"spi tx/rx object size"		) \
  179: 		_( EC_SPI_BUFFER_MISMATCH,     	   47,		"spi buffer mismatch"		) \
  180: 		_( EC_SPI_BUFFERS_NULL,     	   48,		"spi tx/rx buffers null"	) \
  181: 		_( EC_FRAM_ADDRESS_RANGE,     	   49,		"fram address range"		) \
  182: 		_( EC_TEST_FAIL,                   50,		"test fail"           		) \
  183: 		_( EC_BOARD, 					   51,		"board invalid"				) \
  184: 		_( EC_BOARD_TYPE,				   52,		"board type invalid"		) \
  185: 		_( EC_REGISTER_ADDRESS_EXCEEDED,   53,		"register address exceeded" ) \
  186: 		_( EC_EXTRA_IGNORED,			   54,		"extra ignored" 			) \
  187: 		_( EC_FILE_ERROR,				   55,		"file open error" 			) \
  188: 		_( EC_MODE_LEGACY,				   56,		"S/W set to legacy mode"	)
  189: 
  190: 
  191: 
  192: #define EC_EXTRACT_ENUM(symbol,code,message)    symbol = code,
  193: #define EC_EXTRACT_HUMAN_READABLE(symbol,code,message)  { code, message },
  194: #define EC_HUMAN_READABLE_TERMINATE { 0, NULL }
  195: 
  196: 
  197: 
  198: 
  199: typedef enum
  200: {
  201: 	ERROR_CODES( EC_EXTRACT_ENUM )
  202: } EC_ENUM;  
  203: 
  204: struct ec_human_readable
  205: {
  206: 	EC_ENUM			error_code;
  207: 	const char *	message;
  208: };

  223: #define IDI_BANK_INFO_DEFINITION(_)       \
  224: 		_( IDI_BANK_0,			0x00	) \
  225: 		_( IDI_BANK_1,			0x40	) \
  226: 		_( IDI_BANK_2,			0x80	) \
  227: 		_( IDI_BANK_3,			0xC0	) \
  228: 		_( IDI_BANK_4,			0x20	) \
  229: 		_( IDI_BANK_5,			0x60	) \
  230: 		_( IDI_BANK_6,			0xA0	) \
  231: 		_( IDI_BANK_7,			0xE0	) \
  232: 		_( IDI_BANK_NONE,		0xFE	) \
  233: 		_( IDI_BANK_UNDEFINED,	0xFF	)
  234: 
  235: 
  236: #define IDO_BANK_INFO_DEFINITION(_)       \
  237: 		_( IDO_BANK_0,			0x00	) \
  238: 		_( IDO_BANK_1,			0x40	) \
  239: 		_( IDO_BANK_2,			0x80	) \
  240: 		_( IDO_BANK_3,			0xC0	) \
  241: 		_( IDO_BANK_4,			0x20	) \
  242: 		_( IDO_BANK_5,			0x60	) \
  243: 		_( IDO_BANK_6,			0xA0	) \
  244: 		_( IDO_BANK_7,			0xE0	) \
  245: 		_( IDO_BANK_NONE,		0xFE	) \
  246: 		_( IDO_BANK_UNDEFINED,	0xFF	)
  247: 
  248: 
  249: #define BANK_INFO_DEFINITION(_)       	  \
  250: 		_( BANK_0,				0x00	) \
  251: 		_( BANK_1,				0x40	) \
  252: 		_( BANK_2,				0x80	) \
  253: 		_( BANK_3,				0xC0	) \
  254: 		_( BANK_4,				0x20	) \
  255: 		_( BANK_5,				0x60	) \
  256: 		_( BANK_6,				0xA0	) \
  257: 		_( BANK_7,				0xE0	) \
  258: 		_( BANK_NONE,			0xFE	) \
  259: 		_( BANK_UNDEFINED,		0xFF	)
  260:

  265: 
  266: 
  267: #define BANK_EXTRACT_ENUM(symbol,value)  symbol = value,
  268: 
  269: #define BANK_EXTRACT_DEFINITION(symbol,value) { symbol,             #symbol },
  270: 
  271: 
  272: enum { IDI_BANK_ENUM_QTY = 10 };
  273: 
  274: enum { IDO_BANK_ENUM_QTY = 10 };
  275: 
  276: typedef enum
  277: {
  278: 	IDI_BANK_INFO_DEFINITION( BANK_EXTRACT_ENUM )
  279: } IDI_BANK_ENUM;
  280: 
  281: typedef enum
  282: {
  283: 	IDO_BANK_INFO_DEFINITION( BANK_EXTRACT_ENUM )
  284: } IDO_BANK_ENUM;
  285: 
  286: typedef enum
  287: {
  288: 	BANK_INFO_DEFINITION( BANK_EXTRACT_ENUM )
  289: } BANK_ENUM;
  290: 
  291: 
  292: 
  293: 
  294: #define BANK_NULL_DEFINITION                  { BANK_UNDEFINED, 	NULL    }
  295: 
  296: 
  297: 
  298: struct idi_bank_info
  299: {
  300: 	int				symbol;
  301: 	const char * 	name;
  302: };
  303: 
  304: struct ido_bank_info
  305: {
  306: 	IDI_BANK_ENUM	symbol;
  307: 	const char * 	name;
  308: };
  309: 
  310: struct bank_info
  311: {
  312: 	BANK_ENUM		symbol;
  313: 	const char * 	name;
  314: };
  315: 
  316: 
  317: 
  318: typedef enum
  319: {
  320: 	REG_DIR_NONE 		= 0x00,
  321: 	REG_DIR_READ 		= 0x01,
  322: 	REG_DIR_WRITE 		= 0x02,
  323: 	REG_DIR_READ_WRITE	= 0x03
  324: } REG_DIR_ENUM;
  325: 
  326: 
  327: 
  328: 
  335: #define IDI_REGISTER_SET_DEFINITION(_) \
  336:  \
  337:  \
  338: 	 \
  339: 	_( IDI_DI_GROUP0,			 0,		0,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"dig0",		IDI_BANK_NONE	) \
  340: 	_( IDI_DI_GROUP1,			 1,		1,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"dig1",		IDI_BANK_NONE	) \
  341: 	_( IDI_DI_GROUP2,			 2,		2,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"dig2",		IDI_BANK_NONE	) \
  342: 	_( IDI_DI_GROUP3,			 3,		3,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"dig3",		IDI_BANK_NONE	) \
  343: 	_( IDI_DI_GROUP4,			 4,		4,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"dig4",		IDI_BANK_NONE	) \
  344: 	_( IDI_DI_GROUP5,			 5,		5,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"dig5",		IDI_BANK_NONE	) \
  345: 	 \
  346: 	_( IDI_INTR_BY_GROUP,		 6,		6,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"isbg",		IDI_BANK_NONE	) \
  347: 	 \
  348: 	_( IDI_PEND_GROUP0,	 		 7,		8,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"p0",		IDI_BANK_3		) \
  349: 	_( IDI_PEND_GROUP1,	 		 8,		9,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"p1",		IDI_BANK_3		) \
  350: 	_( IDI_PEND_GROUP2,	 		 9,	   10,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"p2",		IDI_BANK_3		) \

  352: 	_( IDI_PEND_GROUP4,			11,	   12,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"p4",		IDI_BANK_3		) \
  353: 	_( IDI_PEND_GROUP5,			12,	   13,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"p5",		IDI_BANK_3		) \
  354: 	_( IDI_CLEAR_GROUP0,	 	13,		8,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_WRITE,		"c0",		IDI_BANK_3		) \
  355: 	_( IDI_CLEAR_GROUP1,	 	14,		9,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_WRITE,		"c1",		IDI_BANK_3		) \

  359: 	_( IDI_CLEAR_GROUP5,		18,	   13,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_WRITE,		"c5",		IDI_BANK_3		) \
  360: 	 \
  361: 	_( IDI_BANK,				19,		7,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"bank",		IDI_BANK_NONE	) \
  362: 	_( IDI_ID_LSB,				20,    14,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"idlsb",	IDI_BANK_NONE	) \
  363: 	_( IDI_ID_MSB,				21,    15,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"idmsb",	IDI_BANK_NONE	) \
  364: 	_( IDI_ZERO0,				22,		8,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"zb0",		IDI_BANK_0		) \
  365: 	_( IDI_ZERO1,				23,		9,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"zb1",		IDI_BANK_0		) \
  366: 	_( IDI_ZERO2,				24,	   10,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"zb2",		IDI_BANK_0		) \

  372: 	_( IDI_FPGA_INDEX,			29,		9,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"fi",		IDI_BANK_0		) \
  373: 	 \
  374: 	_( IDI_EDGE_GROUP0,			30,	    8,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"ep0",		IDI_BANK_1		) \
  375: 	_( IDI_EDGE_GROUP1,			31,	    9,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"ep1",		IDI_BANK_1		) \

  425: 	_( IDO_SPI_DATA,			17,	    8,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"sdata",	IDO_BANK_7		) \
  426: 	_( IDO_SPI_TX_STATUS,		18,	    9,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"stxf",		IDO_BANK_7		) \
  427: 	_( IDO_SPI_RX_STATUS,		19,	   10,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"srxf",		IDO_BANK_7		) \
  428: 	_( IDO_SPI_COMMIT,			20,	   11,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"scmt",		IDO_BANK_7		) \
  429: 	_( IDO_UNDEFINED,			21,	    0,		0,		0,		REG_DIR_NONE,		"",			IDO_BANK_UNDEFINED	)
  430: 
  431: 
  432: 
  433: 
  434: #define IAI_REGISTER_SET_DEFINITION(_) \
  435:  \
  436:  \
  437: 	 \
  438: 	_( IAI_AIN0,				 0,	 0x00,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai1",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  439: 	_( IAI_AIN1,				 1,	 0x02,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai2",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  440: 	_( IAI_AIN2,				 2,	 0x04,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai3",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  441: 	_( IAI_AIN3,				 3,	 0x06,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai4",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  442: 	_( IAI_AIN4,			  	 4,	 0x20,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai5",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  443: 	_( IAI_AIN5,				 5,	 0x22,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai6",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  444: 	_( IAI_AIN6,				 6,	 0x24,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai7",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  445: 	_( IAI_AIN7,				 7,	 0x26,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai8",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  446: 	_( IAI_AIN8,				 8,	 0x40,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai9",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  447: 	_( IAI_AIN9,				 9,	 0x42,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai10",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  448: 	_( IAI_AIN10,				10,	 0x44,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai11",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  449: 	_( IAI_AIN11,				11,	 0x46,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai12",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  450: 	_( IAI_AIN12,				12,	 0x60,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai13",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  451: 	_( IAI_AIN13,				13,	 0x62,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai14",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  452: 	_( IAI_AIN14,				14,	 0x64,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai15",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  453: 	_( IAI_AIN15,				15,	 0x66,		2,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"ai16",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  454: 	\
  455: 	_( IAI_FPGA_DATA,			 7,		8,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"fd",		IDI_BANK_0		) \
  456: 	_( IAI_FPGA_INDEX,			 8,		9,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"fi",		IDI_BANK_0		) \
  457: 	 \
  458: 	_( IAI_ID_LSB,				17,  0x6E,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"idlsb",	IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  459: 	_( IAI_ID_MSB,				18,  0x6F,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"idmsb",	IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  460: 	\
  461: 	_( IAI_SPI_ID_LSB,			19,	 0x70,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"sidlsb",	IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  462: 	_( IAI_SPI_ID_MSB,			20,	 0x71,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"sidmsb",	IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  463: 	_( IAI_SPI_CONFIG,			21,	 0x72,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"scfg",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  464: 	_( IAI_SPI_ECD,				22,	 0x73,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"secd",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  465: 	_( IAI_SPI_HCI_LSB,			23,	 0x74,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"shclsb",	IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  466: 	_( IAI_SPI_HCI_MSB,			24,	 0x75,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"shcmsb",	IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  467: 	_( IAI_SPI_DATA,			25,	 0x76,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"sdata",	IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  468: 	_( IAI_SPI_TX_STATUS,		26,	 0x77,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"stxf",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  469: 	_( IAI_SPI_RX_STATUS,		27,	 0x78,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"srxf",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  470: 	_( IAI_SPI_COMMIT,			28,	 0x79,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"scmt",		IAI_BANK_NONE	) \
  471: 	_( IAI_UNDEFINED,			29,	    0,		0,		0,		REG_DIR_NONE,		"",			IAI_BANK_UNDEFINED	)
  472: 
  473: #if(0)
  474: #define SPI_REGISTER_SET_DEFINITION(_) \
  475:  \
  476:  \
  477: 	\
  478: 	_( SPI_ID_LSB,				 7,	    8,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"sidlsb",	BANK_6			) \
  479: 	_( SPI_ID_MSB,				 8,	    9,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"sidmsb",	BANK_6			) \
  480: 	_( SPI_CONFIG,				 9,	   10,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"scfg",		BANK_6			) \
  481: 	_( SPI_ECD,					10,	   11,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"secd",		BANK_6			) \
  482: 	_( SPI_HCI_LSB,				11,	   12,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"shclsb",	BANK_6			) \
  483: 	_( SPI_HCI_MSB,				12,	   13,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"shcmsb",	BANK_6			) \
  484: 	_( SPI_DATA,				13,	    8,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"sdata",	BANK_7			) \
  485: 	_( SPI_TX_STATUS,			14,	    9,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"stxf",		BANK_7			) \
  486: 	_( SPI_RX_STATUS,			15,	   10,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ,		"srxf",		BANK_7			) \
  487: 	_( SPI_COMMIT,				16,	   11,		1,		1,		REG_DIR_READ_WRITE,	"scmt",		BANK_7			) \
  488: 	_( SPI_UNDEFINED,			17,	    0,		0,		0,		REG_DIR_NONE,		"",			BANK_UNDEFINED	)
  489: #endif
  490: 
  491: 
  492: #define REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET(location)   ( ( (location) >> 8   ) & 0xFF )
  493: #define REG_LOCATION_CHANNEL_GET(location)   (   (location)          & 0xFF )
  494: 
  495: 
  503: #define REG_LOCATION_SET(index,channel)      ( ( ((index) & 0xFF) << 8 )  |  ((channel) & 0xFF) )
  504: 
  505: 
  509: #define REG_EXTRACT_ENUM(symbol,index,offset,register_bytes,aperture_bytes,read_write,name,bank) symbol = REG_LOCATION_SET(index,0),
  510: 
  511: 
  515: #define REG_EXTRACT_DEFINITION(symbol,index,offset,register_bytes,aperture_bytes,read_write,name,bank) { REG_LOCATION_SET(index,0), read_write, bank, offset, #symbol, name },
  516: 
  517: 
  525: 
  526: typedef enum
  527: {
  528: 	IDI_REGISTER_SET_DEFINITION( REG_EXTRACT_ENUM )
  529: } IDI_REG_ENUM;
  530: 
  531: 
  532: typedef enum
  533: {
  534: 	IDO_REGISTER_SET_DEFINITION( REG_EXTRACT_ENUM )
  535: } IDO_REG_ENUM;
  536: 
  537: 
  538: struct idi_reg_definition
  539: {
  540: 	IDI_REG_ENUM	symbol;
  541: 	REG_DIR_ENUM	direction;
  542: 	IDI_BANK_ENUM	bank;
  543: 	uint16_t		physical_offset;
  544: 	char * 			symbol_name;
  545: 	char *			acronym;
  546: };
  547: 
  548: 
  549: struct ido_reg_definition
  550: {
  551: 	IDO_REG_ENUM	symbol;
  552: 	REG_DIR_ENUM	direction;
  553: 	IDO_BANK_ENUM	bank;
  554: 	uint16_t		physical_offset;
  555: 	char * 			symbol_name;
  556: 	char *			acronym;
  557: };
  558: 
  559: 
  560: 
  561: struct reg_definition
  562: {
  563: 	int				symbol;
  564: 	REG_DIR_ENUM	direction;
  565: 	int				bank;
  566: 	uint16_t		physical_offset;
  567: 	char * 			symbol_name;
  568: 	char *			acronym;
  569: };
  570: 
  571: 
  572: typedef enum
  573: {
  574: 	CSB_SOFTWARE	= 0,
  575: 	CSB_BUFFER		= 1,
  576: 	CSB_uint8_t		= 2,
  577: 	CSB_uint16_t	= 3
  578: } SPI_CSB_ENUM;
  579: 
  580: 
  581: 
  582: enum { SPI_FIFO_SIZE = 8 };
  583: 
  584: enum { SPI_FIFO_SIZE_BIT_WIDTH = 15 };
  585: 
  586: 
  587: 
  588: struct spi_cfg
  589: {
  590: 	BOOL				sdio_wrap;				
  591: 	BOOL				sdo_polarity;			
  592: 	BOOL				sdi_polarity;			
  593: 	BOOL				sclk_phase;				
  594: 	BOOL				sclk_polarity;			
  595: 	BOOL				chip_select_route_ch1;  
  596: 	SPI_CSB_ENUM		chip_select_behavior; 	
  597: 	uint8_t				end_cycle_delay;		
  598: 	uint16_t			half_clock_interval;	
  599: 
  600: 	double				clock_hz;				
  601: 	double				end_delay_ns;			
  602: };
  603: 
  604: struct spi_status
  605: {
  606: 	BOOL	tx_status;  
  607: 	BOOL	full;
  608: 	BOOL	empty;
  609: 	int		fifo_size;
  610: 	int		fifo_count;
  611: };
  612: 
  613: 
  614: 
  615: #define IDI_DIN_GROUP_SIZE  8
  616: #define IDI_DIN_SHIFT_RIGHT 3
  617: #define IDI_DIN_GROUP_QTY   6
  618: #define IDI_DIN_QTY			( IDI_DIN_GROUP_SIZE * IDI_DIN_GROUP_QTY )
  619: 
  620: 
  621: #define IDO_DO_GROUP_SIZE  8
  622: #define IDO_DO_SHIFT_RIGHT 3
  623: #define IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY   6
  624: #define IDO_DO_QTY		   ( IDO_DO_GROUP_SIZE * IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY )
  625: 
  626: 
  627: struct din_cfg
  628: {
  629: 	struct
  630: 	{
  631: 		BOOL	falling_edge;
  632: 		BOOL	interrupt_enable;
  633: 	} chan[IDI_DIN_QTY];
  634: };
  635: 
  636: struct dout_cfg
  637: {
  638: 	struct
  639: 	{
  640: 		BOOL	value;
  641: 	} chan[IDO_DO_QTY];
  642: };
  643: 
  644: 
  645: 
  646: 
  649: 
  650: #define FRAM_BLOCK_SIZE   	 256
  651: #define SPI_BLOCK_SIZE       256
  652: #define REGS_INIT_QTY         16
  653: #define MESSAGE_SIZE         256
  654: 
  655: 
  656: struct spi_dataset
  657: {
  658: 	uint16_t			id;
  659: 	struct spi_cfg 		cfg;
  660: 
  661: 	
  662: 	uint8_t				fram_block[FRAM_BLOCK_SIZE];
  663: 
  664: 	
  667: 	uint8_t				tx_buffer[SPI_BLOCK_SIZE];
  668: 	uint8_t				rx_buffer[SPI_BLOCK_SIZE];
  669: };
  670: 
  671: 
  672: 
  673: #define IO_TRACE_DEFINITION(_) \
  674:  \
  675: 	_( IO_TRACE_NULL,	0,		"NULL"				) \
  676: 	_( IO_TRACE_READ,	1,		"IO_Read_U8"		) \
  677: 	_( IO_TRACE_WRITE,	2,		"IO_Write_U8"		) \
  678: 	_( IO_TRACE_SPI,	3,		"SPI"				) \
  679: 	_( IO_TRACE_FRAM,	4,		"FRAM"				) \
  680: 	_( IO_TRACE_AS,		5,		"Analog_Stick"		) \
  681: 	_( IO_TRACE_OTHER,	6,		"Other"				) \
  682: 
  683: #define IO_TRACE_EXTRACT_ENUM(symbol,index,name) symbol = index,
  684: #define IO_TRACE_EXTRACT_NAME(symbol,index,name) name,
  685: 
  686: 
  687: 
  688: 
  689: 
  690: 
  691: 
  692: 
  693: 
  694: 
  695: 
  696: 
  697: 
  698: 
  699: 
  702: #define IO_TRACE_START_DEFINITION(_) \
  703:  \
  704: 	_( IO_TRACE_START_DISABLE,		0,		"disable",	ds->trace.active = false;								      ) \
  705: 	_( IO_TRACE_START_ON,			1,		"on",		ds->trace.active = true;		    						  ) \
  706: 	_( IO_TRACE_START_ERROR,		2,		"error",	if ( SUCCESS       != error_code  ) ds->trace.active = true;  ) \
  707: 	_( IO_TRACE_START_SPI,			3,		"spi",		if ( IO_TRACE_SPI  == action      ) ds->trace.active = true;  ) \
  708: 	_( IO_TRACE_START_FRAM,			4,		"fram",		if ( IO_TRACE_FRAM == action      ) ds->trace.active = true;  ) \
  709: 	_( IO_TRACE_START_AS,			5,		"as",		if ( IO_TRACE_AS   == action      ) ds->trace.active = true;  )
  710: 
  711: #define IO_TRACE_STOP_DEFINITION(_) \
  712:  \
  713: 	_( IO_TRACE_STOP_NONE,			0,		"none",																	  ) \
  714: 	_( IO_TRACE_STOP_ERROR,			1,		"error",	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) ds->trace.active = false;		  ) \
  715: 	_( IO_TRACE_STOP_CTRLC,			2,		"ctrlc",																  )
  716: 
  717: 
  718: #define IO_TRACE_START_STOP_EXTRACT_ENUM(symbol,index,name,action) symbol = index,
  719: #define IO_TRACE_START_STOP_EXTRACT_NAME(symbol,index,name,action) name,
  720: 
  721: #define IO_TRACE_START_STOP_EXTRACT_NAME_HELP_LIST(symbol,index,name,action) name " "
  722: 
  723: #define IO_TRACE_START_STOP_EXTRACT_SWITCH_STATEMENT(symbol,index,name,action)  \
  724: 	case symbol:	\
  725: 		{ action }  \
  726: 		break;
  727: 
  728: 
  729: enum IO_TRACE_ENUM
  730: {
  731: 	IO_TRACE_DEFINITION( IO_TRACE_EXTRACT_ENUM )
  732: };
  733: 
  734: enum IO_TRACE_START_ENUM
  735: {
  736: 	IO_TRACE_START_DEFINITION( IO_TRACE_START_STOP_EXTRACT_ENUM )
  737: };
  738: 
  739: enum IO_TRACE_STOP_ENUM
  740: {
  741: 	IO_TRACE_STOP_DEFINITION( IO_TRACE_START_STOP_EXTRACT_ENUM )
  742: };
  743: 
  744: #define IO_TRACE_SIZE  			1024
  745: #define IO_TRACE_FILE_NAME_SIZE 32
  746: #define IO_TRACE_DUMP_FILE_NAME "iotrace.csv"
  747: 
  748: #define IO_TRACE_USE_SPI_LOGGING  	1
  749: #define IO_TRACE_USE_FRAM_LOGGING 	1
  750: #define IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING 	1
  751: 
  752: struct io_trace
  753: {
  754: 	int					error_code;
  755: 	enum IO_TRACE_ENUM 	action;
  756: 	int 				board_id;
  757: 	int 				location;
  758: 	size_t				line;		
  759: 	size_t				posting;   
  760: 	uint8_t 			value;
  761: 	const char * 		function_name;
  762: };
  763: 
  764: struct io_trace_info
  765: {
  766: 	size_t						begin;
  767: 	size_t						end;
  768: 	size_t						index;
  769: 	size_t						count;
  770: 	size_t						posting; 
  771: 	BOOL						wrap;
  772: 	enum IO_TRACE_START_ENUM	start;
  773: 	enum IO_TRACE_STOP_ENUM		stop;
  774: 	BOOL						active;
  775: 	char  						filename[IO_TRACE_FILE_NAME_SIZE];
  776: 	struct io_trace *   		buf;
  777: };
  778: 
  779: 
  780: typedef enum
  781: {
  782: 	MODE_JUMPERS_0		= 0,  
  783: 	MODE_JUMPERS_1 		= 1,
  784: 	MODE_JUMPERS_2		= 2,
  785: 	MODE_JUMPERS_3		= 3
  786: } MODE_JUMPERS_ENUM;
  787: 
  788: 
  789: struct idi_dataset
  790: {
  791: 	
  792: 	int					board_id;
  793: 
  794: 	BOOL				quit_application;
  795: 	uint16_t			base_address;
  796: 	IDI_BANK_ENUM		bank_previous;
  797: 
  798: 	BOOL				io_simulate;
  799: 	BOOL				io_report;
  800: 	BOOL				spi_is_present;
  801: 
  802: 	BOOL				fram_cs_default;   
  803: 	BOOL				fram_spi_cs_route_backup;
  804: 	BOOL				as_cs_default;   
  805: 	BOOL				as_spi_cs_route_backup;
  806: 	MODE_JUMPERS_ENUM	mode_jumpers;
  807: 	const char *		svn_revision_string;
  808: 	struct spi_dataset		spi;
  809: 	struct io_trace_info 	trace;
  810: 
  811: 	
  812: 	char 	  			message[MESSAGE_SIZE];
  813: 
  814: 
  815: 	
  816: 	unsigned int 		irq_number;
  817: 	
  820: 	BOOL				irq_please_install_handler_request;	
  821: 	BOOL				irq_handler_active;					
  822: 	size_t				irq_quantity;						
  823: 	size_t volatile 	irq_count;          				
  824: 	size_t				irq_count_previous;					
  825: 	
  830: 	uint8_t	volatile	isr_pending_list[IDI_DIN_GROUP_QTY]; 
  831: 
  832: 	
  833: 
  834: 	struct din_cfg		din_cfg;
  835: 
  836: 	struct
  837: 	{
  838: 		BOOL			used;
  839: 		int				address;
  840: 		IDI_REG_ENUM 	location;
  841: 		uint8_t 		value;
  842: 	} reg_init[REGS_INIT_QTY];
  843: 
  844: };
  845: 
  846: 
  847: struct ido_dataset
  848: {
  849: 	
  850: 	int					board_id;
  851: 
  852: 	BOOL				quit_application;
  853: 	uint16_t			base_address;
  854: 	IDI_BANK_ENUM		bank_previous;
  855: 
  856: 	BOOL				io_simulate;
  857: 	BOOL				io_report;
  858: 	BOOL				spi_is_present;
  859: 
  860: 	BOOL				fram_cs_default;   
  861: 	BOOL				fram_spi_cs_route_backup;
  862: 	BOOL				as_cs_default;   
  863: 	BOOL				as_spi_cs_route_backup;
  864: 	MODE_JUMPERS_ENUM	mode_jumpers;
  865: 	const char *		svn_revision_string;
  866: 	struct spi_dataset		spi;
  867: 	struct io_trace_info 	trace;
  868: 
  869: 	
  870: 	char 	  			message[MESSAGE_SIZE];
  871: 
  872: 	
  873: 	unsigned int 		irq_number;
  874: 	
  877: 	BOOL				irq_please_install_handler_request;	
  878: 	BOOL				irq_handler_active;					
  879: 	size_t				irq_quantity;						
  880: 	size_t volatile 	irq_count;          				
  881: 	size_t				irq_count_previous;					
  882: 	
  887: 	uint8_t	volatile	isr_pending_list[IDI_DIN_GROUP_QTY]; 
  888: 
  889: 	
  890: 
  891: 	struct dout_cfg		dout_cfg;
  892: 
  893: 	struct
  894: 	{
  895: 		BOOL			used;
  896: 		int				address;
  897: 		IDO_REG_ENUM 	location;
  898: 		uint8_t 		value;
  899: 	} reg_init[REGS_INIT_QTY];
  900: 
  901: };
  902: 
  903: 
  904: 
  905: 
  910: struct board_dataset
  911: {
  912: 	
  913: 	int					board_id;
  914: 
  915: 	BOOL				quit_application;
  916: 	uint16_t			base_address;
  917: 	int					bank_previous;
  918: 	BOOL				io_simulate;
  919: 	BOOL				io_report;
  920: 	BOOL				spi_is_present;
  921: 
  922: 	BOOL				fram_cs_default;   
  923: 	BOOL				fram_spi_cs_route_backup;
  924: 	BOOL				as_cs_default;   
  925: 	BOOL				as_spi_cs_route_backup;
  926: 	MODE_JUMPERS_ENUM	mode_jumpers;
  927: 	const char *		svn_revision_string;
  928: 	struct spi_dataset		spi;
  929: 	struct io_trace_info 	trace;
  930: };
  931: 
  932: 
  937: 
  938: 
  939: static const char svn_revision_string[] = { SVN_REV };
  940: 
  941: 
  942: const struct ec_human_readable ec_human_readable[] =
  943: {
  944: 		ERROR_CODES( EC_EXTRACT_HUMAN_READABLE )
  945: 		EC_HUMAN_READABLE_TERMINATE
  946: };
  947: 
  948: 
  949: 
  950: static const struct idi_bank_info idi_bank_info[] =
  951: {
  952: 		IDI_BANK_INFO_DEFINITION( BANK_EXTRACT_DEFINITION )
  953: 		BANK_NULL_DEFINITION
  954: };
  955: 
  956: static const struct ido_bank_info ido_bank_info[] =
  957: {
  958: 		IDO_BANK_INFO_DEFINITION( BANK_EXTRACT_DEFINITION )
  959: 		BANK_NULL_DEFINITION
  960: };
  961: 
  962: 
  963: 
  964: static const struct idi_reg_definition idi_reg_definition[] =
  965: {
  966: 		IDI_REGISTER_SET_DEFINITION( REG_EXTRACT_DEFINITION )
  967: };
  968: 
  969: static const struct ido_reg_definition ido_reg_definition[] =
  970: {
  971: 		IDO_REGISTER_SET_DEFINITION( REG_EXTRACT_DEFINITION )
  972: };
  973: 
  974: 
  977: static struct idi_dataset  idi_ds;
  978: 
  979: 
  980: static struct ido_dataset  ido_ds;
  981: 
  982: 
  983: static struct io_trace		global_io_trace_buf[IO_TRACE_SIZE];
  984: static BOOL					global_io_trace_enable;
  985: static const char * 		global_io_trace_start_name[] = { 	IO_TRACE_START_DEFINITION( IO_TRACE_START_STOP_EXTRACT_NAME )
  986: 																NULL
  987: 														   };
  988: static const char *			global_io_trace_stop_name[]  = { 	IO_TRACE_STOP_DEFINITION(  IO_TRACE_START_STOP_EXTRACT_NAME )
  989: 																NULL
  990: 														   };
  991: static const char * 		global_io_trace_name[] 		 = {	IO_TRACE_DEFINITION(       IO_TRACE_EXTRACT_NAME )
  992: 																NULL
  993:    	   	   	   	   	   	   	   	   	   	   	   	   	   	   };
  994: 
  995: 
 1000: 
 1001: #define IDI_BOARD_INIT_FILE_NAME    "idi_init.bin"
 1002: #define IDO_BOARD_INIT_FILE_NAME    "ido_init.bin"
 1003: 
 1004: struct board_definition
 1005: {
 1006: 	const void * bank_info;
 1007: 	const void * definition;
 1008: 	const void * dataset;
 1009: 	const int    bank_register_symbol;
 1010: 	const int	 fpga_data_symbol;
 1011: 	const int	 fpga_index_symbol;
 1012: };
 1013: 
 1014: static struct board_definition  board_definition[] =
 1015: {
 1016: 	{  	(const void *) idi_bank_info,	(const void *) idi_reg_definition, 	(const void *) &idi_ds,  	IDI_BANK,			IDI_FPGA_DATA,		IDI_FPGA_INDEX	},
 1017: 	{	(const void *) ido_bank_info,	(const void *) ido_reg_definition,	(const void *) &ido_ds,		IDO_BANK,			IDO_FPGA_DATA,		IDO_FPGA_INDEX	},
 1018: 	{	NULL,							NULL,								NULL,						IDO_BANK_NONE,		0,					0				}
 1019: };
 1020: 
 1021: 
 1022: static int  global_board_id      						= ID_IDI48;
 1023: static BOOL global_loop_command 						= false;
 1024: static int  global_loop_count                           = 0;
 1025: static int  global_loop_count_counter					= 0;
 1026: static int  global_loop_delay_ms						= 0;
 1027: static BOOL global_loop_space							= false;
 1028: static BOOL global_irq_please_install_handler_request 	= false;
 1029: 
 1030: 
 1031: 
 1032: 
 1036: 
 1037: 
 1038: 
 1039: 
 1040: 
 1041: 
 1042: 
 1050: static const char * IDI_Bank_Symbol_To_Name( struct idi_bank_info * info, IDI_BANK_ENUM bank )
 1051: {
 1052: 	int index;
 1053: 
 1054: 	switch( bank )
 1055: 	{
 1056: 		case IDI_BANK_0:			index = 0;	break;
 1057: 		case IDI_BANK_1:			index = 1;	break;
 1058: 		case IDI_BANK_2:			index = 2;	break;
 1059: 		case IDI_BANK_3:			index = 3;	break;
 1060: 		case IDI_BANK_4:			index = 4;	break;
 1061: 		case IDI_BANK_5:			index = 5;	break;
 1062: 		case IDI_BANK_6:			index = 6;	break;
 1063: 		case IDI_BANK_7:			index = 7;	break;
 1064: 		case IDI_BANK_NONE:			index = 8;	break;
 1065: 		case IDI_BANK_UNDEFINED:	index = 9;	break;
 1066: 	}
 1067: 	return info[index].name;
 1068: }
 1069: 
 1070: static const char * IDO_Bank_Symbol_To_Name( struct ido_bank_info * info, IDO_BANK_ENUM bank )
 1071: {
 1072: 	int index;
 1073: 
 1074: 	switch( bank )
 1075: 	{
 1076: 		case IDO_BANK_0:			index = 0;	break;
 1077: 		case IDO_BANK_1:			index = 1;	break;
 1078: 		case IDO_BANK_2:			index = 2;	break;
 1079: 		case IDO_BANK_3:			index = 3;	break;
 1080: 		case IDO_BANK_4:			index = 4;	break;
 1081: 		case IDO_BANK_5:			index = 5;	break;
 1082: 		case IDO_BANK_6:			index = 6;	break;
 1083: 		case IDO_BANK_7:			index = 7;	break;
 1084: 		case IDO_BANK_NONE:			index = 8;	break;
 1085: 		case IDO_BANK_UNDEFINED:	index = 9;	break;
 1086: 	}
 1087: 	return info[index].name;
 1088: }
 1089: 
 1090: 
 1091: static const char * Bank_Symbol_To_Name( int board_id, int bank )
 1092: {
 1093: 	switch ( board_id )
 1094: 	{
 1095: 		case ID_IDI48: return IDI_Bank_Symbol_To_Name( ((struct idi_bank_info *) board_definition[board_id].bank_info), (IDI_BANK_ENUM) bank );
 1096: 		case ID_IDO48: return IDO_Bank_Symbol_To_Name( ((struct ido_bank_info *) board_definition[board_id].bank_info), (IDO_BANK_ENUM) bank );
 1097: 	}
 1098: 	return NULL;
 1099: }
 1100: 
 1101: 
 1102: 
 1103: 
 1110: 
 1111: static int IDI_Bank_Name_To_Symbol( int board_id, const char * name, IDI_BANK_ENUM * bank )
 1112: {
 1113: 	int index;
 1114: 	const struct bank_info * info = board_definition[board_id].bank_info;
 1115: 	index = 0;
 1116: 	while ( NULL != info[index].name  )
 1117: 	{
 1118: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( info[index].name, name ) )
 1119: 		{
 1120: 			*bank = info[index].symbol;
 1121: 			return SUCCESS;
 1122: 		}
 1123: 		index++;
 1124: 	}
 1125: 	return -EC_BANK;
 1126: }
 1127: 
 1128: static int IDO_Bank_Name_To_Symbol( int board_id, const char * name, IDO_BANK_ENUM * bank )
 1129: {
 1130: 	int index;
 1131: 	const struct bank_info * info = board_definition[board_id].bank_info;
 1132: 	index = 0;
 1133: 	while ( NULL != info[index].name  )
 1134: 	{
 1135: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( info[index].name, name ) )
 1136: 		{
 1137: 			*bank = info[index].symbol;
 1138: 			return SUCCESS;
 1139: 		}
 1140: 		index++;
 1141: 	}
 1142: 	return -EC_BANK;
 1143: }
 1144: 
 1145: static int Bank_Name_To_Symbol( int board_id, const char * name, int * bank )
 1146: {
 1147: 	switch ( board_id )
 1148: 	{
 1149: 		case ID_IDI48: return IDI_Bank_Name_To_Symbol( board_id, name, (IDI_BANK_ENUM *) bank );
 1150: 		case ID_IDO48: return IDO_Bank_Name_To_Symbol( board_id, name, (IDO_BANK_ENUM *) bank );
 1151: 	}
 1152: 	return -EC_BOARD;
 1153: }
 1154: 
 1155: 
 1160: static int IDI_Register_Report_CSV( const struct idi_reg_definition * table, FILE * out )
 1161: {
 1162: 	int index = 0;
 1163: 
 1164: 	fprintf( out, "\"acronym\",\"symbol\",\"bank\",\"direction\",\"physical_offset\"\n" );
 1165: 	do
 1166: 	{
 1167: 		fprintf( out, "\"%s\",", table[index].acronym     );
 1168: 		fprintf( out, "\"%s\",", table[index].symbol_name );
 1169: 
 1170: 		switch( table[index].bank )
 1171: 		{
 1172: 		case IDI_BANK_0:			fprintf( out, "IDI_BANK_0" );			break;
 1173: 		case IDI_BANK_1:			fprintf( out, "IDI_BANK_1" );			break;
 1174: 		case IDI_BANK_2:			fprintf( out, "IDI_BANK_2" );			break;
 1175: 		case IDI_BANK_3:			fprintf( out, "IDI_BANK_3" );			break;
 1176: 		case IDI_BANK_4:			fprintf( out, "IDI_BANK_4" );			break;
 1177: 		case IDI_BANK_5:			fprintf( out, "IDI_BANK_5" );			break;
 1178: 		case IDI_BANK_6:			fprintf( out, "IDI_BANK_6" );			break;
 1179: 		case IDI_BANK_7:			fprintf( out, "IDI_BANK_7" );			break;
 1180: 		case IDI_BANK_NONE:			fprintf( out, "IDI_BANK_NONE" );		break;
 1181: 		case IDI_BANK_UNDEFINED:	fprintf( out, "IDI_BANK_UNDEFINED" );	break;
 1182: 		}
 1183: 		fprintf( out, "," );
 1184: 
 1185: 		switch( table[index].direction )
 1186: 		{
 1187: 			case REG_DIR_NONE:			fprintf( out, "REG_DIR_NONE" );			break;
 1188: 			case REG_DIR_READ:			fprintf( out, "REG_DIR_READ" );			break;
 1189: 			case REG_DIR_WRITE:			fprintf( out, "REG_DIR_WRITE" );		break;
 1190: 			case REG_DIR_READ_WRITE:	fprintf( out, "REG_DIR_READ_WRITE" );	break;
 1191: 		}
 1192: 		fprintf( out, "," );
 1193: 
 1194: 		fprintf( out, "\"%d\"", table[index].physical_offset );
 1195: 		fprintf( out, "\n\r" ); 
 1196: 		index++;
 1197: 	} while ( table[index].direction != REG_DIR_NONE );
 1198: 
 1199: 	return SUCCESS;
 1200: }
 1201: 
 1206: static int IDO_Register_Report_CSV( const struct ido_reg_definition * table, FILE * out )
 1207: {
 1208: 	int index = 0;
 1209: 
 1210: 	fprintf( out, "\"acronym\",\"symbol\",\"bank\",\"direction\",\"physical_offset\"\n" );
 1211: 	do
 1212: 	{
 1213: 		fprintf( out, "\"%s\",", table[index].acronym     );
 1214: 		fprintf( out, "\"%s\",", table[index].symbol_name );
 1215: 
 1216: 		switch( table[index].bank )
 1217: 		{
 1218: 		case IDO_BANK_0:			fprintf( out, "IDO_BANK_0" );			break;
 1219: 		case IDO_BANK_1:			fprintf( out, "IDO_BANK_1" );			break;
 1220: 		case IDO_BANK_2:			fprintf( out, "IDO_BANK_2" );			break;
 1221: 		case IDO_BANK_3:			fprintf( out, "IDO_BANK_3" );			break;
 1222: 		case IDO_BANK_4:			fprintf( out, "IDO_BANK_4" );			break;
 1223: 		case IDO_BANK_5:			fprintf( out, "IDO_BANK_5" );			break;
 1224: 		case IDO_BANK_6:			fprintf( out, "IDO_BANK_6" );			break;
 1225: 		case IDO_BANK_7:			fprintf( out, "IDO_BANK_7" );			break;
 1226: 		case IDO_BANK_NONE:			fprintf( out, "IDO_BANK_NONE" );		break;
 1227: 		case IDO_BANK_UNDEFINED:	fprintf( out, "IDO_BANK_UNDEFINED" );	break;
 1228: 		}
 1229: 		fprintf( out, "," );
 1230: 
 1231: 		switch( table[index].direction )
 1232: 		{
 1233: 			case REG_DIR_NONE:			fprintf( out, "REG_DIR_NONE" );			break;
 1234: 			case REG_DIR_READ:			fprintf( out, "REG_DIR_READ" );			break;
 1235: 			case REG_DIR_WRITE:			fprintf( out, "REG_DIR_WRITE" );		break;
 1236: 			case REG_DIR_READ_WRITE:	fprintf( out, "REG_DIR_READ_WRITE" );	break;
 1237: 		}
 1238: 		fprintf( out, "," );
 1239: 
 1240: 		fprintf( out, "\"%d\"", table[index].physical_offset );
 1241: 		fprintf( out, "\n\r" ); 
 1242: 		index++;
 1243: 	} while ( table[index].direction != REG_DIR_NONE );
 1244: 
 1245: 	return SUCCESS;
 1246: }
 1247: 
 1257: int Register_Report_CSV( int board_id, FILE * out )
 1258: {
 1259: 	switch ( board_id )
 1260: 	{
 1261: 		case ID_IDI48:	return IDI_Register_Report_CSV( ((const struct idi_reg_definition *) board_definition[board_id].definition), out );
 1262: 		case ID_IDO48:	return IDO_Register_Report_CSV( ((const struct ido_reg_definition *) board_definition[board_id].definition), out );
 1263: 	}
 1264: 	return -EC_BOARD;
 1265: }
 1266: 
 1267: 
 1270: static int Register_Acronym_To_Row( int board_id, const char * acronym, int * row )
 1271: {
 1272: 	int   index;
 1273: 	const struct reg_definition * definition = (const struct reg_definition *) board_definition[board_id].definition;
 1274: 
 1275: 	index =  0;
 1276: 	while ( definition[index].direction != REG_DIR_NONE )
 1277: 	{
 1278: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( definition[index].acronym, acronym )  )
 1279: 		{
 1280: 			*row = index;
 1281: 			return SUCCESS;
 1282: 		}
 1283: 		index++;
 1284: 	}
 1285: 	return  -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 1286: }
 1287: 
 1288: 
 1289: 
 1290: 
 1291: 
 1292: 
 1293: 
 1294: 
 1302: BOOL String_To_Bool( const char * str )
 1303: {
 1304: 	switch( str[0] )
 1305: 	{
 1306: 	case '0':
 1307: 	case 'f':
 1308: 	case 'F':
 1309: 		return false;
 1310: 	case '1':
 1311: 	case 't':
 1312: 	case 'T':
 1313: 		return true;
 1314: 	}
 1315: 	return false;
 1316: }
 1317: 
 1330: enum { HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE = 16 };
 1331: 
 1332: int Hex_Dump_Line( uint16_t address, size_t count, uint8_t * buffer, FILE * out )
 1333: {
 1334: 	size_t 	index;
 1335: 	char 	str_temp[8];
 1336: 	char    str_ascii[20];
 1337: 	char  	str_hex_list[64];
 1338: 
 1339: 	
 1340: 	if ( count > HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE ) return -EC_HEX_DUMP_COUNT;
 1341: 
 1342: 	sprintf( str_hex_list, "%04X: ", ((int) address) );
 1343: 	strcpy( str_ascii,    "" );
 1344: 	for ( index = 0; index < count; index++ )
 1345: 	{ 	
 1346: 		sprintf( str_temp, "%02X", buffer[index] );
 1347: 		strcat( str_hex_list, str_temp );
 1348: 		
 1349: 		if ( 0x07 == ( index & 0x07 ) ) strcat( str_hex_list, "  " );
 1350: 		
 1351: 		strcat( str_hex_list, " " );
 1352: 		
 1353: 		if ( ( buffer[index] < ' ' ) || ( buffer[index] > '~' ) )
 1354: 		{ 
 1355: 			strcat( str_ascii, "." );
 1356: 		}
 1357: 		else
 1358: 		{ 
 1359: 			sprintf( str_temp, "%c", buffer[index] );
 1360: 			strcat( str_ascii, str_temp );
 1361: 		}
 1362: 	}
 1363: 	
 1364: 	index = strlen( str_hex_list );
 1365: 	
 1366: 	count = 60 - index;
 1367: 	while ( count > 0 )
 1368: 	{ 
 1369: 		strcat( str_hex_list, " " );
 1370: 		count--;
 1371: 	}
 1372: 	
 1373: 	fprintf( out, "%s%s\n", str_hex_list, str_ascii );
 1374: 	return SUCCESS;
 1375: }
 1376: 
 1387: static const char ec_unknown[] = "unknown error code";
 1388: 
 1389: const char * EC_Code_To_Human_Readable( EC_ENUM error_code )
 1390: {
 1391: 	int index;
 1392: 
 1393: 	if ( error_code < 0 ) error_code = -error_code;
 1394: 
 1395: 	index = 0;
 1396: 	while( NULL != ec_human_readable[index].message )
 1397: 	{
 1398: 		if ( ((EC_ENUM) error_code) == ec_human_readable[index].error_code )
 1399: 		{
 1400: 			return ec_human_readable[index].message;
 1401: 		}
 1402: 		index++;
 1403: 	}
 1404: 	return ec_unknown;
 1405: }
 1406: 
 1418: BOOL Character_Get( int * character )
 1419: {
 1420: 	int  char_temp;
 1421: 	BOOL result = false;
 1422: #ifdef __BORLANDC__
 1423: 	if ( kbhit() )
 1424: 	{
 1425: 		char_temp = getch();
 1426: 		result    = true;
 1427: 	}
 1428: 	else
 1429: 	{
 1430: 		char_temp = '\0';
 1431: 	}
 1432: #else
 1433: 	char_temp = '\0';
 1434: 	result    = false;
 1435: #endif
 1436: 	if ( NULL != character ) *character = char_temp;
 1437: 	return result;
 1438: }
 1439: 
 1451: int Time_Current_String( char * buf, size_t buf_size )
 1452: {
 1453: 	struct tm * time_block;
 1454: 	time_t		time_current;
 1455: 	char *      time_ascii;
 1456: 	size_t		index;
 1457: 
 1458: 	time_current = time( NULL );
 1459: 	
 1460: 	time_block   = localtime( &time_current );
 1461: 	
 1465: 	time_ascii = asctime( time_block );
 1466: 	index = 0;
 1467: 	
 1468: 	while( ( time_ascii[index] != '\n' ) && ( index < buf_size ) )
 1469: 	{
 1470: 		buf[index] = time_ascii[index];
 1471: 		index++;
 1472: 	}
 1473: 	if ( index >= buf_size ) index = buf_size - 1;
 1474: 	buf[index] = '\0';
 1475: 	return SUCCESS;
 1476: }
 1477: 
 1480: static int Print_Multiple( char * message, FILE * out )
 1481: {
 1482: 	int error_code;
 1483: 
 1484: 	error_code = fprintf( stdout, message );
 1485: 	if ( out != stdout )
 1486: 	{ 
 1487: 		error_code = fprintf( out, message );
 1488: 	}
 1489: 	return error_code;
 1490: }
 1491: 
 1492: 
 1493: 
 1494: 
 1495: 
 1496: 
 1497: 
 1498: 
 1499: 
 1503: int IO_Trace_Initialize( int board_id )
 1504: {
 1505: 	size_t					index;
 1506: 	struct io_trace *	 	trace;
 1507: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 1508: 	dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 1509: 
 1510: 	dataset->trace.begin	= 0;
 1511: 	dataset->trace.end		= IO_TRACE_SIZE - 1;
 1512: 	dataset->trace.index	= 0;
 1513: 	dataset->trace.count	= 0;
 1514: 	dataset->trace.wrap		= false;
 1515: 	dataset->trace.posting  = 0;
 1516: 
 1517: 	if ( IO_TRACE_START_ON == dataset->trace.start ) dataset->trace.active = true;
 1518: 	else                                             dataset->trace.active = false;
 1519: 
 1520: 	dataset->trace.buf = &(global_io_trace_buf[0]);
 1521: 
 1522: 	for ( index = 0; index < IO_TRACE_SIZE; index++ )
 1523: 	{
 1524: 		trace = &(dataset->trace.buf[index]);
 1525: 		memset( trace, 0, sizeof( struct io_trace ) );
 1526: 		dataset->trace.buf[index].action 		= IO_TRACE_NULL;
 1527: 		dataset->trace.buf[index].function_name = NULL;
 1528: 		dataset->trace.buf[index].board_id 		= ID_BOARD_UNKNOWN;
 1529: 	}
 1530: 
 1531: 	if ( strlen(dataset->trace.filename) == 0 )
 1532: 	{
 1533: 		strcpy( dataset->trace.filename, IO_TRACE_DUMP_FILE_NAME );
 1534: 	}
 1535: 	return SUCCESS;
 1536: }
 1537: 
 1538: 
 1539: 
 1543: static int IO_Trace_Log_Dataset_Begin( struct board_dataset * ds, size_t line, enum IO_TRACE_ENUM action, int location, int error_code, uint8_t value )
 1544: {
 1545: 	(void) line;
 1546: 	(void) location;
 1547: 	(void) value;
 1548: 
 1549: 	if ( false == global_io_trace_enable ) return 1; 
 1550: 
 1551: 	
 1552: 	switch( ds->trace.start )
 1553: 	{
 1554: 		IO_TRACE_START_DEFINITION( IO_TRACE_START_STOP_EXTRACT_SWITCH_STATEMENT )
 1555: 	}
 1556: 
 1557: 	if ( false == ds->trace.active ) return 2;  
 1558: 
 1559: 	
 1560: 	if ( false == ds->trace.wrap ) ds->trace.count++;
 1561: 
 1562: 	if ( ds->trace.index >= ds->trace.end )
 1563: 	{
 1564: 		ds->trace.index = ds->trace.begin;
 1565: 		ds->trace.wrap  = true;
 1566: 	}
 1567: 	else
 1568: 	{
 1569: 		ds->trace.index++;
 1570: 	}
 1571: 	return 0;
 1572: }
 1573: 
 1577: static int IO_Trace_Log_Dataset_End( struct board_dataset * ds, size_t line, enum IO_TRACE_ENUM action, int location, int error_code, uint8_t value )
 1578: {
 1579: 	(void) line;
 1580: 	(void) action;
 1581: 	(void) location;
 1582: 	(void) value;
 1583: 
 1584: 	
 1585: 	switch( ds->trace.stop )
 1586: 	{
 1587: 		IO_TRACE_STOP_DEFINITION( IO_TRACE_START_STOP_EXTRACT_SWITCH_STATEMENT )
 1588: 	}
 1589: 	return SUCCESS;
 1590: }
 1591: 
 1595: int IO_Trace_Log_Dataset( struct board_dataset * ds, size_t line, enum IO_TRACE_ENUM action, int location, int error_code, uint8_t value )
 1596: {
 1597: 	struct io_trace * trace;
 1598: 
 1599: 	if ( 0 != IO_Trace_Log_Dataset_Begin( ds, line, action, location, error_code, value ) ) return SUCCESS;  
 1600: 
 1601: 
 1602: 
 1603: 
 1604: 
 1605: 
 1606: 
 1607: 
 1608: 
 1609: 
 1610: 
 1611: 
 1612: 
 1613: 
 1614: 
 1615: 
 1616: 
 1617: 
 1618: 
 1619: 
 1620: 
 1621: 
 1622: 
 1623: 
 1624: 
 1625: 	trace = &(ds->trace.buf[ds->trace.index]);
 1626: 	trace->action  		= action;
 1627: 	trace->board_id		= ds->board_id;
 1628: 	trace->location		= location;
 1629: 	trace->error_code 	= error_code;
 1630: 	trace->value		= value;
 1631: 	trace->posting		= ds->trace.posting;
 1632: 	trace->line			= line;
 1633: 	ds->trace.posting++;
 1634: 
 1635: 	IO_Trace_Log_Dataset_End( ds, line, action, location, error_code, value  );
 1636: 
 1637: 
 1638: 
 1639: 
 1640: 
 1641: 
 1642: 
 1643: 	return SUCCESS;
 1644: }
 1645: 
 1649: int IO_Trace_Log( int board_id, size_t line, enum IO_TRACE_ENUM action, int location, int error_code, uint8_t value )
 1650: {
 1651: 	int ec; 
 1652: 	if ( true == global_io_trace_enable )
 1653: 	{
 1654: 		struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 1655: 		dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 1656: 
 1657: 		ec = IO_Trace_Log_Dataset( dataset, line, action, location, error_code, value );
 1658: 	}
 1659: 	else
 1660: 	{
 1661: 		ec = SUCCESS;
 1662: 	}
 1663: 	return ec;
 1664: }
 1665: 
 1669: int IO_Trace_Log_Function( const char * function_name, size_t line, enum IO_TRACE_ENUM action, int board_id, int error_code )
 1670: {
 1671: 	int ec; 
 1672: 	if ( true == global_io_trace_enable )
 1673: 	{
 1674: 		struct io_trace * 		trace;
 1675: 		struct board_dataset *  ds;
 1676: 		ds = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 1677: 
 1678: 		if ( 0 != IO_Trace_Log_Dataset_Begin( ds, line, action, 0, error_code, 0  ) ) return SUCCESS; 
 1679: 
 1680: 		trace = &(ds->trace.buf[ds->trace.index]);
 1681: 		trace->action  		 = action;
 1682: 		trace->board_id		 = ds->board_id;
 1683: 		trace->location		 = 0;
 1684: 		trace->error_code 	 = error_code;
 1685: 		trace->value		 = 0;
 1686: 		trace->posting		 = ds->trace.posting;
 1687: 		trace->line			 = line;
 1688: 		trace->function_name = function_name;
 1689: 		ds->trace.posting++;
 1690: 
 1691: 		IO_Trace_Log_Dataset_End( ds, line, action, 0, error_code, 0  );
 1692: 	}
 1693: 	else
 1694: 	{
 1695: 		ec = SUCCESS;
 1696: 	}
 1697: 	return ec;
 1698: }
 1699: 
 1704: int IO_Trace_Dump( int board_id )
 1705: {
 1706: 	int						error_code;
 1707: 	FILE *					out;
 1708: 	size_t					count, index, row;
 1709: 	struct io_trace *  		trace;
 1710: 	struct reg_definition * definition = ( struct reg_definition * ) board_definition[board_id].definition;
 1711: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset    = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 1712: 
 1713: 	if ( false == global_io_trace_enable ) return SUCCESS;
 1714: 
 1715: 	if ( strlen(dataset->trace.filename) == 0 ) out = fopen( IO_TRACE_DUMP_FILE_NAME, "wt" );
 1716: 	else										out = fopen( dataset->trace.filename, "wt" );
 1717: 
 1718: 	error_code = -EC_FILE_ERROR; 
 1719: 	if ( NULL == out ) return error_code;
 1720: 	else               error_code = SUCCESS;
 1721: 
 1722: 	index = dataset->trace.index;
 1723: 	
 1724: 	
 1725: 	
 1726: 	count = dataset->trace.count;
 1727: 
 1728: 	
 1729: 	
 1730: 
 1731: 	
 1732: 	{
 1733: 		char buf[64]={ 0 };
 1734: 		Time_Current_String( buf, 64 );
 1735: 		fprintf( out, "%s\n", buf );
 1736: 	}
 1737: 	fprintf( out, "trace.start        = " );
 1738: 	fprintf( out, "%s\n", global_io_trace_start_name[dataset->trace.start] );
 1739: 	fprintf( out, "trace.stop         = " );
 1740: 	fprintf( out, "%s\n", global_io_trace_stop_name[dataset->trace.stop] );
 1741: 	fprintf( out, "trace.file_name    = " );
 1742: 	if ( 0 == strlen( dataset->trace.filename ) ) fprintf( out, "%s\n", IO_TRACE_DUMP_FILE_NAME );
 1743: 	else                                          fprintf( out, "%s\n", dataset->trace.filename );
 1744: 
 1745: 
 1746: 	
 1747: 	fprintf( out, "\"row\"" );
 1748:     fprintf( out, ", \"posting\"" );
 1749:     fprintf( out, ", \"board\"" );
 1750:     fprintf( out, ", \"action\"" );
 1751:     fprintf( out, ", \"src_line\"" );
 1752:     fprintf( out, ", \"register_or_function\"" );
 1753:     fprintf( out, ", \"channel\"" );
 1754:     fprintf( out, ", \"error\"" );
 1755:     fprintf( out, ",\"value\"" );
 1756:     fprintf( out, "\n" );
 1757: 	
 1758: 	row = 0;
 1759: 	while ( count > 0 )
 1760: 	{
 1761: 		trace = &(dataset->trace.buf[index]);
 1762: 
 1763: 		
 1764: 		fprintf( out, "%3u", (unsigned) row );
 1765: 
 1766: 		
 1767: 		fprintf( out, ", %6u", (unsigned) trace->posting );
 1768: 
 1769: 		
 1770: 		
 1771: 		fprintf( out, ", " );
 1772: 		switch( trace->board_id )
 1773: 		{
 1774: 			case ID_IDI48:	fprintf( out, "\"IDI48\"" );	break;
 1775: 			case ID_IDO48:	fprintf( out, "\"IDO48\"" );	break;
 1776: 			case ID_IAI16:	fprintf( out, "\"IAI16\"" );	break;
 1777: 			case ID_ARM32:	fprintf( out, "\"ARM32\"" );	break;
 1778: 		}
 1779: 		
 1780: 		fprintf( out, ", " );
 1781: 		fprintf( out, "\"%s\"", global_io_trace_name[trace->action] );
 1782: 
 1783: 		
 1784: 		fprintf( out, ", %6u", (unsigned) trace->line );
 1785: 
 1786: 		
 1787: 		switch( trace->action )
 1788: 		{
 1789: 			case IO_TRACE_READ:
 1790: 			case IO_TRACE_WRITE:
 1791: 				fprintf( out, ", \"reg: %s\"", definition[REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET(trace->location) + REG_LOCATION_CHANNEL_GET( trace->location )].symbol_name );
 1792: 				break;
 1793: 			default:
 1794: 				if ( NULL != trace->function_name )
 1795: 				{
 1796: 				fprintf( out, ", \"fnc: %s\"", trace->function_name );
 1797: 				}
 1798: 				break;
 1799: 		}
 1800: 
 1801: 		
 1802: 		fprintf( out, ", %d", REG_LOCATION_CHANNEL_GET( trace->location ) );
 1803: 		
 1804: 		fprintf( out, ", \"%s\"", EC_Code_To_Human_Readable( trace->error_code ) );
 1805: 		
 1806: 		fprintf( out, ", 0x%02X", (int) trace->value );
 1807: 		
 1808: 		fprintf( out, "\n" );
 1809: 
 1810: 		
 1811: 		if ( index == dataset->trace.begin )
 1812: 		{
 1813: 			index = dataset->trace.end;
 1814: 		}
 1815: 		else
 1816: 		{
 1817: 			index--;
 1818: 		}
 1819: 		count--;
 1820: 		row++;
 1821: 	}
 1822: 
 1823: 	fclose( out );
 1824: 	return error_code;
 1825: }
 1826: 
 1831: #define IDI_IO_DIRECTION_TEST   1
 1832: 
 1833: #if(0)
 1834: 
 1843: static char * IO_Get_Symbol_Name( IDI_REG_ENUM location )
 1844: {
 1845: 	int index;
 1846: 	index = REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET( location );
 1847: 	return idi_definitionsions[index].symbol_name;
 1848: }
 1849: 
 1860: #if defined( IDI_IO_DIRECTION_TEST )
 1861: static BOOL IO_Direction_IsNotValid( IDI_REG_ENUM location, REG_DIR_ENUM direction )
 1862: {
 1863: 	int index;
 1864: 	index = REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET( location );
 1865: 	if ( direction == (idi_definitions[index].direction & direction) ) return false;
 1866: 	return true;
 1867: }
 1868: #endif
 1869: #endif
 1870: 
 1871: 
 1872: 
 1875: static int IO_Write_U8_Port( struct board_dataset * dataset, size_t line, int address, uint8_t value )
 1876: {
 1877: 	if ( NULL == dataset )
 1878: 	{
 1879: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 1880: 			outportb( address, value );
 1881: #else
 1882: 			printf( "IO_Write_U8_Port: address = 0x%04X, value = 0x%02X\n", address, value );
 1883: #endif
 1884: 	}
 1885: 	else
 1886: 	{
 1887: 		if ( !dataset->io_simulate )
 1888: 		{
 1889: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 1890: 			outportb( address, value );
 1891: #endif
 1892: 		}
 1893: 		if ( ( dataset->io_report ) || ( dataset->io_simulate ) )
 1894: 		{
 1895: 		printf( "IO_Write_U8_Port: address = 0x%04X, value = 0x%02X\n", address, value );
 1896: 		}
 1897: 	}
 1898: 	return SUCCESS;
 1899: }
 1900: 
 1903: static int IO_Read_U8_Port( struct board_dataset * dataset, size_t line, int address,  uint8_t * value )
 1904: {
 1905: 	if ( NULL == dataset )
 1906: 	{
 1907: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 1908: 			*value = inportb( address );
 1909: #else
 1910: 		printf( "IO_Read_U8_Port: address = 0x%04X, value=unknown\n", address );
 1911: #endif
 1912: 	}
 1913: 	else
 1914: 	{
 1915: 		if ( !dataset->io_simulate )
 1916: 		{
 1917: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 1918: 			*value = inportb( address );
 1919: #endif
 1920: 		}
 1921: 		if ( ( dataset->io_report ) || ( dataset->io_simulate ) )
 1922: 		{
 1923: 		printf( "IO_Read_U8_Port: address = 0x%04X, ", address );
 1924: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 1925: 		printf( "value = 0x%02X\n", *value );
 1926: #else
 1927: 		printf( "value = unknown\n" );
 1928: #endif
 1929: 		}
 1930: 	}
 1931: 	return SUCCESS;
 1932: }
 1933: 
 1934: 
 1947: int IO_Write_U8( int board_id, size_t line, int location, uint8_t value )
 1948: {
 1949: 	int error_code;
 1950: 	int index;
 1951: 	int offset;
 1952: 	int channel;
 1953: 	int	address;
 1954: 	int	bank;
 1955: 
 1956: 	struct reg_definition * definition = ( struct reg_definition * ) board_definition[board_id].definition;
 1957: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset    = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 1958: 
 1959: 	error_code = SUCCESS;
 1960: 	index   = REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET( location );
 1961: #if defined( IDI_IO_DIRECTION_TEST )
 1962: 	if ( !( REG_DIR_WRITE == ( definition[index].direction & REG_DIR_WRITE ) ) )
 1963: 	{
 1964: 		printf( "IO_Write_U8: %s, error in direction\n", definition[index].symbol_name );
 1965: 		error_code = -EC_DIRECTION;
 1966: 		goto IO_Write_U8_Exit;
 1967: 	}
 1968: #endif
 1969:     bank   = definition[index].bank;
 1970: 	if ( ( BANK_NONE != bank ) && ( bank != dataset->bank_previous ) )
 1971: 	{   
 1972: 		address = dataset->base_address + definition[REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET( board_definition[board_id].bank_register_symbol )].physical_offset;
 1973: 		dataset->bank_previous = bank;
 1974: 		IO_Write_U8_Port( dataset, __LINE__, address, (uint8_t) bank );
 1975: 		IO_Trace_Log( board_id, line, IO_TRACE_WRITE, board_definition[board_id].bank_register_symbol, error_code, (uint8_t) bank );
 1976: 		if ( ( dataset->io_report ) || ( dataset->io_simulate ) )
 1977: 		{
 1978: 		printf( "IO_Write_U8 bank write: %s, address = 0x%04X, bank = %s (0x%02X)\n", 	definition[index].symbol_name,
 1979: 																		    		address,
 1980: 																		    		Bank_Symbol_To_Name( board_id, bank ),
 1981: 																		    		bank
 1982: 			  );
 1983: 		}
 1984: 	}
 1985: 	channel = REG_LOCATION_CHANNEL_GET( location );
 1986: 	offset  = definition[index].physical_offset;
 1987: 	address = dataset->base_address + offset + channel;
 1988: 	IO_Write_U8_Port( dataset, __LINE__, address, value );
 1989: IO_Write_U8_Exit:
 1990: 	IO_Trace_Log( board_id, line, IO_TRACE_WRITE, location, error_code, value );
 1991: 	return SUCCESS;
 1992: }
 1993: 
 1994: 
 2006: int IO_Read_U8( int board_id, size_t line, int location,  uint8_t * value )
 2007: {
 2008: 	int error_code;
 2009: 	int index;
 2010: 	int offset;
 2011: 	int	channel;
 2012: 	int address;
 2013: 	int	bank;
 2014: 
 2015: 	struct reg_definition * definition = ( struct reg_definition * ) board_definition[board_id].definition;
 2016: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset    = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 2017: 
 2018: 	error_code = SUCCESS;
 2019: 	index   = REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET( location );
 2020: #if defined( IDI_IO_DIRECTION_TEST )
 2021: 	if ( !( REG_DIR_READ == ( definition[index].direction & REG_DIR_READ ) ) )
 2022: 	{
 2023: 		printf( "IO_Read_U8: %s, error in direction\n", definition[index].symbol_name );
 2024: 		error_code = -EC_DIRECTION;
 2025: 		goto IO_Read_U8_Exit;
 2026: 	}
 2027: #endif
 2028: 	bank   = definition[index].bank;
 2029: 	if ( ( BANK_NONE != bank ) && ( bank != dataset->bank_previous ) )
 2030: 	{   
 2031: 		address = dataset->base_address + definition[REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET( board_definition[board_id].bank_register_symbol )].physical_offset;
 2032: 		dataset->bank_previous = bank;
 2033: 		IO_Write_U8_Port(  dataset, __LINE__, address, (uint8_t) bank );
 2034: 		IO_Trace_Log( board_id, line, IO_TRACE_READ, board_definition[board_id].bank_register_symbol, error_code, (uint8_t) bank );
 2035: 		if ( ( dataset->io_report ) || ( dataset->io_simulate ) )
 2036: 		{
 2037: 		printf( "IO_Read_U8 bank write: %s, address = 0x%04X, bank = %s (0x%02X)\n", 	definition[index].symbol_name,
 2038: 																		    	address,
 2039: 																		    	Bank_Symbol_To_Name( board_id, bank ),
 2040: 																		    	bank
 2041: 			  );
 2042: 		}
 2043: 	}
 2044: 	channel = REG_LOCATION_CHANNEL_GET( location );
 2045: 	offset  = definition[index].physical_offset;
 2046: 	address = dataset->base_address + offset + channel;
 2047: 	IO_Read_U8_Port( dataset, __LINE__, address, value );
 2048: IO_Read_U8_Exit:
 2049: 	IO_Trace_Log( board_id, line, IO_TRACE_READ, location, error_code, *value );
 2050: 	return SUCCESS;
 2051: }
 2052: 
 2067: void IO_Write_U16_Address_Increment( int board_id, size_t line, int location, uint16_t value )
 2068: {
 2069: 
 2070: 
 2071: 
 2072: 	IO_Write_U8( board_id, line, (int)(((int) location) + 0 ), (uint8_t)(   value        & 0xFF ) );
 2073: 	IO_Write_U8( board_id, line, (int)(((int) location) + 1 ), (uint8_t)( ( value >> 8 ) & 0xFF ) );
 2074: }
 2075: 
 2090: void IO_Read_U16_Address_Increment( int board_id, size_t line, int location,  uint16_t * value )
 2091: {
 2092: 
 2093: 	uint8_t lsb, msb;
 2094: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, line, (int)(((int) location) + 0 ), &lsb );
 2095: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, line, (int)(((int) location) + 1 ), &msb );
 2096: 	*value = ( ((uint16_t) msb) << 8 ) | ( ((uint16_t) lsb) & 0xFF );
 2097: }
 2098: 
 2113: void IO_Write_U16_Address_Fixed( int board_id, size_t line, int location, uint16_t value )
 2114: {
 2115: 
 2116: 	IO_Write_U8( board_id, line, (int)(((int) location) + 0), (uint8_t)(     value      & 0xFF ) );
 2117: 	IO_Write_U8( board_id, line, (int)(((int) location) + 0), (uint8_t)( ( value >> 8 ) & 0xFF ) );
 2118: }
 2119: 
 2134: void IO_Read_U16_Address_Fixed( int board_id, size_t line, int location,  uint16_t * value )
 2135: {
 2136: 
 2137: 	uint8_t lsb, msb;
 2138: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, line, (int)(((int) location) + 0), &lsb );
 2139: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, line, (int)(((int) location) + 0), &msb );
 2140: 	*value = ( ((uint16_t) msb) << 8 ) | ( ((uint16_t) lsb) & 0xFF );
 2141: }
 2142: 
 2143: 
 2144: 
 2145: 
 2146: 
 2147: 
 2148: 
 2157: 
 2158: 
 2159: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 2160: 
 2161: #include <limits.h>   
 2162: 
 2163: #define TARGET_CPU_INTEL_386 1
 2164: 
 2165: 
 2166: 
 2169: #define IOKERN_DOS_PIC1_BASE_ADDRESS	0x20
 2170: #define IOKERN_DOS_PIC2_BASE_ADDRESS	0xA0
 2171: #define IOKERN_DOS_PIC1_CMD             IOKERN_DOS_PIC1_BASE_ADDRESS			
 2172: #define IOKERN_DOS_PIC1_IMR             ( IOKERN_DOS_PIC1_BASE_ADDRESS + 1 )	
 2173: #define IOKERN_DOS_PIC2_CMD             IOKERN_DOS_PIC2_BASE_ADDRESS			
 2174: #define IOKERN_DOS_PIC2_IMR             ( IOKERN_DOS_PIC2_BASE_ADDRESS + 1 )	
 2175: 
 2176: 
 2178: #define IOKERN_DOS_NSEOI           0x20   
 2179: 
 2180: 
 2181: #define IOKERN_IRQ_START  disable()
 2182: #define IOKERN_IRQ_ENABLE enable()
 2183: #define IOKERN_IRQ_END(irq) IOKern_PIC_EOI( irq ); enable()
 2184: 
 2185: #if defined( TARGET_CPU_INTEL_186 )
 2186: # pragma message "TARGET_CPU_INTEL_186 for interrupt chaining"
 2187: 
 2188: struct pt_regs
 2189: {
 2190: 	uint16_t bp;
 2191: 	uint16_t di;
 2192: 	uint16_t si;
 2193: 	uint16_t ds;
 2194: 	uint16_t es;
 2195: 	uint16_t dx;
 2196: 	uint16_t cx;
 2197: 	uint16_t bx;
 2198: 	uint16_t ax;
 2199: 	uint16_t ip;
 2200: 	uint16_t cs;
 2201: 	uint16_t flags;
 2202: };
 2203: 
 2204: 
 2205: # define IOKERN_IRQ_CHAIN_SELECT(old_fp,regs)		\
 2206: 		_BX  =   regs.bx;    						\
 2207: 		_CX  =   regs.ax;     						\
 2208: 		regs.ax  =   FP_SEG((void far *)old_fp);	\
 2209: 		regs.bx  =   FP_OFF((void far *)old_fp);	\
 2210: 		_AX  =  _CX  ;								\
 2211: 		__emit__(0x5D);								\
 2212: 		__emit__(0x5F);								\
 2213: 		__emit__(0x5E); 							\
 2214: 		__emit__(0x1F); 							\
 2215: 		__emit__(0x07);  							\
 2216: 		__emit__(0x5A); 							\
 2217: 		__emit__(0x59); 							\
 2218: 		__emit__(0xCB);
 2219: 
 2220: #elif defined( TARGET_CPU_INTEL_386 )
 2221: # pragma message "TARGET_CPU_INTEL_386 for interrupt chaining"
 2222: 
 2223: struct pt_regs
 2224: {
 2225: 	uint16_t bp;
 2226: 	union { uint32_t edi; uint16_t di; };
 2227: 	union { uint32_t esi; uint16_t si; };
 2228: 	uint16_t ds;
 2229: 	uint16_t es;
 2230: 	union { uint32_t edx; uint16_t dx; struct { uint8_t l, h; } d; };
 2231: 	union { uint32_t ecx; uint16_t cx; struct { uint8_t l, h; } c; };
 2232: 		union { uint32_t ebx; uint16_t bx; struct { uint8_t l, h; } b; };
 2233: 	
 2234: 	union { uint32_t eax; uint16_t ax; struct { uint16_t l, h; } aw; struct { uint8_t l, h; } a; };
 2235: 	uint16_t ip;
 2236: 	uint16_t cs;
 2237: 	uint16_t flags;
 2238: };
 2239: 
 2240: # define IOKERN_IRQ_CHAIN_SELECT(old_fp,regs)	\
 2241: 	_ECX  =   regs.eax;							\
 2242: 	regs.aw.h  = FP_SEG((void far *)old_fp);	\
 2243: 	regs.aw.l  = FP_OFF((void far *)old_fp);	\
 2244: 	_EAX  =  _ECX ;								\
 2245: 	__emit__(0x5D);								\
 2246: 	__emit__(0x66);  __emit__(0x5F);			\
 2247: 	__emit__(0x66);  __emit__(0x5E);			\
 2248: 	__emit__(0x1F);								\
 2249: 	__emit__(0x07);								\
 2250: 	__emit__(0x66);  __emit__(0x5A);			\
 2251: 	__emit__(0x66);  __emit__(0x59);			\
 2252: 	__emit__(0x66);  __emit__(0x5B);			\
 2253: 	__emit__(0xCB);
 2254: #endif
 2255: 
 2256: #define INTERRUPT interrupt
 2257: typedef void INTERRUPT ( * IOKERN_ISR_FP )( struct pt_regs r );
 2258: 
 2259: 
 2260: 
 2261: #define IOKERN_LOCAL_IRQ_SAVE(flags)	\
 2262: 	do {								\
 2263: 			asm push bx				;	\
 2264: 			asm pushf				;	\
 2265: 			asm pop bx				;	\
 2266: 			asm mov [flags], bx		;	\
 2267: 			asm cli					;	\
 2268: 			asm pop bx				;	\
 2269: 	} while(0)
 2270: 
 2271: #define IOKERN_LOCAL_IRQ_RESTORE(flags)	\
 2272: 	do {								\
 2273: 			asm push bx				;	\
 2274: 			asm mov bx, [flags]		;	\
 2275: 			asm push bx				;	\
 2276: 			asm popf				;	\
 2277: 			asm pop bx				;	\
 2278: 	} while(0)
 2279: 
 2280: 
 2281: typedef enum
 2282: {
 2283: 	IOKERN_IRQ_NONE			= UINT_MAX,
 2284: 	
 2285: 	IOKERN_IRQ_0			=  0, 
 2286: 	IOKERN_IRQ_1			=  1, 
 2287: 	IOKERN_IRQ_2			=  2, 
 2288: 	IOKERN_IRQ_3			=  3, 
 2289: 	IOKERN_IRQ_4			=  4, 
 2290: 	IOKERN_IRQ_5			=  5, 
 2291: 	IOKERN_IRQ_6			=  6, 
 2292: 	IOKERN_IRQ_7			=  7, 
 2293: 	IOKERN_IRQ_8			=  8, 
 2294: 	IOKERN_IRQ_9			=  9,
 2295: 	IOKERN_IRQ_10			= 10, 
 2296: 	IOKERN_IRQ_11			= 11, 
 2297: 	IOKERN_IRQ_12			= 12, 
 2298: 	IOKERN_IRQ_13			= 13, 
 2299: 	IOKERN_IRQ_14			= 14, 
 2300: 	IOKERN_IRQ_15			= 15, 
 2301: 	
 2302: 	IOKERN_INT_33			= 0x33
 2303: } IOKERN_IRQ_ENUM;
 2304: 
 2305: typedef enum
 2306: {
 2307: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_NONE			= -1,
 2308: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ0			=  0,
 2309: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ1			=  1,
 2310: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ2			=  2,
 2311: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ3			=  3,
 2312: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ4			=  4,
 2313: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ5			=  5,
 2314: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ6			=  6,
 2315: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ7			=  7,
 2316: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ8			=  8,
 2317: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ9			=  9,
 2318: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ10		= 10,
 2319: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ11		= 11,
 2320: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ12		= 12,
 2321: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ13		= 13,
 2322: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ14		= 14,
 2323: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ15		= 15,
 2324: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_INT33		= 16  
 2325: } IOKERN_TASK_ID_ENUM;
 2326: 
 2327: 
 2328: typedef enum
 2329: {
 2330: 	IOKERN_CHAIN_TO_OLD_OFF		= 0,    
 2331: 	IOKERN_CHAIN_TO_OLD_TIMER	= 1,	
 2335: 	IOKERN_CHAIN_TO_OLD_NORMAL  = 2		
 2336: } IOKERN_CHAIN_TO_OLD_ENUM;
 2337: 
 2338: 
 2339: 
 2345: 
 2351: enum irqreturn {
 2352: 	IRQ_NONE,
 2353: 	IRQ_HANDLED,
 2354: 	IRQ_WAKE_THREAD,
 2355: };
 2356: 
 2357: typedef enum irqreturn irqreturn_t;
 2358: 
 2359: 
 2360: typedef irqreturn_t ( * IOKERN_TASK_FP )( int irq, void * dev_id, struct pt_regs * regs );
 2361: typedef void        ( * IOKERN_HELP_FP )( IOKERN_TASK_ID_ENUM id, IOKERN_IRQ_ENUM irq, struct pt_regs * regs );
 2362: 
 2363: 
 2364: typedef struct IOKERN_TASK_TYPE
 2365: {
 2366: 	
 2367: 	IOKERN_TASK_FP	task_fp;		
 2368: 	IOKERN_HELP_FP	help_fp;		
 2369: 	void *			dev_id;			
 2370: 	const char *	name;			
 2371: 	size_t			speed;			
 2372: 	IOKERN_CHAIN_TO_OLD_ENUM chain_to_old;	
 2373: 	unsigned int	number;			
 2374: 	size_t			sw_int;			
 2375: 	irqreturn_t		result;			
 2376: 	unsigned long	count;			
 2377: 	IOKERN_ISR_FP	old_isr;		
 2378: 	unsigned char	old_state;		
 2379: } IOKERN_TASK_TYPE;
 2380: 
 2381: 
 2383: static void IOKern_DOS_IRQ_Mask_Set( unsigned char irq, unsigned char state  )
 2384: {
 2385: 	unsigned int  port;
 2386: 	unsigned char value;
 2387: 
 2388: 	port = IOKERN_DOS_PIC1_IMR;
 2389: 	if ( irq >= 8 )
 2390: 	{
 2391: 		
 2392: 		if ( state ) value = inp( port ) |  ( 1 << 2 ); 
 2393: 		else         value = inp( port ) & ~( 1 << 2 ); 
 2394: 		outp( port, value );
 2395: 
 2396: 		irq = irq - 8;
 2397: 		port = IOKERN_DOS_PIC2_IMR;
 2398: 	}
 2399: 	if ( state ) value = inp( port ) |  ( 1 << irq ); 
 2400: 	else         value = inp( port ) & ~( 1 << irq ); 
 2401: 	outp( port, value );
 2402: }
 2403: 
 2405: static void IOKern_DOS_IRQ_Mask_Get( unsigned char irq, unsigned char * state )
 2406: {
 2407: 	unsigned int  port;
 2408: 	unsigned char value;
 2409: 	if ( irq < 8 )
 2410: 	{
 2411: 		port = IOKERN_DOS_PIC1_IMR;
 2412: 	}
 2413: 	else
 2414: 	{
 2415: 		irq = irq - 8;
 2416: 		port = IOKERN_DOS_PIC2_IMR;
 2417: 	}
 2418: 	value = inp( port ) & ( 1 << irq );
 2419: 	*state = value;
 2420: }
 2421: 
 2422: 
 2424: typedef void interrupt (* IOKERN_DOS_VECTOR_TYPE )();
 2425: 
 2426: 
 2428: IOKERN_DOS_VECTOR_TYPE IOKern_DOS_Vector_Get( unsigned num )
 2429: {
 2430: 	asm push es
 2431: 	asm push bx
 2432: 
 2433: 	asm	xor bx,bx
 2434: 	asm	mov es,bx
 2435: 	asm	mov bx,[num]
 2436: 
 2437: 	asm	shl bx,1
 2438: 	asm	shl bx,1
 2439: 
 2442: 	asm	les bx,es:[bx]
 2443: 
 2444: 	asm	mov dx,es
 2445: 	asm	mov ax,bx
 2446: 	asm pop bx
 2447: 	asm pop es
 2448: 
 2449: }
 2450: 
 2451: 
 2453: void IOKern_DOS_Vector_Set( unsigned num, IOKERN_DOS_VECTOR_TYPE h )
 2454: {
 2455: 	asm push es
 2456: 	asm push bx
 2457: 
 2458: 	asm	xor bx,bx
 2459: 	asm	mov es,bx
 2460: 	asm	mov bx,[num]
 2461: 
 2462: 	asm	shl bx,1
 2463: 	asm	shl bx,1
 2464: 
 2466: 	asm	pushf
 2467: 	asm	cli
 2468: 	asm	mov ax,word ptr [h]
 2469: 	asm	mov es:[bx],ax
 2470: 	asm	mov ax,word ptr [h+2]
 2471: 	asm	mov es:[bx+2],ax
 2472: 	asm	popf
 2473: 	asm pop bx
 2474: 	asm pop es
 2475: }
 2476: 
 2478: #define	IOKERN_DOS_INT_GET(num)		IOKern_DOS_Vector_Get(num)
 2479: #define	IOKERN_DOS_INT_SET(num, fn)	IOKern_DOS_Vector_Set(num, (IOKERN_DOS_VECTOR_TYPE)fn)
 2480: 
 2481: #define IOKERN_TASK_QTY  17
 2482: IOKERN_TASK_TYPE  iokern_task[IOKERN_TASK_QTY];
 2483: 
 2484: 
 2488: void IOKern_PIC_EOI( unsigned char irq )
 2489: {
 2490: 	outp( IOKERN_DOS_PIC1_CMD, IOKERN_DOS_NSEOI );
 2491: 	if ( irq >= 8 ) outp( IOKERN_DOS_PIC2_CMD, IOKERN_DOS_NSEOI );
 2492: }
 2493: 
 2498: void IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_ENUM id, IOKERN_IRQ_ENUM irq, struct pt_regs * regs )
 2499: {
 2500: 	iokern_task[id].result =
 2501: 		( * iokern_task[id].task_fp )( irq, iokern_task[id].dev_id, regs );
 2502: 
 2503: 	iokern_task[id].count++;
 2504: }
 2505: 
 2511: static void INTERRUPT IOKern_ISR0( struct pt_regs r )
 2512: {
 2513: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2514: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ1, IOKERN_IRQ_0, r );
 2515: #else
 2516: 	IOKERN_IRQ_START;
 2517: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ0, IOKERN_IRQ_0, &r );
 2518: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_0 );
 2519: #endif
 2520: }
 2521: 
 2527: static void INTERRUPT IOKern_ISR1( struct pt_regs r )
 2528: {
 2529: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2530: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ1, IOKERN_IRQ_1, r );
 2531: #else
 2532: 	IOKERN_IRQ_START;
 2533: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ1, IOKERN_IRQ_1, &r );
 2534: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_1 );
 2535: #endif
 2536: }
 2537:

 2544: {
 2545: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2546: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ2, IOKERN_IRQ_2, r );
 2547: #else
 2548: 	IOKERN_IRQ_START;
 2549: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ2, IOKERN_IRQ_2, &r );
 2550: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_2 );
 2551: #endif
 2552: }

 2567: #endif
 2568: }

 2579: #else

 2581: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ4, IOKERN_IRQ_4, &r );

 2599: #endif
 2600: }

 2625: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2626: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ7, IOKERN_IRQ_7, r );
 2627: #else

 2629: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ7, IOKERN_IRQ_7, &r );
 2630: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_7 );
 2631: #endif
 2632: }

 2640: {
 2641: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2642: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ8, IOKERN_IRQ_8, r );
 2643: #else
 2644: 	IOKERN_IRQ_START;
 2645: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ8, IOKERN_IRQ_8, &r );
 2646: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_8 );
 2647: #endif
 2648: }
 2649: 
 2655: static void INTERRUPT IOKern_ISR9( struct pt_regs r )
 2656: {
 2657: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2658: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ9, IOKERN_IRQ_9, r );
 2659: #else
 2660: 	IOKERN_IRQ_START;
 2661: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ9, IOKERN_IRQ_9, &r );
 2662: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_9 );
 2663: #endif
 2664: }
 2665: 
 2671: static void INTERRUPT IOKern_ISR10( struct pt_regs r )
 2672: {
 2673: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2674: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ10, IOKERN_IRQ_10, r );
 2675: #else
 2676: 	IOKERN_IRQ_START;
 2677: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ10, IOKERN_IRQ_10, &r );
 2678: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_10 );
 2679: #endif
 2680: }
 2681: 
 2687: static void INTERRUPT IOKern_ISR11( struct pt_regs r )
 2688: {
 2689: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2690: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ11, IOKERN_IRQ_11, r );
 2691: #else

 2693: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ11, IOKERN_IRQ_11, &r );
 2694: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_11 );
 2695: #endif
 2696: }
 2697:

 2704: {
 2705: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2706: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ12, IOKERN_IRQ_12, r );
 2707: #else

 2709: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ12, IOKERN_IRQ_12, &r );
 2710: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_12 );
 2711: #endif
 2712: }

 2720: {
 2721: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2722: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ13, IOKERN_IRQ_13, r );
 2723: #else

 2726: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_13 );
 2727: #endif
 2728: }
 2729: 
 2735: static void INTERRUPT IOKern_ISR14( struct pt_regs r )
 2736: {
 2737: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2738: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ14, IOKERN_IRQ_14, r );
 2739: #else

 2741: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ14, IOKERN_IRQ_14, &r );
 2742: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_14 );
 2743: #endif
 2744: }
 2745: 
 2751: static void INTERRUPT IOKern_ISR15( struct pt_regs r )
 2752: {
 2753: #if defined( IOKERN_ISR_USE_THESE_GUTS )
 2754: 	IOKERN_ISR_GUTS( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ15, IOKERN_IRQ_15, r );
 2755: #else
 2756: 	IOKERN_IRQ_START;
 2757: 	IOKern_Interrupt_Helper( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ15, IOKERN_IRQ_15, &r );
 2758: 	IOKERN_IRQ_END( IOKERN_IRQ_15 );
 2759: #endif
 2760: }
 2761: 
 2763: IOKERN_ISR_FP iokern_isr_table[IOKERN_TASK_QTY] =
 2764: {
 2765: 	IOKern_ISR0,
 2766: 	IOKern_ISR1,
 2767: 	IOKern_ISR2,
 2768: 	IOKern_ISR3,
 2769: 	IOKern_ISR4,
 2770: 	IOKern_ISR5,
 2771: 	IOKern_ISR6,
 2772: 	IOKern_ISR7,
 2773: 	IOKern_ISR8,
 2774: 	IOKern_ISR9,
 2775: 	IOKern_ISR10,
 2776: 	IOKern_ISR11,
 2777: 	IOKern_ISR12,
 2778: 	IOKern_ISR13,
 2779: 	IOKern_ISR14,
 2780: 	IOKern_ISR15,
 2781: 	NULL
 2782: };
 2783: 
 2789: int IOKern_IRQ_Test_Helper( unsigned int irq )
 2790: {
 2791: 	int error_code = SUCCESS;
 2792: #if defined( IOKERN_CPU_REGION_MAP )
 2793: 	int index;
 2794: 	
 2795: 	index = 0;
 2796: 	while( SYS_TYPE__NONE != iokern_irq_map_list[index].type )
 2797: 	{
 2798: 		if ( irq == iokern_irq_map_list[index].irq )
 2799: 		{ 
 2800: 			return( -((int)(index + 1)) );
 2801: 		}
 2802: 		index++;
 2803: 	}
 2804: #endif
 2805: 
 2806: 	switch( (IOKERN_IRQ_ENUM) irq )
 2807: 	{
 2808: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_NONE:
 2809: 		
 2810: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_1:
 2811: 		
 2812: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_3:
 2813: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_4:
 2814: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_5:
 2815: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_6:
 2816: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_7:
 2817: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_9:
 2818: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_10:
 2819: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_11:
 2820: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_12:
 2821: 		
 2822: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_14:
 2823: 		case IOKERN_IRQ_15:
 2824: 		
 2825: 			break;
 2826: 		default:
 2827: 			error_code =  -EC_INTR_ERROR;
 2828: 	}
 2829: 
 2830: 	return error_code;
 2831: }
 2832: 
 2838: int IOKern_IRQ_Test( unsigned int irq )
 2839: {
 2840: 	int error_code;
 2841: 
 2842: 	error_code = IOKern_IRQ_Test_Helper( irq );
 2843: 
 2845: 	if ( error_code ) return -EC_INTR_ERROR;
 2846: 
 2847: 	return SUCCESS;
 2848: }
 2849: 
 2855: void IOKern_IRQ_Invoke_ISR_Test( size_t irq )
 2856: {
 2857: 	struct pt_regs r;
 2858: 
 2859: 	memset( &r, 0, sizeof( struct pt_regs ) );
 2860: 	( * iokern_isr_table[irq] )( r );
 2861: }
 2862: 
 2868: IOKERN_TASK_ID_ENUM IOKern_Task_ID_Get( unsigned int irq )
 2869: {
 2870: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_ENUM  task_id;
 2871: 
 2872: 	if ( IOKERN_IRQ_NONE == irq )
 2873: 	{
 2874: 		task_id = IOKERN_TASK_ID_NONE;  
 2875: 	}
 2876: 	else if ( irq <= IOKERN_IRQ_15 )
 2877: 	{
 2878: 		task_id = (IOKERN_TASK_ID_ENUM) irq;
 2879: 	}
 2880: 	else
 2881: 	{
 2882: 		task_id = IOKERN_TASK_ID_NONE;
 2883: 	}
 2884: 	return task_id;
 2885: }
 2886: 
 2892: IOKERN_TASK_TYPE * IOKern_Task_Handle_Get( unsigned int irq )
 2893: {
 2894: 	size_t 	task_id;
 2895: 
 2896: 	if ( SUCCESS != IOKern_IRQ_Test( irq ) ) return( NULL );
 2897: 
 2898: 	task_id = 0;
 2899: 	while( task_id < IOKERN_TASK_QTY )
 2900: 	{
 2901: 		if ( irq == iokern_task[task_id].number )
 2902: 		{
 2903: 			return( &iokern_task[task_id] );
 2904: 		}
 2905: 		task_id++;
 2906: 	}
 2907: 	
 2908: 	return NULL;
 2909: }
 2910: 
 2916: static int IOKern_DOS_ISR_Install( unsigned char irq )
 2917: {
 2918: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_ENUM  task_id;
 2919: 	int					 int_number;
 2920: 
 2921: 	task_id = IOKern_Task_ID_Get( irq );
 2922: 	if ( IOKERN_TASK_ID_NONE == task_id ) return SUCCESS; 
 2923: 
 2924: 	if ( ( IOKERN_TASK_ID_IRQ0 == task_id ) || ( IOKERN_TASK_ID_INT33 == task_id ) )
 2925: 	{ 
 2926: 		return -EC_INTERRUPT_UNAVAILABLE;
 2927: 	}
 2928: 
 2929: 
 2930: 
 2931: 
 2932: 
 2933: 
 2934: 
 2935: 
 2936: 
 2937: 
 2938: 
 2939: 
 2940: 
 2941: 
 2942: 
 2943: 		if ( irq < 8 ) int_number = ( irq - 0 ) + 0x08;
 2944: 		else           int_number = ( irq - 8 ) + 0x70;
 2945: 
 2946: 	
 2947: 		iokern_task[task_id].old_isr = (IOKERN_ISR_FP) IOKERN_DOS_INT_GET( int_number );
 2948: 		IOKern_DOS_IRQ_Mask_Get( irq, &(iokern_task[task_id].old_state) );
 2949: 		IOKERN_DOS_INT_SET( int_number, iokern_isr_table[task_id] );
 2950: 		IOKern_DOS_IRQ_Mask_Set( irq, 0 );  
 2951: 	
 2952: 
 2953: 	return SUCCESS;
 2954: }
 2955: 
 2961: static void IOKern_DOS_ISR_Restore( unsigned char irq )
 2962: {
 2963: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_ENUM  task_id;
 2964: 	int					 int_number;
 2965: 
 2966: 	task_id = IOKern_Task_ID_Get( irq );
 2967: 	if ( IOKERN_TASK_ID_NONE == task_id ) return; 
 2968: 
 2969: 
 2970: 
 2971: 
 2972: 
 2973: 
 2974: 
 2975: 
 2976: 
 2977: 		if ( irq < 8 ) int_number = ( irq - 0 ) + 0x08;
 2978: 		else           int_number = ( irq - 8 ) + 0x70;
 2979: 
 2980: 		IOKern_DOS_IRQ_Mask_Set( irq, iokern_task[task_id].old_state );
 2981: 		IOKERN_DOS_INT_SET( int_number, iokern_task[task_id].old_isr );
 2982: 
 2983: }
 2984: 
 2990: int IOKern_DOS_IRQ_Request(	unsigned int	irq,
 2991: 							IOKERN_TASK_FP	handler,
 2992: 
 2993: 
 2994: 							void *			dev_id		
 2995: 							)
 2996: {
 2997: 	int 					error_code;
 2998: 	IOKERN_TASK_ID_ENUM  	task_id;
 2999: #define IOKERN_FUNCTION_NAME "IOKern_DOS_IRQ_Request"
 3000:  #if defined ( MSDOS_PRINTF_DEBUG_MESSAGES )
 3001: 	Printf( "%s: ", IOKERN_FUNCTION_NAME );
 3002: 	Printf( "irq=%d, ", irq );
 3003:  #endif
 3004: #undef IOKERN_FUNCTION_NAME
 3005: 	if ( SUCCESS != IOKern_IRQ_Test( irq ) ) return -EC_INTR_ERROR; 
 3006: 
 3007: 	task_id = IOKern_Task_ID_Get( irq );
 3008: 	if ( IOKERN_TASK_ID_NONE == task_id ) return SUCCESS; 
 3009: 
 3010: 	if ( NULL == handler ) return -EC_INTR_ERROR;						
 3011: 	if ( NULL != iokern_task[task_id].task_fp ) return -EC_BUSY;	
 3012: 
 3013: 	iokern_task[task_id].task_fp	= handler;
 3014: 
 3015: 
 3016: 
 3017: 
 3018: 
 3019: 
 3020: 
 3021: 
 3022: 
 3023: 
 3024: 
 3025: 
 3026: 
 3027: 
 3028: 
 3029: 
 3030: 
 3031: 
 3032: 
 3033: 		iokern_task[task_id].help_fp		= NULL;
 3034: 		iokern_task[task_id].chain_to_old	= IOKERN_CHAIN_TO_OLD_OFF;
 3035: 
 3036: 
 3037: 	iokern_task[task_id].dev_id		= dev_id;
 3038: 
 3039: 	iokern_task[task_id].number		= irq;
 3040: 	error_code = IOKern_DOS_ISR_Install( (unsigned char) irq );
 3041:  #if defined ( MSDOS_PRINTF_DEBUG_MESSAGES )
 3042: 	Printf( "done\n" );
 3043:  #endif
 3044: 	return error_code;
 3045: #undef IOKERN_FUNCTION_NAME
 3046: }
 3047: 
 3053: void IOKern_DOS_IRQ_Free( unsigned int 	irq
 3054: 
 3055: 						)
 3056: {
 3057: 	IOKERN_TASK_TYPE * 	task;
 3058: 
 3059: #define IOKERN_FUNCTION_NAME "IOKern_DOS_IRQ_Free"
 3060:  #if defined ( MSDOS_PRINTF_DEBUG_MESSAGES )
 3061: 	Printf( "%s: ", IOKERN_FUNCTION_NAME );
 3062: 	Printf( "irq=%d, ", irq );
 3063:  #endif
 3064: 	task = IOKern_Task_Handle_Get( irq );
 3065: 	if ( ( SUCCESS == IOKern_IRQ_Test( irq ) ) && ( NULL != task ) )
 3066: 	{
 3067: 		if ( task->task_fp )
 3068: 		{
 3069: 			IOKern_DOS_ISR_Restore( (unsigned char) irq );
 3070: 			memset( task, 0, sizeof( IOKERN_TASK_TYPE ) );
 3071: 			task->number = IOKERN_IRQ_NONE;
 3072:  #if defined ( MSDOS_PRINTF_DEBUG_MESSAGES )
 3073: 			Printf( "success " );
 3074:  #endif
 3075: 		}
 3076: 	}
 3077: 	else
 3078: 	{
 3079:  #if defined ( MSDOS_PRINTF_DEBUG_MESSAGES )
 3080: 	Printf( " " );
 3081:  #endif
 3082: 	}
 3083:  #if defined ( MSDOS_PRINTF_DEBUG_MESSAGES )
 3084: 	Printf( "done\n" );
 3085:  #endif
 3086: #undef IOKERN_FUNCTION_NAME
 3087: }
 3088: 
 3090: void IOKern_Resource_Termination( void )
 3091: {
 3092: 	size_t				index;
 3093: 
 3094: 	IOKERN_IRQ_START;
 3095: 	for ( index = 0; index < IOKERN_TASK_QTY; index++ )
 3096: 	{ 
 3097: 		IOKern_DOS_IRQ_Free( iokern_task[index].number );
 3098: 	}
 3099: 	IOKERN_IRQ_ENABLE;
 3100: }
 3101: 
 3103: void IOKern_Resource_Initialization( void )
 3104: {
 3105: 	size_t				index;
 3106: 
 3107: 
 3108: 
 3109: 
 3110: 
 3111: 	memset( iokern_task, 0, IOKERN_TASK_QTY * sizeof( IOKERN_TASK_TYPE ) );
 3112: 
 3113: 	for ( index = 0; index < IOKERN_TASK_QTY; index++ )
 3114: 	{
 3115: 		iokern_task[index].number = IOKERN_IRQ_NONE;
 3116: 	}
 3117: 
 3118: #if defined( IOKERN_CPU_REGION_MAP )
 3119: 	
 3120: 	index = 0;
 3121: 	while( SYS_TYPE__NONE != iokern_cpu_region_list[index].type )
 3122: 	{
 3123: 		iokern_cpu_region_list[index].name = iokern_cpu_region_description[index];
 3124: 		index++;
 3125: 	}
 3126: 	
 3127: 	index = 0;
 3128: 	while( SYS_TYPE__NONE != iokern_irq_map_list[index].type )
 3129: 	{
 3130: 		iokern_irq_map_list[index].name = iokern_irq_map_description[index];
 3131: 		index++;
 3132: 	}
 3133: #endif
 3134: }
 3135: 
 3136: 
 3137: #endif 
 3138: 
 3139: 
 3140: 
 3141: #if(0)
 3142: 
 3143: 
 3144: 
 3145: 
 3146: 
 3147: 
 3148: 
 3157: int IAI_AI_ID_Get( int board_id, uint16_t * id )
 3158: {
 3159: 	uint8_t   	lsb, msb;
 3160: 
 3161: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, IAI_ID_LSB, &lsb );
 3162: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, IAI_ID_MSB, &msb );
 3163: 	*id = ( ((uint16_t) msb) << 8 ) | ((uint16_t) lsb);
 3164: #if defined( ID_ALWAYS_REPORT_AS_GOOD )
 3165: 	*id = ID_IAI;
 3166: #endif
 3167: 	return SUCCESS;
 3168: }
 3169: 
 3174: int IAI16_AI_Channel_Get( int board_id, size_t channel, int * value )
 3175: {
 3176: 	int			location;
 3177: 	size_t		row;
 3178: 	uint16_t 	scratch;
 3179: 	struct reg_definition * definition = ( struct reg_definition * ) board_definition[board_id].definition;
 3180: 
 3181: 	row = REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET( IAI_AIN0 ) + channel;
 3182: 	location = REG_LOCATION_SET( row, 0 ); 
 3183: 
 3184: 	IO_Read_U16_Address_Increment( board_id, location, &scratch );
 3185: 	
 3186: 	*value = (int) scratch;
 3187: 	return SUCCESS;
 3188: }
 3189: 
 3194: int IAI16_AI_Channel_Multiple_Get( 	int 	board_id,
 3195: 									size_t 	channel_first,
 3196: 									size_t 	channel_last,
 3197: 									size_t 	table_offset,
 3198: 									int * 	table
 3199: 								 )
 3200: {
 3201: 	int			location;
 3202: 	size_t		row;
 3203: 	size_t		index;
 3204: 	uint16_t 	scratch;
 3205: 	struct reg_definition * definition = ( struct reg_definition * ) board_definition[board_id].definition;
 3206: 
 3207: 	index = 0;
 3208: 	for ( channel = channel_first; channel <= channel_last; channel++ )
 3209: 	{
 3210: 		row = REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET( IAI_AIN0 ) + channel;
 3211: 		location = REG_LOCATION_SET( row, 0 ); 
 3212: 		IO_Read_U16_Address_Increment( board_id, location, &scratch );
 3213: 		
 3214: 		value[table_offset + index] = (int) scratch;
 3215: 		index++;
 3216: 	}
 3217: 	return SUCCESS;
 3218: }
 3219: 
 3220: 
 3221: 
 3222: 
 3223: 
 3228: 
 3229: 
 3230: 
 3231: 
 3236: 
 3237: 
 3238: 
 3243: 
 3244: 
 3245: 
 3251: static int CMD__IAI16_AI_ID( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 3252: { 
 3253: 	uint16_t 	id;
 3254: 	(void) 		argc;
 3255: 	(void) 		argv;
 3256: 	IAI_AI_ID_Get( board_id, &id );
 3257: 	printf( "IAI16 AI ID: 0x%04X\n", id );
 3258: 	return SUCCESS;
 3259: }
 3260: 
 3266: static int CMD__IAI16_AI_Channel( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 3267: {
 3268: 	int 	error_code;		       
 3269: 	int 	channel;
 3270: 	int		value;
 3271: 
 3272: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 3273: 
 3274: 	channel = (int) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 3275: 
 3276: 	if ( argc < 2 )
 3277: 	{ 
 3278: 		error_code = IAI_AI_Channel_Get( board_id, channel, &value );
 3279: 		printf( "IA%02d:  0x%04X  %d\n", channel, value, value );
 3280: 	}
 3281: 	return SUCCESS;
 3282: }
 3283: 
 3289: static int CMD__IAI16_AI_All( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 3290: {
 3291: 	int 	error_code;		       
 3292: 	int 	channel;
 3293: 	int		value;
 3294: 
 3295: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 3296: 
 3297: 	channel = (int) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 3298: 
 3299:
