 6145: 	size_t		block_remainder;
 6146: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset    = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 6147: 
 6148: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "FRAM_Memory_To_File"
 6149: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_FRAM_LOGGING == 1 )
 6150: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_FRAM, board_id, 0 );
 6151: #endif
 6152: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 6153: 
 6154: 	block_count = length / ((size_t) FRAM_BLOCK_SIZE);
 6155: 	block_remainder = length - ( block_count * ((size_t) FRAM_BLOCK_SIZE) );
 6156: 
 6157: 	while ( block_count > 0 )
 6158: 	{
 6159: 		error_code = FRAM__Memory_Read( board_id, address, ((size_t) FRAM_BLOCK_SIZE), dataset->spi.fram_block );
 6160: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) goto FRAM_Memory_To_File_Error_Exit;
 6161: 		fwrite( dataset->spi.fram_block, 1, ((size_t) FRAM_BLOCK_SIZE), binary );
 6162: 		address += FRAM_BLOCK_SIZE;
 6163: 		block_count--;
 6164: 	}
 6165: 
 6166: 	if ( block_remainder > 0 )
 6167: 	{
 6168: 		error_code = FRAM__Memory_Read( board_id, address, block_remainder, dataset->spi.fram_block );
 6169: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) goto FRAM_Memory_To_File_Error_Exit;
 6170: 		fwrite( dataset->spi.fram_block, 1, block_remainder, binary );
 6171: 	}
 6172: 	return SUCCESS;
 6173: 
 6174: FRAM_Memory_To_File_Error_Exit:
 6175: 
 6176: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "FRAM_Memory_To_File"
 6177: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_FRAM_LOGGING == 1 )
 6178: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_FRAM, board_id, error_code );
 6179: #endif
 6180: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 6181: 
 6182: 	return error_code;
 6183: }
 6184: 
 6190: int FRAM_File_To_Memory( int board_id, uint16_t address, size_t length, FILE * binary )
 6191: {
 6192: 	int		error_code;
 6193: 	size_t	count_read;
 6194: 	size_t  count_total;
 6195: 	size_t  count_actual;
 6196: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset    = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 6197: 
 6198: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "FRAM_File_To_Memory"
 6199: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_FRAM_LOGGING == 1 )
 6200: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_FRAM, board_id, 0 );
 6201: #endif
 6202: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 6203: 
 6204: 	count_total = 0;
 6205: 	count_read  = FRAM_BLOCK_SIZE;
 6206: 	if ( 0 == length )
 6207: 	{
 6208: 		do
 6209: 		{
 6210: 			count_actual = fread( dataset->spi.fram_block, 1, count_read, binary );
 6211: 			error_code   = FRAM__Memory_Write( board_id, address, count_read, dataset->spi.fram_block );
 6212: 			if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) goto FRAM_File_To_Memory_Error_Exit;
 6213: 			count_total += count_actual;
 6214: 			if ( count_actual != count_read ) count_read = 0; 
 6215: 		} while ( count_read > 0 );
 6216: 	}
 6217: 	else
 6218: 	{
 6219: 		if ( length < count_read ) count_read = length;
 6220: 		do
 6221: 		{
 6222: 			count_actual = fread( dataset->spi.fram_block, 1, count_read, binary );
 6223: 			error_code   = FRAM__Memory_Write( board_id, address, count_read, dataset->spi.fram_block );
 6224: 			if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) goto FRAM_File_To_Memory_Error_Exit;
 6225: 			count_total += count_actual;
 6226: 			length      -= count_actual;
 6227: 			if ( count_actual != count_read ) count_read = 0; 
 6228: 			if ( length < count_read ) count_read = length;
 6229: 		} while ( count_read > 0 );
 6230: 	}
 6231: 	return SUCCESS;
 6232: 
 6233: FRAM_File_To_Memory_Error_Exit:
 6234: 
 6235: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "FRAM_File_To_Memory"
 6236: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_FRAM_LOGGING == 1 )
 6237: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_FRAM, board_id, error_code );
 6238: #endif
 6239: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 6240: 
 6241: 	return error_code;
 6242: }
 6243: 
 6244: 
 6245: 
 6246: 
 6247: 
 6248: 
 6249: 
 6250: 
 6255: struct command_line
 6256: {
 6257: 	struct command_line * link;						
 6258: 	int ( * cmd_fnc )( int argc, char * argv[] );   
 6259: 	char *  name;                                   
 6260: 	char *  help;                                   
 6261: };
 6262: 
 6263: struct command_line_board   
 6264: {
 6265: 	struct command_line_board * link;				
 6266: 	int ( * cmd_fnc )( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] );   
 6267: 	char *  name;                                   
 6268: 	char *  help;                                   
 6269: };
 6270: 
 6271: 
 6272: 
 6273: 
 6274: 
 6275: 
 6276: 
 6277: 
 6278: 
 6279: 
 6280: 
 6281: 
 6287: static int CMD__SPI_ID( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6288: { 
 6289: 	uint16_t 	id;
 6290: 	(void) 		argc;
 6291: 	(void) 		argv;
 6292: 
 6293: 	SPI_ID_Get( board_id, &id );
 6294: 	printf( "SPI ID: 0x%04X\n", id );
 6295: 	return SUCCESS;
 6296: }
 6297: 
 6303: static int CMD__SPI_Config_Get( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6304: { 
 6305: 	int 	error_code;
 6306: 	struct 	spi_cfg cfg;
 6307: 	(void) 	argc;
 6308: 	(void) 	argv;
 6309: 
 6310: 	error_code = SPI_Configuration_Get( board_id, &cfg );
 6311: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6312: 
 6313: 	error_code = SPI_Report_Configuration_Text( &cfg, stdout );
 6314: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6315: 
 6316: 	printf( "\n" );
 6317: 	return SUCCESS;
 6318: }
 6319: 
 6325: static int CMD__SPI_Config_Clock_Hz( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6326: { 
 6327: 	int 	 error_code;
 6328: 	double 	 clock_request_hz;
 6329: 	double   clock_actual_hz;
 6330: 	double   error;
 6331: 	uint16_t hci;
 6332: 	struct 	 spi_cfg cfg;
 6333: 
 6334: 	
 6335: 	error_code = SPI_Configuration_Get( board_id, &cfg );
 6336: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6337: 
 6338: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 6339: 	{ 
 6340: 		printf( "SPI CLK: %f hz\n", cfg.clock_hz );
 6341: 	}
 6342: 	else
 6343: 	{ 
 6344: 		clock_request_hz = atof( argv[0] );
 6345: 		error_code = SPI_Calculate_Clock( clock_request_hz, &clock_actual_hz, &error, &hci );
 6346: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6347: 		
 6348: 		
 6349: 		cfg.clock_hz = clock_actual_hz;
 6350: 		error_code   = SPI_Configuration_Set( board_id, &cfg );
 6351: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6352: 		printf( "OK\n" );
 6353: 	}
 6354: 	return SUCCESS;
 6355: }
 6356: 
 6362: static int CMD__SPI_Config_End_Cycle_Delay_Sec( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6363: { 
 6364: 	int 	 error_code;
 6365: 	double 	 request_sec;
 6366: 	double   actual_sec;
 6367: 	double   error;
 6368: 	uint8_t  ecd;
 6369: 	struct 	 spi_cfg cfg;
 6370: 
 6371: 	
 6372: 	error_code = SPI_Configuration_Get( board_id, &cfg );
 6373: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6374: 
 6375: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 6376: 	{ 
 6377: 		printf( "SPI ECD: %g sec\n", ( cfg.end_delay_ns * 1.0e-9 ) );
 6378: 	}
 6379: 	else
 6380: 	{ 
 6381: 		request_sec = atof( argv[0] );
 6382: 		error_code = SPI_Calculate_End_Cycle_Delay( SPI_Calculate_Half_Clock_Interval_Sec( cfg.half_clock_interval ),
 6383: 													request_sec,
 6384: 													&actual_sec,
 6385: 													&error,
 6386: 													&ecd
 6387: 												  );
 6388: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6389: 		cfg.end_delay_ns = actual_sec * 1.0e9;
 6390: 		
 6391: 		error_code = SPI_Configuration_Set( board_id, &cfg );
 6392: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6393: 		printf( "OK\n" );
 6394: 	}
 6395: 	return SUCCESS;
 6396: }
 6397: 
 6406: 
 6412: static int CMD__SPI_Config_Mode( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6413: { 
 6414: 	int 	 error_code;
 6415: 	int		 mode;
 6416: 	struct 	 spi_cfg cfg;
 6417: 
 6418: 	
 6419: 	error_code = SPI_Configuration_Get( board_id, &cfg );
 6420: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6421: 
 6422: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 6423: 	{ 
 6424: 		if      ( (false == cfg.sclk_polarity ) && (false == cfg.sclk_phase) ) mode = 0;
 6425: 		else if ( (false == cfg.sclk_polarity ) && (true  == cfg.sclk_phase) ) mode = 1;
 6426: 		else if ( (true  == cfg.sclk_polarity ) && (false == cfg.sclk_phase) ) mode = 2;
 6427: 		else if ( (true  == cfg.sclk_polarity ) && (true  == cfg.sclk_phase) ) mode = 3;
 6428: 		printf( "SPI MODE: %d\n", mode );
 6429: 	}
 6430: 	else
 6431: 	{ 
 6432: 		mode = (int) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 6433: 		switch ( mode )
 6434: 		{
 6435: 			case 0: cfg.sclk_polarity = false;	cfg.sclk_phase = false;		break;
 6436: 			case 1: cfg.sclk_polarity = false;	cfg.sclk_phase = true;		break;
 6437: 			case 2: cfg.sclk_polarity = true;	cfg.sclk_phase = false;		break;
 6438: 			case 3: cfg.sclk_polarity = true;	cfg.sclk_phase = true;		break;
 6439: 		}
 6440: 		
 6441: 		error_code = SPI_Configuration_Set( ID_IDI48, &cfg );
 6442: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6443: 		printf( "OK\n" );
 6444: 	}
 6445: 	return SUCCESS;
 6446: }
 6447: 
 6453: static int CMD__SPI_Config_SDI_Polarity( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6454: { 
 6455: 	int 	 error_code;
 6456: 
 6457: 	struct 	 spi_cfg cfg;
 6458: 
 6459: 	
 6460: 	error_code = SPI_Configuration_Get( board_id, &cfg );
 6461: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6462: 
 6463: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 6464: 	{ 
 6465: 		printf( "SPI SDI POLARITY: %s\n", cfg.sdi_polarity ? "true" : "false" );
 6466: 	}
 6467: 	else
 6468: 	{ 
 6469: 		cfg.sdi_polarity = String_To_Bool( argv[0] );
 6470: 		
 6471: 		error_code = SPI_Configuration_Set( board_id, &cfg );
 6472: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6473: 		printf( "OK\n" );
 6474: 	}
 6475: 	return SUCCESS;
 6476: }
 6477: 
 6483: static int CMD__SPI_Config_SDO_Polarity( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6484: { 
 6485: 	int 	 error_code;
 6486: 
 6487: 	struct 	 spi_cfg cfg;
 6488: 
 6489: 	
 6490: 	error_code = SPI_Configuration_Get( board_id, &cfg );
 6491: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6492: 
 6493: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 6494: 	{ 
 6495: 		printf( "SPI SDO POLARITY: %s\n", cfg.sdo_polarity ? "true" : "false" );
 6496: 	}
 6497: 	else
 6498: 	{ 
 6499: 		cfg.sdo_polarity = String_To_Bool( argv[0] );
 6500: 		
 6501: 		error_code = SPI_Configuration_Set( board_id, &cfg );
 6502: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6503: 		printf( "OK\n" );
 6504: 	}
 6505: 	return SUCCESS;
 6506: }
 6507: 
 6513: static int CMD__SPI_Config_SDIO_Wrap( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6514: { 
 6515: 	int 	 error_code;
 6516: 
 6517: 	struct 	 spi_cfg cfg;
 6518: 
 6519: 	
 6520: 	error_code = SPI_Configuration_Get( board_id, &cfg );
 6521: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6522: 
 6523: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 6524: 	{ 
 6525: 		printf( "SPI wrap: %s\n", cfg.sdio_wrap ? "true" : "false" );
 6526: 	}
 6527: 	else
 6528: 	{ 
 6529: 		cfg.sdio_wrap = String_To_Bool( argv[0] );
 6530: 		
 6531: 		error_code = SPI_Configuration_Set( board_id, &cfg );
 6532: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6533: 		printf( "OK\n" );
 6534: 	}
 6535: 	return SUCCESS;
 6536: }
 6537: 
 6543: static int CMD__SPI_Config_Chip_Select_Route( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6544: { 
 6545: 	int 	 error_code;
 6546: 
 6547: 	struct 	 spi_cfg cfg;
 6548: 
 6549: 	
 6550: 	error_code = SPI_Configuration_Get( board_id, &cfg );
 6551: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6552: 
 6553: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 6554: 	{ 
 6555: 		printf( "SPI CS ROUTE: %s\n", cfg.chip_select_route_ch1 ? "1" : "0" );
 6556: 	}
 6557: 	else
 6558: 	{ 
 6559: 		cfg.chip_select_route_ch1 = String_To_Bool( argv[0] );
 6560: 		
 6561: 		error_code = SPI_Configuration_Set( board_id, &cfg );
 6562: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6563: 		printf( "OK\n" );
 6564: 	}
 6565: 	return SUCCESS;
 6566: }
 6567: 
 6573: static int CMD__SPI_Config_Chip_Select_Behavior( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6574: { 
 6575: 	int 	 error_code;
 6576: 
 6577: 	struct 	 spi_cfg cfg;
 6578: 
 6579: 	
 6580: 	error_code = SPI_Configuration_Get( board_id, &cfg );
 6581: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6582: 
 6583: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 6584: 	{ 
 6585: 		printf( "SPI CSB: ");
 6586: 		switch ( cfg.chip_select_behavior )
 6587: 		{
 6588: 			case CSB_SOFTWARE:	printf( "software" 	);	break;
 6589: 			case CSB_BUFFER:	printf( "buffer"   	);	break;
 6590: 			case CSB_uint8_t:	printf( "uint8_t"   );	break;
 6591: 			case CSB_uint16_t:	printf( "uint16_t"  );	break;
 6592: 			default:            printf( "undefined"	);	break;
 6593: 		}
 6594: 		printf( "\n" );
 6595: 	}
 6596: 	else
 6597: 	{ 
 6598: 		if      ( 0 == strcmpi( "software",   argv[0] ) ) cfg.chip_select_behavior = 0;
 6599: 		else if ( 0 == strcmpi( "buffer",     argv[0] ) ) cfg.chip_select_behavior = 1;
 6600: 		else if ( 0 == strcmpi( "uint8_t",    argv[0] ) ) cfg.chip_select_behavior = 2;
 6601: 		else if ( 0 == strcmpi( "uint16_t",   argv[0] ) ) cfg.chip_select_behavior = 3;
 6602: 		else
 6603: 		{
 6604: 			cfg.chip_select_behavior = (SPI_CSB_ENUM) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 6605: 			switch ( cfg.chip_select_behavior )
 6606: 			{
 6607: 				case CSB_SOFTWARE:
 6608: 				case CSB_BUFFER:
 6609: 				case CSB_uint8_t:
 6610: 				case CSB_uint16_t:
 6611: 					break;
 6612: 				default:
 6613: 					error_code = -EC_SPI_CSB_OUT_OF_RANGE;
 6614: 					break;
 6615: 			}
 6616: 		}
 6617: 		 if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6618: 		
 6619: 		error_code = SPI_Configuration_Set( board_id, &cfg );
 6620: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6621: 		printf( "OK\n" );
 6622: 	}
 6623: 	return SUCCESS;
 6624: }
 6625: 
 6631: static int CMD__SPI_Status( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6632: { 
 6633: 	int 	 			error_code;
 6634: 	int					index;
 6635: 	struct spi_status 	status;
 6636: 
 6637: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 6638: 	{
 6639: 		error_code = SPI_Status_Read( board_id, &status );
 6640: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6641: 		SPI_Report_Status_Text( &status, stdout );
 6642: 	}
 6643: 	else
 6644: 	{
 6645: 		for ( index = 0; index < argc; index++ )
 6646: 		{
 6647: 			if ( 0 == strcmpi( "rx", argv[index] ) )
 6648: 			{
 6649: 				error_code = SPI_Status_Read( board_id, &status );
 6650: 				if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6651: 				SPI_Report_Status_Text( &status, stdout );
 6652: 			}
 6653: 			else if ( 0 == strcmpi( "tx", argv[index] ) )
 6654: 			{
 6655: 				error_code = SPI_Status_Write( board_id, &status );
 6656: 				if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6657: 				SPI_Report_Status_Text( &status, stdout );
 6658: 			}
 6659: 		}
 6660: 	}
 6661: 	return SUCCESS;
 6662: }
 6663: 
 6669: static int CMD__SPI_Data_Interpreter( 	int 		arg_start,  
 6670: 										int 		argc,
 6671: 										char * 		argv[],
 6672: 										size_t		tx_size,	
 6673: 										size_t *	tx_count,   
 6674: 										uint8_t * 	tx_buffer   
 6675: 									)
 6676: {
 6677: 	size_t 	arg_qty;
 6678: 	size_t	count;
 6679: 	int 	index_arg;
 6680: 	int		index_byte;
 6681: 	uint8_t data_temp;
 6682: 	char * 	endptr;
 6683: 	char *  sp;
 6684: 
 6685: 	arg_qty = (size_t)( argc - arg_start );
 6686: 
 6687: 	sp         = NULL;
 6688: 	index_arg  = arg_start;
 6689: 	index_byte = 0;
 6690: 	count      = arg_qty;
 6691: 	while ( ( count != 0 ) && ( index_byte < tx_size ) )
 6692: 	{
 6693: 		data_temp = (uint8_t) strtol( argv[index_arg], &endptr, 0 );
 6694: 		if ( endptr == argv[index_arg] )
 6695: 		{
 6696: 			sp = &(argv[index_arg][0]);
 6697: 			while ( ( '\0' != *sp ) && ( index_byte < tx_size ) )
 6698: 			{
 6699: 				tx_buffer[index_byte] = (uint8_t)( *sp );
 6700: 				sp++;	index_byte++;
 6701: 			}
 6702: 			if ( '\0' == *sp ) sp = NULL;
 6703: 		}
 6704: 		else
 6705: 		{
 6706: 			tx_buffer[index_byte] = data_temp;
 6707: 			index_byte++;
 6708: 			sp = NULL;
 6709: 		}
 6710: 		count--;	index_arg++;
 6711: 	}
 6712: 
 6713: 	if ( count > 0 )
 6714: 	{
 6715: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 6716: 		printf( "Warning: ignored %d arguments", count );
 6717: #else
 6718: 		printf( "Warning: ignored %lu arguments", count );
 6719: #endif
 6720: 		if ( NULL != sp )
 6721: 		{
 6722: 			printf( ", and portion of string argument" );
 6723: 		}
 6724: 		printf( "\n" );
 6725: 	}
 6726: 
 6727: 	*tx_count = index_byte;
 6728: 	return SUCCESS;
 6729: }
 6730: 
 6741: static int CMD__SPI_Data( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6742: { 
 6743: 	int 	 			error_code;
 6744: 	size_t				index;
 6745: 	size_t				transfer_count; 
 6746: 	size_t	  			lines;
 6747: 	uint8_t *			bp; 			
 6748: 
 6749: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 6750: 	dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 6751: 
 6752: 
 6753: 
 6754: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_PARAMETER;
 6755: 
 6756: 	CMD__SPI_Data_Interpreter( 		0,  						
 6757: 									argc,
 6758: 									argv,
 6759: 									SPI_BLOCK_SIZE,				
 6760: 									&transfer_count,   			
 6761: 									dataset->spi.tx_buffer 	
 6762: 								 );
 6763: 
 6764: 	error_code = SPI_Data_Write_Read( 	board_id,
 6765: 										sizeof( uint8_t ),
 6766: 										transfer_count,
 6767: 										dataset->spi.tx_buffer,
 6768: 										transfer_count,
 6769: 										dataset->spi.rx_buffer
 6770: 									);
 6771: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6772: 
 6773: 	lines = transfer_count / HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE;
 6774: 	
 6775: 	for ( index = 0; index <= lines; index++ )
 6776: 	{
 6777: 		bp = &(dataset->spi.rx_buffer[index * HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE]);
 6778: 		if ( transfer_count < HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE )
 6779: 		{
 6780: 			Hex_Dump_Line( 0, transfer_count, bp, stdout );
 6781: 		}
 6782: 		else
 6783: 		{
 6784: 			Hex_Dump_Line( 0, HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE, bp, stdout );
 6785: 			transfer_count = transfer_count - HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE;
 6786: 		}
 6787: 	}
 6788: 	return SUCCESS;
 6789: }
 6790: 
 6796: static int CMD__SPI_FIFO( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6797: { 
 6798: 	int 	 			error_code;
 6799: 	int					index;
 6800: 	size_t				count;
 6801: 	SPI_CSB_ENUM		csb;
 6802: 	int					read_count; 
 6803: 
 6804: 	uint8_t				tx_buffer[SPI_FIFO_SIZE];
 6805: 	uint8_t				rx_buffer[SPI_FIFO_SIZE];
 6806: 
 6807: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 6808: 	dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 6809: 
 6810: 	read_count = 0;
 6811: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 6812: 	{
 6813: 		read_count = SPI_FIFO_SIZE;
 6814: 	}
 6815: 	else
 6816: 	{
 6817: 		if      ( 0 == strcmpi( "rx", argv[0] ) )
 6818: 		{
 6819: 			if ( argc > 1)
 6820: 			{
 6821: 				if ( 0 == strcmpi( "all", argv[1] ) ) read_count = SPI_FIFO_SIZE;
 6822: 				else read_count = (int) strtol( argv[1], NULL, 0 );
 6823: 			}
 6824: 		}
 6825: 		else if ( 0 == strcmpi( "tx", argv[0] ) )
 6826: 		{
 6827: 			CMD__SPI_Data_Interpreter( 		1,  				
 6828: 											argc,
 6829: 											argv,
 6830: 											SPI_FIFO_SIZE,		
 6831: 											&count,   			
 6832: 											tx_buffer   		
 6833: 										 );
 6834: 
 6835: 			error_code = SPI_FIFO_Write( board_id, (void *) tx_buffer, sizeof( uint8_t ), count, NULL );
 6836: 			if ( error_code < 0 ) return error_code;
 6837: 
 6838: 			printf( "OK, wrote %d objects or %d bytes\n", error_code, error_code * ((int) sizeof( uint8_t )) );
 6839: 			return SUCCESS;
 6840: 		}
 6841: 		else if ( 0 == strcmpi( "commit", argv[0] ) )
 6842: 		{
 6843: 			if ( argc > 1 )
 6844: 			{
 6845: 				if ( String_To_Bool( argv[1] ) ) SPI_Commit( board_id, 0xFF );
 6846: 				else                             SPI_Commit( board_id, 0x00 );
 6847: 
 6848: 				printf( "OK\n" );
 6849: 				return SUCCESS;
 6850: 			}
 6851: 			else
 6852: 			{
 6853: 				uint8_t commit_status;
 6854: 				SPI_Commit_Get( board_id, &commit_status );
 6855: 				printf( "commit status = %s\n", ( 0 == commit_status ) ? "false" : "true" );
 6856: 				return SUCCESS;
 6857: 			}
 6858: 			
 6859: 		}
 6860: 	}
 6861: 
 6862: 
 6863: 	
 6864: 	
 6865: 	error_code = SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Behavior_Get( board_id, &csb );
 6866: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6867: 
 6868: 	if ( SPI_Status_Write_FIFO_Is_Not_Empty( board_id ) )
 6869: 	{ 
 6870: 		if ( CSB_SOFTWARE != csb ) SPI_Commit( board_id, 0xFF );
 6871: 	}
 6872: 	
 6873: 	while ( SPI_Status_Write_FIFO_Is_Not_Empty( board_id ) )
 6874: 	{ 
 6875: 		error_code = SUCCESS;
 6876: 		if ( dataset->quit_application ) error_code = -EC_APP_TERMINATE_CTRLC;
 6877: 		if ( Character_Get( NULL )     ) error_code = -EC_APP_TERMINATE;
 6878: 		if ( SUCCESS != error_code     )
 6879: 		{
 6880: 			printf( "IDI_CMD__SPI_FIFO: waiting for tx empty\n" );
 6881: 			return -EC_APP_TERMINATE;
 6882: 		}
 6883: 	}
 6884: 
 6885: 	if ( read_count > 0 )
 6886: 	{
 6887: 		int 	  lines;
 6888: 		uint8_t * bp; 
 6889: 
 6890: 		if ( SPI_Status_Read_FIFO_Is_Not_Empty( board_id ) )
 6891: 		{
 6892: 			error_code = SPI_FIFO_Read( board_id, (void *) rx_buffer, sizeof( uint8_t ), read_count, NULL );
 6893: 			if ( error_code < 0 ) return error_code;
 6894: 			
 6895: 			read_count = error_code * sizeof( uint8_t );
 6896: 			lines = read_count / HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE;
 6897: 			
 6898: 			for ( index = 0; index <= lines; index++ )
 6899: 			{
 6900: 				bp = &(rx_buffer[index * HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE]);
 6901: 				if ( read_count < HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE )
 6902: 				{
 6903: 					Hex_Dump_Line( 0, read_count, bp, stdout );
 6904: 				}
 6905: 				else
 6906: 				{
 6907: 					Hex_Dump_Line( 0, HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE, bp, stdout );
 6908: 					read_count = read_count - HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE;
 6909: 				}
 6910: 			}
 6911: 		}
 6912: 		else
 6913: 		{
 6914: 			printf( "FIFO Empty\n" );
 6915: 		}
 6916: 	}
 6917: 	return SUCCESS;
 6918: 
 6919: 
 6920: 
 6921: 
 6922: }
 6923: 
 6929: static int CMD__SPI_Commit( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 6930: { 
 6931: 	int		 error_code;
 6932: 	uint8_t  commit;
 6933: 
 6934: 	if      ( argc < 1 )
 6935: 	{
 6936: 		uint8_t commit_status;
 6937: 		SPI_Commit_Get( board_id, &commit_status );
 6938: 		printf( "commit status = %s\n", ( 0 == commit_status ) ? "false" : "true" );
 6939: 	}
 6940: 	else if ( String_To_Bool( argv[0] ) ) commit = 0x01;
 6941: 	else                                  commit = 0x00;
 6942: 
 6943: 	error_code = SPI_Commit( board_id, commit );
 6944: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) return error_code;
 6945: 
 6946: 	printf( "OK\n" );
 6947: 	return SUCCESS;
 6948: }
 6949: 
 6950: 
 6954: static struct command_line_board  cmd_spi[] =
 6955: {
 6956: 	{	NULL,	CMD__SPI_ID, 							"id",		"wishbone id: params: none"								},
 6957: 	{	NULL,	CMD__SPI_Config_Get, 		  			"cfg",		"config dump: params: none"								},
 6958: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Config_Clock_Hz, 				"clk",		"clk:         params: [<clock freq in hertz>]"			},
 6959: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Config_End_Cycle_Delay_Sec,	"ecd",		"end delay:   params: [<time in seconds>]"				},
 6960: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Config_Mode,					"mode",		"mode:        params: [<0/1/2/3>]"						},
 6961: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Config_SDI_Polarity,			"sdi",		"sdi pol:     params: [<true/1/false/0>]"				},
 6962: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Config_SDO_Polarity,			"sdo",		"sdo pol:     params: [<true/1/false/0>]"				},
 6963: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Config_SDIO_Wrap,				"wrap",		"sdo-->sdi:   params: [<true/1/false/0>]"				},
 6964: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Config_Chip_Select_Behavior,	"csb",		"chip select behavior: params: [0/1/2/3/software/buffer/uint8_t/uint16_t]"	},
 6965: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Config_Chip_Select_Route,		"csr",		"chip select routing: params: [<true/1/false/0>]"	},
 6966: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Status,						"status",	"status of both TX and RX buffers"						},
 6967: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Data,							"data",		"read/write:  params: <data list: bytes/characters/strings>" },
 6968: 	{	NULL,	CMD__SPI_FIFO,							"fifo",		"fifo r/w:    params: <data list: bytes/characters/strings>" },
 6969: 	{   NULL,	CMD__SPI_Commit,						"commit",	"causes spi transactions to start"						},
 6970: 	{	NULL,	NULL,									NULL,		NULL													}
 6971: };
 6972: 
 6978: int Command_Line_SPI( int board_id, int argc, char* argv[] )
 6979: {
 6980: 	int 		error_code;
 6981: 	int 		index;
 6982:     int     	argc_new;
 6983:     char ** 	argv_new;
 6984: 
 6985:     error_code = -EC_SYNTAX;
 6986: 
 6987: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 6988: 
 6989: 	index = 0;
 6990: 	while ( NULL != cmd_spi[index].cmd_fnc )
 6991: 	{
 6992: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( cmd_spi[index].name, argv[0] )  )
 6993: 		{
 6994: 			argv_new = &(argv[1]);
 6995: 			argc_new = argc - 1;
 6996: 			if ( 0 == argc_new ) argv_new = NULL;
 6997: 
 6998: 			{ 
 6999: 				struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 7000: 				dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 7001: 				if ( IO_TRACE_START_SPI == dataset->trace.start )
 7002: 				{
 7003: 					dataset->trace.active = true;
 7004: 				}
 7005: 			}
 7006: 
 7007: 			error_code = (* cmd_spi[index].cmd_fnc )( board_id, argc_new, argv_new );
 7008: 			break;
 7009: 		}
 7010: 		index++;
 7011: 	}
 7012: 	return error_code;
 7013: }
 7014: 
 7015: 
 7016: 
 7017: 
 7018: 
 7019: 
 7020: 
 7021: 
 7022: 
 7023: 
 7024: 
 7025: 
 7026: 
 7029: enum
 7030: {   AS_ADS1259_CONFIG0		 = 0,
 7031: 	AS_ADS1259_CONFIG1		 = 1,
 7032: 	AS_ADS1259_CONFIG2		 = 2,
 7033: 	AS_ADS1259_OFC0			 = 3,
 7034: 	AS_ADS1259_OFC1			 = 4,
 7035: 	AS_ADS1259_OFC2			 = 5,
 7036: 	AS_ADS1259_FSC0			 = 6,
 7037: 	AS_ADS1259_FSC1			 = 7,
 7038: 	AS_ADS1259_FSC2			 = 8,
 7039: 	AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY  = 9
 7040: };
 7041: 
 7044: static char * as_register_name[] =
 7045: {
 7046: 	"config0",  
 7047: 	"config1",
 7048: 	"config2",
 7049: 	"ofc0",
 7050: 	"ofc1",
 7051: 	"ofc2",
 7052: 	"fsc0",
 7053: 	"fsc1",
 7054: 	"fsc2",		
 7055: 	NULL
 7056: };
 7057: 
 7060: struct bit_string_info
 7061: {
 7062: 	size_t 	register_offset;
 7063: 	size_t	bit_offset;
 7064: 	size_t	bit_width;
 7065: 	char *  name;
 7066: };
 7067: 
 7070: static struct bit_string_info as_bit_string[] =
 7071: {
 7072: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG0, 		0,		1,	 	"spi"		},
 7073: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG0,		2,		1,		"rbias"		},
 7074: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG0,		4,		2,		"id"		},
 7075: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG1,		0,		3,		"delay"		},
 7076: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG1,		3,		1,		"extref"	},
 7077: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG1,		4,		1,		"sinc2"		},
 7078: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG1,		6,		1,		"chksum"	},
 7079: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG1,		7,		1,		"flag"		},
 7080: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG2,		0,		3,		"dr"		},
 7081: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG2,		4,		1,		"pulse"		},
 7082: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG2,		5,		1,		"syncout"	},
 7083: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG2,		6,		1,		"extclk"	},
 7084: 		{ AS_ADS1259_CONFIG2,		7,		1,		"drdy_b"	},
 7085: 		{ AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY, 	0,		0,		NULL		}
 7086: };
 7087: 
 7090: int AS_Register_Name_To_Offset( char * name )
 7091: {
 7092: 	size_t index;
 7093: 
 7094: 	index = 0;
 7095: 	while ( NULL != as_register_name[index] )
 7096: 	{
 7097: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( as_register_name[index], name ) )
 7098: 		{
 7099: 			return index;
 7100: 		}
 7101: 		index++;
 7102: 	}
 7103: 	return -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 7104: }
 7105: 
 7108: int Bit_String_Report( struct bit_string_info * table, size_t address, uint8_t value, FILE * out )
 7109: {
 7110: 	size_t	index;
 7111: 	BOOL 	not_done;
 7112: 	BOOL	initial;
 7113: 	uint8_t	bit_string_value;
 7114: 
 7115: 	initial  = true;
 7116: 	not_done = true;
 7117: 	index    = 0;
 7118: 	while ( not_done )
 7119: 	{
 7120: 		if ( NULL == table[index].name )
 7121: 		{
 7122: 			not_done = false;
 7123: 		}
 7124: 		else if ( address == table[index].register_offset )
 7125: 		{
 7126: 			size_t  i;
 7127: 			uint8_t	mask = 0;
 7128: 			for ( i = 0; i < table[index].bit_width; i++ ) mask = ( mask << 1 ) | 0x01;
 7129: 			bit_string_value = value >> table[index].bit_offset;
 7130: 			bit_string_value = bit_string_value & mask;
 7131: 			if ( initial )
 7132: 			{
 7133: 				fprintf( out, ": " );	initial = false;
 7134: 			}
 7135: 			fprintf( out, " %s=%d", table[index].name, (int) bit_string_value );
 7136: 		}
 7137: 		index++;
 7138: 	}
 7139: 	return SUCCESS;
 7140: }
 7141: 
 7144: int Bit_String_Index_By_Name( struct bit_string_info * table, char * name )
 7145: {
 7146: 	int index;
 7147: 	index = 0;
 7148: 	while ( NULL != table[index].name )
 7149: 	{
 7150: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( table[index].name, name )  ) return index;
 7151: 		index++;
 7152: 	}
 7153: 	return -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 7154: }
 7155: 
 7164: static int AS_Chip_Select_Route_Override( int board_id )
 7165: {
 7166: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 7167: 	dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 7168: 
 7169: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "AS_Chip_Select_Route_Override"
 7170: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7171: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7172: #endif
 7173: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7174: 
 7175: 	SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Route_Get( board_id, &(dataset->as_spi_cs_route_backup) );
 7176: 	SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Route_Set( board_id, dataset->as_cs_default );
 7177: 	return SUCCESS;
 7178: }
 7179: 
 7187: static int AS_Chip_Select_Route_Restore( int board_id )
 7188: {
 7189: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 7190: 	dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 7191: 
 7192: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "AS_Chip_Select_Route_Restore"
 7193: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7194: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7195: #endif
 7196: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7197: 
 7198: 	SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Route_Set( board_id, dataset->as_spi_cs_route_backup );
 7199: 	return SUCCESS;
 7200: }
 7201: 
 7204: int AS_Opcode_Write( int board_id, uint8_t * tx_buf, size_t count )
 7205: {
 7206: 	int error_code;
 7207: 	
 7208: 
 7209: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "AS_Opcode_Write"
 7210: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7211: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7212: #endif
 7213: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7214: 
 7215: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Override( board_id );
 7216: 	SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Behavior_Set( board_id, CSB_BUFFER );
 7217: 	error_code = SPI_Data_Write_Read( 	board_id,	
 7218: 										1,			
 7219: 										count,		
 7220: 										tx_buf, 	
 7221: 										0, 			
 7222: 										NULL 		
 7223: 							  	    );
 7224: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Restore( board_id );
 7225: 	return error_code;
 7226: }
 7227: 
 7230: static int CMD__AS_Wakeup( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7231: {
 7232: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[1] = { 0x03 };
 7233: 	(void)		argc;
 7234: 	(void)		argv;
 7235: 
 7236: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Wakeup"
 7237: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7238: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7239: #endif
 7240: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7241: 
 7242: 	return AS_Opcode_Write( board_id, tx_buf, 1 );
 7243: }
 7244: 
 7247: static int CMD__AS_Sleep( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7248: {
 7249: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[1] = { 0x05 };
 7250: 	(void)		argc;
 7251: 	(void)		argv;
 7252: 
 7253: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Sleep"
 7254: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7255: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7256: #endif
 7257: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7258: 
 7259: 	return AS_Opcode_Write( board_id, tx_buf, 1 );
 7260: }
 7261: 
 7264: static int CMD__AS_Reset( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7265: {
 7266: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[1] = { 0x07 };
 7267: 	(void)		argc;
 7268: 	(void)		argv;
 7269: 
 7270: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Reset"
 7271: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7272: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7273: #endif
 7274: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7275: 
 7276: 	return AS_Opcode_Write( board_id, tx_buf, 1 );
 7277: }
 7278: 
 7281: static int CMD__AS_Start( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7282: {
 7283: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[1] = { 0x09 };
 7284: 	(void)		argc;
 7285: 	(void)		argv;
 7286: 
 7287: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Start"
 7288: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7289: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7290: #endif
 7291: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7292: 
 7293: 	return AS_Opcode_Write( board_id, tx_buf, 1 );
 7294: }
 7295: 
 7298: static int CMD__AS_Stop( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7299: {
 7300: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[1] = { 0x0B };
 7301: 	(void)		argc;
 7302: 	(void)		argv;
 7303: 
 7304: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Stop"
 7305: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7306: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7307: #endif
 7308: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7309: 
 7310: 	return AS_Opcode_Write( board_id, tx_buf, 1 );
 7311: }
 7312: 
 7315: static int CMD__AS_Rdatac( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7316: {
 7317: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[1] = { 0x10 };
 7318: 	(void)		argc;
 7319: 	(void)		argv;
 7320: 
 7321: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Rdatac"
 7322: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7323: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7324: #endif
 7325: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7326: 
 7327: 	return AS_Opcode_Write( board_id, tx_buf, 1 );
 7328: }
 7329: 
 7332: static int CMD__AS_Sdatac( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7333: {
 7334: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[1] = { 0x11 };
 7335: 	(void)		argc;
 7336: 	(void)		argv;
 7337: 
 7338: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Sdatac"
 7339: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7340: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7341: #endif
 7342: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7343: 
 7344: 	return AS_Opcode_Write( board_id, tx_buf, 1 );
 7345: }
 7346: 
 7349: static int CMD__AS_Rdata( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7350: {
 7351: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[4] = { 0x12, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00 };
 7352: 	uint8_t		rx_buf[4] = { 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00 };
 7353: 	uint32_t	adc_value;
 7354: 	size_t		index;
 7355: 	int			error_code;
 7356: 	(void)		argc;
 7357: 	(void)		argv;
 7358: 
 7359: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Rdata"
 7360: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7361: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7362: #endif
 7363: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7364: 
 7365: 	
 7366: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Override( board_id );
 7367: 	SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Behavior_Set( board_id, CSB_BUFFER );
 7368: 	error_code =  SPI_Data_Write_Read(  board_id,	
 7369: 										1,			
 7370: 										4,			
 7371: 										tx_buf, 	
 7372: 										4, 			
 7373: 										rx_buf 		
 7374: 							  	  	  );
 7375: 	if ( error_code < 0 ) goto CMD__AS_Rdata_Error_Exit;
 7376: 	adc_value = 0;
 7377: 	for ( index = 1; index < 4; index++ )	adc_value = (adc_value << 8 ) + ( (uint32_t) rx_buf[index] );
 7378: 	printf( "0x%08X\n", adc_value );
 7379: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Restore( board_id );
 7380: 	return SUCCESS;
 7381: CMD__AS_Rdata_Error_Exit:
 7382: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Restore( board_id );
 7383: 	return error_code;
 7384: }
 7385: 
 7388: static int AS_Calibration_Value_Write( int board_id, size_t address, uint32_t value )
 7389: {
 7390: 	int			error_code;
 7391: 	size_t 		index;
 7392: 	size_t		object_count;
 7393: 	size_t		count      = 3;
 7394: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7395: 	uint8_t		rx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7396: 
 7397: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "AS_Calibration_Value_Write"
 7398: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7399: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7400: #endif
 7401: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7402: 
 7403: 	for ( index = 0; index < count; index++ )
 7404: 	{
 7405: 		tx_buf[index + 2] = (uint8_t)( value & 0xFF );
 7406: 		value = value >> 8;
 7407: 	}
 7408: 	tx_buf[0] = 0x40;
 7409: 	
 7410: 	address   = 0x0F & address;
 7411: 	tx_buf[0] = tx_buf[0] + ( (uint8_t) address );
 7412: 	tx_buf[1] = tx_buf[1] + ( (uint8_t) count   );
 7413: 	
 7414: 	object_count = count + 2;
 7415: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Override( board_id );
 7416: 	SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Behavior_Set( board_id, CSB_BUFFER );
 7417: 	error_code =  SPI_Data_Write_Read(  board_id,		
 7418: 										1,				
 7419: 										object_count,	
 7420: 										tx_buf, 		
 7421: 										object_count,	
 7422: 										rx_buf 			
 7423: 							  	  	  );
 7424: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Restore( board_id );
 7425: 	return error_code;
 7426: }
 7427: 
 7430: static int AS_Calibration_Value_Read( int board_id, size_t address, uint32_t * value )
 7431: {
 7432: 	int			error_code;
 7433: 	uint32_t	value_temp;
 7434: 	size_t 		index;
 7435: 	size_t		object_count;
 7436: 	size_t		count      = 3;
 7437: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7438: 	uint8_t		rx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7439: 
 7440: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "AS_Calibration_Value_Read"
 7441: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7442: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7443: #endif
 7444: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7445: 
 7446: 	tx_buf[0] = 0x20;
 7447: 	
 7448: 	address = 0x0F & address;
 7449: 	tx_buf[0] = tx_buf[0] + ( (uint8_t) address );
 7450: 	tx_buf[1] = tx_buf[1] + ( (uint8_t) count   );
 7451: 	
 7452: 	object_count = count + 2;
 7453: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Override( board_id );
 7454: 	SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Behavior_Set( board_id, CSB_BUFFER );
 7455: 	error_code =  SPI_Data_Write_Read(  board_id,		
 7456: 										1,				
 7457: 										object_count,	
 7458: 										tx_buf, 		
 7459: 										object_count,	
 7460: 										rx_buf 			
 7461: 							  	  	  );
 7462: 	if ( error_code < 0 ) goto AS_Calibration_Value_Read_Error_Exit;
 7463: 	value_temp = 0;
 7464: 	object_count--;
 7465: 	for ( index = 0; index < count; index++ ) value_temp = ( value_temp << 8 ) + ( (uint32_t) rx_buf[object_count - index] );
 7466: 	*value = value_temp;
 7467: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Restore( board_id );
 7468: 	return SUCCESS;
 7469: AS_Calibration_Value_Read_Error_Exit:
 7470: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Restore( board_id );
 7471: 	return error_code;
 7472: }
 7473: 
 7476: static int AS_Registers_Read( int board_id, size_t address, size_t count, uint8_t * tx_buf, uint8_t * rx_buf )
 7477: {
 7478: 	size_t		object_count;
 7479: 	int			error_code;
 7480: 
 7481: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "AS_Registers_Read"
 7482: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7483: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7484: #endif
 7485: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7486: 
 7487: 	
 7488: 	if ( ( address + count ) > AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY ) return -EC_REGISTER_ADDRESS_EXCEEDED;
 7489: 	
 7490: 	count   = 0x0F & count;
 7491: 	address = 0x0F & address;
 7492: 	tx_buf[0] = 0x20;
 7493: 	tx_buf[0] = tx_buf[0] + ( (uint8_t) address );
 7494: 	tx_buf[1] = tx_buf[1] + ( (uint8_t) count   );
 7495: 
 7496: 	
 7497: 	object_count = count + 2;
 7498: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Override( board_id );
 7499: 	SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Behavior_Set( board_id, CSB_BUFFER );
 7500: 	error_code =  SPI_Data_Write_Read(  board_id,		
 7501: 										1,				
 7502: 										object_count,	
 7503: 										tx_buf, 		
 7504: 										object_count,	
 7505: 										rx_buf 			
 7506: 							  	  	  );
 7507: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Restore( board_id );
 7508: 	return error_code;
 7509: }
 7510: 
 7513: static int AS_Registers_Write( int board_id, size_t address, size_t count, uint8_t * tx_buf, uint8_t * rx_buf )
 7514: {
 7515: 	size_t	object_count;
 7516: 	int		error_code;
 7517: 
 7518: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "AS_Registers_Write"
 7519: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7520: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7521: #endif
 7522: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7523: 
 7524: 	
 7525: 	count   = 0x0F & count;
 7526: 	address = 0x0F & address;
 7527: 	tx_buf[0] = 0x40;
 7528: 	tx_buf[0] = tx_buf[0] + ( (uint8_t) address );
 7529: 	tx_buf[1] = tx_buf[1] + ( (uint8_t) count   );
 7530: 
 7531: 	
 7532: 	object_count = count + 2;
 7533: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Override( board_id );
 7534: 	SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Behavior_Set( board_id, CSB_BUFFER );
 7535: 	error_code =  SPI_Data_Write_Read(  board_id,		
 7536: 										1,				
 7537: 										object_count,	
 7538: 										tx_buf, 		
 7539: 										object_count,	
 7540: 										rx_buf 			
 7541: 							  	  	  );
 7542: 	AS_Chip_Select_Route_Restore( board_id );
 7543: 	return error_code;
 7544: }
 7545: 
 7548: static int CMD__AS_RReg( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7549: {
 7550: 	size_t		count;
 7551: 	size_t		index;
 7552: 	size_t		address;
 7553: 	int			error_code;
 7554: 	BOOL		dump_as_hex;
 7555: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7556: 	uint8_t		rx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7557: 
 7558: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_RReg"
 7559: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7560: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7561: #endif
 7562: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7563: 
 7564: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_SYNTAX;
 7565: 
 7566: 	index = 0;
 7567: 	if ( ( 'a' == argv[0][0] ) || ( 'A' == argv[0][0] ) )
 7568: 	{
 7569: 		count   = AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY;
 7570: 		address = AS_ADS1259_CONFIG0;
 7571: 		index = 1;
 7572: 	}
 7573: 	else
 7574: 	{
 7575: 		if ( argc < 2 ) return -EC_SYNTAX;
 7576: 		
 7577: 		count   = (size_t) strtol( argv[1], NULL, 0 );
 7578: 		error_code = AS_Register_Name_To_Offset( argv[0] );
 7579: 		if ( error_code < 0 )
 7580: 		{
 7581: 			address = (size_t) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 7582: 		}
 7583: 		else
 7584: 		{
 7585: 			address = (size_t) error_code;
 7586: 		}
 7587: 		index = 2;
 7588: 	}
 7589: 
 7590: 	dump_as_hex = false;
 7591: 	if ( argc > index )
 7592: 	{
 7593: 		if ( ( 'h' == argv[index][0] ) || ( 'H' == argv[index][0] ) )
 7594: 		{
 7595: 			dump_as_hex = true;
 7596: 		}
 7597: 	}
 7598: 
 7599: 	error_code = AS_Registers_Read( board_id, address, count, tx_buf, rx_buf );
 7600: 	if ( error_code < 0 ) return error_code;
 7601: 
 7602: 	if ( dump_as_hex )
 7603: 	{
 7604: 		Hex_Dump_Line( (uint16_t) address, count, &(rx_buf[2]), stdout );
 7605: 	}
 7606: 	else
 7607: 	{
 7608: 		for ( index = 0; index < count; index++ )
 7609: 		{
 7610: 			printf( "%s=0x%02X", as_register_name[address + index], rx_buf[index + 2] );
 7611: 			Bit_String_Report( as_bit_string, address + index, rx_buf[index + 2], stdout );
 7612: 			printf( "\n" );
 7613: 		}
 7614: 	}
 7615: 	return SUCCESS;
 7616: }
 7617: 
 7620: static int CMD__AS_WReg( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7621: {
 7622: 	size_t	count;
 7623: 	size_t	index;
 7624: 	size_t	address;
 7625: 	int		error_code;
 7626: 	BOOL	not_done;
 7627: 	uint8_t	tx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7628: 	uint8_t	rx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7629: 
 7630: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_WReg"
 7631: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7632: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7633: #endif
 7634: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7635: 
 7636: 	if ( argc < 2 ) return -EC_SYNTAX;   
 7637: 
 7638: 	index = 0;
 7639: 	if ( ( argv[index][0] >= '0' ) || ( argv[index][0] <= '9' ) )
 7640: 	{ 
 7641: 		address  = (size_t) strtol( argv[index], NULL, 0 );
 7642: 	}
 7643: 	else
 7644: 	{
 7645: 		error_code = AS_Register_Name_To_Offset( argv[index] );
 7646: 		if ( error_code < 0 ) return -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 7647: 		address = (size_t) error_code;
 7648: 	}
 7649: 	index++;
 7650: 
 7651: 	count = 0;
 7652: 	not_done = true;
 7653: 	do
 7654: 	{
 7655: 		tx_buf[count + 2]  = (size_t) strtol( argv[index], NULL, 0 );
 7656: 		count++;
 7657: 		index++;
 7658: 
 7659: 		if ( count >= AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY )
 7660: 		{
 7661: 			not_done   = false;
 7662: 			error_code = -EC_EXTRA_IGNORED;
 7663: 		}
 7664: 		if ( index >= argc ) not_done = false;
 7665: 	} while ( not_done );
 7666: 
 7667: 	error_code = AS_Registers_Write( board_id, address, count, tx_buf, rx_buf );
 7668: 	return error_code;
 7669: }
 7670: 
 7673: static int CMD__AS_Reg_Write_By_Name( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7674: {
 7675: 	size_t	count;
 7676: 	size_t	index;
 7677: 	size_t	address;
 7678: 	size_t	value;
 7679: 	int		error_code;
 7680: 	uint8_t	tx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7681: 	uint8_t	rx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7682: 
 7683: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Reg_Write_By_Name"
 7684: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7685: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7686: #endif
 7687: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7688: 
 7689: 	if ( argc < 2 ) return -EC_SYNTAX;   
 7690: 
 7691: 	index = 0;
 7692: 	while ( ( argc - index ) > 1 )
 7693: 	{
 7694: 		if ( (argc - index) > 1 )
 7695: 		{
 7696: 			if ( ( argv[index][0] >= '0' ) || ( argv[index][0] <= '9' ) )
 7697: 			{ 
 7698: 				address  = (size_t) strtol( argv[index], NULL, 0 );
 7699: 			}
 7700: 			else
 7701: 			{
 7702: 				error_code = AS_Register_Name_To_Offset( argv[index] );
 7703: 				if ( error_code < 0 ) return -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 7704: 				address = (size_t) error_code;
 7705: 			}
 7706: 			index++;
 7707: 
 7708: 			if ( ( argc - index ) > 0 )
 7709: 			{ 
 7710: 				value  = (size_t) strtol( argv[index], NULL, 0 );
 7711: 				tx_buf[2] = (uint8_t) value;
 7712: 				count = 1;
 7713: 				error_code = AS_Registers_Write( board_id, address, count, tx_buf, rx_buf );
 7714: 			}
 7715: 			else
 7716: 			{
 7717: 				return -EC_SYNTAX;
 7718: 			}
 7719: 			index++;
 7720: 		}
 7721: 		else
 7722: 		{
 7723: 			error_code = -EC_SYNTAX;
 7724: 		}
 7725: 	} 
 7726: 
 7727: 	if ( (argc - index) > 0 ) error_code = -EC_EXTRA_IGNORED;
 7728: 	return error_code;
 7729: }
 7730: 
 7733: static int CMD__AS_Ofscal( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7734: {
 7735: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[1] = { 0x18 };
 7736: 	(void)		argc;
 7737: 	(void)		argv;
 7738: 
 7739: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Ofscal"
 7740: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7741: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7742: #endif
 7743: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7744: 
 7745: 	return AS_Opcode_Write( board_id, tx_buf, 1 );
 7746: }
 7747: 
 7750: static int CMD__AS_Gancal( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7751: {
 7752: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[1] = { 0x19 };
 7753: 	(void)		argc;
 7754: 	(void)		argv;
 7755: 
 7756: #define FUNCTION_NAME__  "CMD__AS_Gancal"
 7757: #if ( IO_TRACE_USE_AS_LOGGING == 1 )
 7758: 	IO_Trace_Log_Function( FUNCTION_NAME__, __LINE__, IO_TRACE_AS, board_id, 0 );
 7759: #endif
 7760: #undef FUNCTION_NAME__
 7761: 
 7762: 	return AS_Opcode_Write( board_id, tx_buf, 1 );
 7763: }
 7764: 
 7767: static int CMD__AS_Calibration_Gain( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7768: {
 7769: 	uint32_t	fsc;
 7770: 	int			error_code;
 7771: 
 7772: 	if ( argc > 0 )
 7773: 	{ 
 7774: 		fsc = (uint32_t) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 7775: 		error_code = AS_Calibration_Value_Write( board_id, AS_ADS1259_OFC0, fsc );
 7776: 		if ( error_code < 0 ) return error_code;
 7777: 	}
 7778: 	else
 7779: 	{ 
 7780: 		error_code = AS_Calibration_Value_Read( board_id, AS_ADS1259_OFC0, &fsc );
 7781: 		if ( error_code < 0 ) return error_code;
 7782: 		printf( "Full Scale Calibration (FSC) = 0x%08X, %u\n", fsc, fsc );
 7783: 	}
 7784: 	return SUCCESS;
 7785: }
 7786: 
 7789: static int CMD__AS_Calibration_Offset( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7790: {
 7791: 	uint32_t	ofc;
 7792: 	int			error_code;
 7793: 
 7794: 	if ( argc > 0 )
 7795: 	{ 
 7796: 		ofc = (uint32_t) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 7797: 		error_code = AS_Calibration_Value_Write( board_id, AS_ADS1259_OFC0, ofc );
 7798: 	}
 7799: 	else
 7800: 	{ 
 7801: 		error_code = AS_Calibration_Value_Read( board_id, AS_ADS1259_FSC0, &ofc );
 7802: 		if ( error_code < 0 ) return error_code;
 7803: 		printf( "Offset Calibration (OFC) = 0x%08X, %u\n", ofc, ofc );
 7804: 	}
 7805: 	return SUCCESS;
 7806: }
 7807: 
 7810: static int CMD__AS_Register_Save( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7811: {
 7812: 	int		error_code;
 7813: 	FILE * 	fd;
 7814: 	uint8_t	tx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7815: 	uint8_t	rx_buf[12] = { 0x00 };
 7816: 
 7817: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_SYNTAX;
 7818: 
 7819: 	error_code = AS_Registers_Read( board_id, AS_ADS1259_CONFIG0, AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY, tx_buf, rx_buf );
 7820: 	if ( error_code < 0 ) return error_code;
 7821: 
 7822: 	fd = fopen( argv[0], "w" );
 7823: 	if ( NULL != fd )
 7824: 	{
 7825: 		void * data_pointer = (void *) &(rx_buf[2]);
 7826: 		fwrite( data_pointer, AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY, 1, fd );
 7827: 		fclose( fd );
 7828: 	}
 7829: 	return SUCCESS;
 7830: }
 7831: #if(0)
 7832: 
 7835: static void AS_Register_Defaults( uint8_t * buf, size_t count )
 7836: {
 7837: 	if ( count < AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY ) return;
 7838: 	buf[AS_ADS1259_CONFIG0] = 0x85;
 7839: 	buf[AS_ADS1259_CONFIG1] = 0x10;
 7840: 	buf[AS_ADS1259_CONFIG2] = 0x00;
 7841: 	buf[AS_ADS1259_OFC0] 	= 0x00;
 7842: 	buf[AS_ADS1259_OFC1] 	= 0x00;
 7843: 	buf[AS_ADS1259_OFC2] 	= 0x00;
 7844: 	buf[AS_ADS1259_FSC0] 	= 0x00;
 7845: 	buf[AS_ADS1259_FSC1] 	= 0x00;
 7846: 	buf[AS_ADS1259_FSC2] 	= 0x40;
 7847: }
 7848: #endif
 7849: 
 7852: static int CMD__AS_Register_Load( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7853: {
 7854: 	int		error_code;
 7855: 	FILE * 	fd;
 7856: 	void *  data_pointer = NULL;
 7857: 	uint8_t	tx_buf[12]   = { 0x00 };
 7858: 	uint8_t	rx_buf[12]   = { 0x00 };
 7859: 
 7860: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_SYNTAX;
 7861: 
 7862: 	fd = fopen( argv[0], "r" );
 7863: 	if ( NULL == fd )
 7864: 	{
 7865: 		
 7866: 	}
 7867: 	else
 7868: 	{ 
 7869: 		size_t file_size;
 7870: 		
 7871: 		fseek( fd, 0L, SEEK_END );
 7872: 		file_size = (size_t) ftell( fd );
 7873: 		fseek( fd, 0L, SEEK_SET );
 7874: 		if ( file_size != AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY )
 7875: 		{
 7876: 			
 7877: 		}
 7878: 		else
 7879: 		{	
 7880: 			data_pointer = (void *) &(tx_buf[2]);
 7881: 			fread( data_pointer, AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY, 1, fd );
 7882: 		}
 7883: 		fclose( fd );
 7884: 	}
 7885: 
 7886: 	error_code = AS_Registers_Write( board_id, AS_ADS1259_CONFIG0, AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY, tx_buf, rx_buf );
 7887: 	return error_code;
 7888: }
 7889: 
 7892: static int CMD__AS_Parameter( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 7893: {
 7894: 	int 		error_code = SUCCESS;
 7895:     int     	argc_new;
 7896:     char ** 	argv_new;
 7897: 	int 		index;
 7898: 	uint8_t		tx_buf[12]   = { 0x00 };
 7899: 	uint8_t		rx_buf[12]   = { 0x00 };
 7900: 
 7901: 	if ( argc >= 2 )
 7902: 	{ 
 7903: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( "ofc", argv[0] )  )
 7904: 		{ 
 7905: 			argv_new = &(argv[1]);
 7906: 			argc_new = argc - 1;
 7907: 			error_code = CMD__AS_Calibration_Offset( board_id, argc_new, argv_new );
 7908: 		}
 7909: 		else if ( 0 == strcmpi( "fsc", argv[0] )  )
 7910: 		{ 
 7911: 			argv_new = &(argv[1]);
 7912: 			argc_new = argc - 1;
 7913: 			error_code = CMD__AS_Calibration_Gain( board_id, argc_new, argv_new );
 7914: 		}
 7915: 		else if ( ( index = AS_Register_Name_To_Offset( argv[0] ) ) >= 0 )
 7916: 		{ 
 7917: 			error_code = CMD__AS_Reg_Write_By_Name( board_id, argc, argv );
 7918: 		}
 7919: 		else if ( ( index = Bit_String_Index_By_Name( as_bit_string, argv[0] ) ) >= 0 )
 7920: 		{ 
 7921: 			struct 	bit_string_info * 	bsd; 
 7922: 			size_t  					temp;
 7923: 			uint8_t						mask = 0;
 7924: 			bsd = &(as_bit_string[index]);
 7925: 			error_code = AS_Registers_Read( board_id, bsd->register_offset, 1, tx_buf, rx_buf );
 7926: 			
 7927: 			for ( temp = 0; temp < bsd->bit_width; temp++ ) mask = ( mask << 1 ) | 0x01;
 7928: 			temp = (size_t) strtol( argv[1], NULL, 0 );
 7929: 			temp = temp & mask;
 7930: 			temp = temp << bsd->bit_offset;
 7931: 			rx_buf[2] = rx_buf[2] & ~( mask << bsd->bit_offset );
 7932: 			tx_buf[2] = rx_buf[2] | ( (uint8_t) temp );
 7933: 			error_code = AS_Registers_Write( board_id, bsd->register_offset, 1, tx_buf, rx_buf );
 7934: 		}
 7935: 		else
 7936: 		{
 7937: 			error_code = -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 7938: 		}
 7939: 	}
 7940: 	else if ( argc < 1 )
 7941: 	{ 
 7942: 		argv_new = &(argv[1]);
 7943: 		argc_new = argc - 1;
 7944: 		printf( "Calibration offset: " );
 7945: 		error_code = CMD__AS_Calibration_Offset( board_id, argc_new, argv_new );
 7946: 		if ( error_code < 0 ) goto CMD__AS_PARAMETER_END;
 7947: 		printf( "Calibration gain: " );
 7948: 		error_code = CMD__AS_Calibration_Gain( board_id, argc_new, argv_new );
 7949: 		if ( error_code < 0 ) goto CMD__AS_PARAMETER_END;
 7950: 		printf( "Registers:\n" );
 7951: 		for ( index = 0; index < AS_ADS1259_REGISTER_QTY; index++ )
 7952: 		{
 7953: 			error_code = CMD__AS_RReg( board_id, 1, &(as_register_name[index]) );
 7954: 			if ( error_code < 0 ) goto CMD__AS_PARAMETER_END;
 7955: 		}
 7956: 
 7957: 		printf( "Bit String Parameters:\n" );
 7958: 		index = 0;
 7959: 		while ( NULL != as_bit_string[index].name )
 7960: 		{
 7961: 			struct 	bit_string_info * 	bsd; 
 7962: 			size_t  					i;
 7963: 			uint8_t						mask = 0;
 7964: 			bsd = &(as_bit_string[index]);
 7965: 			error_code = AS_Registers_Read( board_id, bsd->register_offset, 1, tx_buf, rx_buf );
 7966: 			if ( error_code < 0 ) goto CMD__AS_PARAMETER_END;
 7967: 			
 7968: 			for ( i = 0; i < bsd->bit_width; i++ ) mask = ( mask << 1 ) | 0x01;
 7969: 			rx_buf[2] = rx_buf[2] >> bsd->bit_offset;
 7970: 			rx_buf[2] = rx_buf[2] & mask;
 7971: 			printf( " %8s = %d\n", bsd->name, (int) rx_buf[2] );
 7972: 
 7973: 			index++;
 7974: 		}
 7975: 	}
 7976: 	else
 7977: 	{ 
 7978: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( "ofc", argv[0] )  )
 7979: 		{ 
 7980: 			argv_new = &(argv[1]);
 7981: 			argc_new = argc - 1;
 7982: 			error_code = CMD__AS_Calibration_Offset( board_id, argc_new, argv_new );
 7983: 		}
 7984: 		else if ( 0 == strcmpi( "fsc", argv[0] )  )
 7985: 		{ 
 7986: 			argv_new = &(argv[1]);
 7987: 			argc_new = argc - 1;
 7988: 			error_code = CMD__AS_Calibration_Gain( board_id, argc_new, argv_new );
 7989: 		}
 7990: 		else if ( ( index = AS_Register_Name_To_Offset( argv[0] ) ) >= 0 )
 7991: 		{ 
 7992: 			error_code = CMD__AS_RReg( board_id, argc, argv );
 7993: 		}
 7994: 		else if ( ( index = Bit_String_Index_By_Name( as_bit_string, argv[0] ) ) >= 0 )
 7995: 		{ 
 7996: 			struct 	bit_string_info * 	bsd; 
 7997: 			size_t  					i;
 7998: 			uint8_t						mask = 0;
 7999: 			bsd = &(as_bit_string[index]);
 8000: 			error_code = AS_Registers_Read( board_id, bsd->register_offset, 1, tx_buf, rx_buf );
 8001: 			if ( error_code < 0 ) goto CMD__AS_PARAMETER_END;
 8002: 			
 8003: 			for ( i = 0; i < bsd->bit_width; i++ ) mask = ( mask << 1 ) | 0x01;
 8004: 			rx_buf[2] = rx_buf[2] >> bsd->bit_offset;
 8005: 			rx_buf[2] = rx_buf[2] & mask;
 8006: 			printf( "%8s = %d\n", bsd->name, (int) rx_buf[2] );
 8007: 		}
 8008: 		else
 8009: 		{
 8010: 			error_code = -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 8011: 		}
 8012: 	}
 8013: CMD__AS_PARAMETER_END:
 8014: 	return error_code;
 8015: }
 8016: 
 8017: 
 8021: static struct command_line_board  cmd_as[] =
 8022: {
 8023: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Wakeup, 			"wakeup",		"ADS1259 exit sleep mode"									},
 8024: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Sleep,				"sleep",		"ADS1259 enter sleep mode"									},
 8025: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Reset,				"reset",		"ADS1259 register and filter reset"							},
 8026: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Start,				"start",		"ADS1259 start conversion(s)" 								},
 8027: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Stop,				"stop",			"ADS1259 stop conversions"		 							},
 8028: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Rdatac,				"rdatac",		"ADS1259 set read data continuous mode"						},
 8029: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Sdatac,				"sdatac",		"ADS1259 stop read data continuous mode"					},
 8030: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Rdata,				"rdata",		"ADS1259 read data in stop continuous mode"					},
 8031: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_RReg,				"rreg",			"ADS1259 read N registers, rreg <address> <count>"			},
 8032: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_WReg,				"wreg",			"ADS1259 write N registers, wreg <adress> <value> [<value>]"},
 8033: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Ofscal,				"ofscal",		"ADS1259 perform offset calibration, apply zero input"		},
 8034: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Gancal,				"gancal",		"ADS1259 perform full-scale calibration, apply full-scale"  },
 8035: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Reg_Write_By_Name,	"wrn",			"Write one or more registers by name, wrn <name> <value>"	},
 8036: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Calibration_Gain,	"fsc",			"read/write fullscale calibration"							},
 8037: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Calibration_Offset,	"ofc",			"read/write offset calibration"								},
 8038: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Register_Save,		"rsave",		"save all registers to a file"								},
 8039: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Register_Load,		"rload",		"restore all registers from file"							},
 8040: 	{	NULL,	CMD__AS_Parameter,			"param",		"read/write parameter"										},
 8041: 	{	NULL,	NULL,						NULL,			NULL														},
 8042: };
 8043: 
 8049: int Command_Line_Analog_Stick( int board_id, int argc, char* argv[] )
 8050: {
 8051: 	int 		error_code;
 8052: 	int 		index;
 8053:     int     	argc_new;
 8054:     char ** 	argv_new;
 8055: 
 8056:     error_code = -EC_SYNTAX;
 8057: 
 8058: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 8059: 
 8060: 	index = 0;
 8061: 	while ( NULL != cmd_as[index].cmd_fnc )
 8062: 	{
 8063: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( cmd_as[index].name, argv[0] )  )
 8064: 		{
 8065: 			argv_new = &(argv[1]);
 8066: 			argc_new = argc - 1;
 8067: 			if ( 0 == argc_new ) argv_new = NULL;
 8068: 
 8069: 			{ 
 8070: 				struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 8071: 				dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 8072: 				if ( IO_TRACE_START_AS == dataset->trace.start )
 8073: 				{
 8074: 					dataset->trace.active = true;
 8075: 				}
 8076: 			}
 8077: 
 8078: 			error_code = (* cmd_as[index].cmd_fnc )( board_id, argc_new, argv_new );
 8079: 			break;
 8080: 		}
 8081: 		index++;
 8082: 	}
 8083: 	return error_code;
 8084: }
 8085: 
 8086: 
 8087: 
 8088: 
 8089: 
 8090: 
 8091: 
 8092: 
 8098: static int CMD__FRAM_Dump( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8099: { 
 8100: 	uint16_t address;
 8101: 	uint16_t length;
 8102: 
 8103: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_PARAMETER;
 8104: 
 8105: 	address = (uint16_t) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 8106: 	if ( address > ( FRAM_DENSITY_BYTES - 1 ) ) return -EC_FRAM_ADDRESS_RANGE;
 8107: 
 8108: 	if ( argc < 2 ) length = HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE;
 8109: 	else		    length  = (uint16_t) strtol( argv[1], NULL, 0 );
 8110: 
 8111: 	if ( ( address + length ) > FRAM_DENSITY_BYTES ) length = FRAM_DENSITY_BYTES - address;
 8112: 
 8113: 	return FRAM_Report( board_id, address, length, stdout );
 8114: }
 8115: 
 8121: static int CMD__FRAM_Save( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8122: { 
 8123: 	int			error_code;
 8124: 	uint16_t 	address;
 8125: 	size_t 		length;
 8126: 	FILE *   	out;
 8127: 
 8128: 	if ( argc < 3 ) return -EC_PARAMETER;
 8129: 
 8130: 	address = (uint16_t) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 8131: 	if ( address > ( FRAM_DENSITY_BYTES - 1 ) ) return -EC_FRAM_ADDRESS_RANGE;
 8132: 
 8133: 	length  = (uint16_t) strtol( argv[1], NULL, 0 );
 8134: 	if ( (address + length - 1) > ( FRAM_DENSITY_BYTES - 1 ) ) return -EC_FRAM_ADDRESS_RANGE;
 8135: 	out = fopen( argv[2], "w" );
 8136: 	error_code = FRAM_Memory_To_File( board_id, address, length, out );
 8137: 	fclose( out );
 8138: 	return error_code;
 8139: }
 8140: 
 8146: static int CMD__FRAM_Load( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8147: { 
 8148: 	int			error_code;
 8149: 	uint16_t 	address;
 8150: 
 8151: 	FILE *   	out;
 8152: 
 8153: 	if ( argc < 2 ) return -EC_PARAMETER;
 8154: 
 8155: 	address = (uint16_t) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 8156: 	if ( address > ( FRAM_DENSITY_BYTES - 1 ) ) return -EC_FRAM_ADDRESS_RANGE;
 8157: 	out = fopen( argv[2], "r" );
 8158: 	error_code = FRAM_File_To_Memory( board_id, address, 0 , out );
 8159: 	fclose( out );
 8160: 	return error_code;
 8161: }
 8162: 
 8168: static int CMD__FRAM_Write( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8169: { 
 8170: 	int			error_code;
 8171: 	size_t		count;
 8172: 	uint16_t 	address;
 8173: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 8174: 	dataset    = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 8175: 
 8176: 	if ( argc < 2 ) return -EC_PARAMETER;
 8177: 
 8178: 	address = (uint16_t) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 8179: 	if ( address > ( FRAM_DENSITY_BYTES - 1 ) ) return -EC_FRAM_ADDRESS_RANGE;
 8180: 
 8181: 	error_code = CMD__SPI_Data_Interpreter( 	1, 
 8182: 												argc,
 8183: 												argv,
 8184: 												FRAM_BLOCK_SIZE,
 8185: 												&count,
 8186: 												dataset->spi.fram_block
 8187: 											  );
 8188: 	if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) goto CMD__FRAM_Write_Error_Exit;
 8189: 	error_code = FRAM__Memory_Write( board_id, address, count, dataset->spi.fram_block );
 8190: CMD__FRAM_Write_Error_Exit:
 8191: 	return error_code;
 8192: }
 8193: 
 8199: static int CMD__FRAM_Init( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8200: { 
 8201: 	int			error_code;
 8202: 
 8203: 	size_t		tx_size_in_bytes;
 8204: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 8205: 	dataset    = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 8206: 
 8207: 	
 8208: 	if ( argc < 1 )
 8209: 	{ 
 8210: 		error_code = FRAM_Set( board_id, 0, NULL );
 8211: 	}
 8212: 	else
 8213: 	{
 8214: 		CMD__SPI_Data_Interpreter(		0, 					
 8215: 										argc,
 8216: 										argv,
 8217: 										FRAM_BLOCK_SIZE,
 8218: 										&tx_size_in_bytes,
 8219: 										dataset->spi.fram_block
 8220: 									 );
 8221: 
 8222: #if defined( IDI_FRAM_PRINT_DEBUG )
 8223: 
 8224: {
 8225: 	size_t display_count;
 8226: 
 8227: 	if ( tx_size_in_bytes > HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE ) display_count = HEX_DUMP_BYTES_PER_LINE;
 8228: 	else                                              display_count = tx_size_in_bytes;
 8229: 
 8230: 	Hex_Dump_Line( 0, display_count, dataset->spi.fram_block, stdout );
 8231: }
 8232: #endif
 8233: 		error_code = FRAM_Set( board_id, tx_size_in_bytes, dataset->spi.fram_block );
 8234: 	}
 8235: 	return error_code;
 8236: }
 8237: 
 8243: static int CMD__FRAM_WREN( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8244: { 
 8245: 	(void) 		argc;
 8246: 	(void) 		argv;
 8247: 	return FRAM__Write_Enable_Latch_Set( board_id );
 8248: }
 8249: 
 8255: static int CMD__FRAM_WRDI( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8256: { 
 8257: 	(void) 		argc;
 8258: 	(void) 		argv;
 8259: 	return FRAM__Write_Disable( board_id );
 8260: }
 8261: 
 8267: static int CMD__FRAM_RDSR( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8268: { 
 8269: 	int 		error_code;
 8270: 	uint8_t 	status;
 8271: 	(void) 		argc;
 8272: 	(void) 		argv;
 8273: 	error_code = FRAM__Read_Status_Register( board_id, &status );
 8274: 	printf( "FRAM STATUS: 0x%02X\n", ((int) status) );
 8275: 	return error_code;
 8276: }
 8277: 
 8283: static int CMD__FRAM_WRSR( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8284: { 
 8285: 
 8286: 	uint8_t status;
 8287: 
 8288: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_PARAMETER;
 8289: 	status = (uint8_t) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 8290: 	return FRAM__Write_Status_Register( board_id, status );
 8291: }
 8292: 
 8298: static int CMD__FRAM_RDID( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8299: { 
 8300: 	uint32_t 	id;
 8301: 	(void) 		argc;
 8302: 	(void) 		argv;
 8303: 	FRAM__Read_ID( board_id, &id );
 8304: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8305: 	printf( "FRAM ID: 0x%08lX\n", id );
 8306: #else
 8307: 	printf( "FRAM ID: 0x%08X\n", id );
 8308: #endif
 8309: 	return SUCCESS;
 8310: }
 8311: 
 8315: static struct command_line_board  cmd_fram[] =
 8316: {
 8317: 	{	NULL,	CMD__FRAM_Dump, 	"dump",		"params: <address> <length>"							},
 8318: 	{	NULL,	CMD__FRAM_Save,		"save",		"params: <address> <length> <binary destination file>"	},
 8319: 	{	NULL,	CMD__FRAM_Load,		"load",		"params: <address> <binary source file name>"			},
 8320: 	{	NULL,	CMD__FRAM_Write,	"write",	"params: <address> <data list: bytes/characters/strings>" },
 8321: 	{	NULL,	CMD__FRAM_Init,		"init",		"params: [byte/character] [byte/character] ..."		 	},
 8322: 	{	NULL,	CMD__FRAM_WREN,		"wren",		"WRite Enable Latch Set"								},
 8323: 	{	NULL,	CMD__FRAM_WRDI,		"wrdi",		"WRite DIsable"											},
 8324: 	{	NULL,	CMD__FRAM_RDSR,		"rdsr",		"ReaD Status Register"									},
 8325: 	{	NULL,	CMD__FRAM_WRSR,		"wrsr",		"WRite Status Register.  Params: <status>"				},
 8326: 	{	NULL,	CMD__FRAM_RDID,		"rdid",		"ReaD ID Register"										},
 8327: 	{	NULL,	NULL,				NULL,		NULL													},
 8328: };
 8329: 
 8335: int Command_Line_FRAM( int board_id, int argc, char* argv[] )
 8336: {
 8337: 	int 		error_code;
 8338: 	int 		index;
 8339:     int     	argc_new;
 8340:     char ** 	argv_new;
 8341: 
 8342:     error_code = -EC_SYNTAX;
 8343: 
 8344: 	if ( argc < 1 ) return -EC_NOT_FOUND;
 8345: 
 8346: 	index = 0;
 8347: 	while ( NULL != cmd_fram[index].cmd_fnc )
 8348: 	{
 8349: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( cmd_fram[index].name, argv[0] )  )
 8350: 		{
 8351: 			argv_new = &(argv[1]);
 8352: 			argc_new = argc - 1;
 8353: 			if ( 0 == argc_new ) argv_new = NULL;
 8354: 
 8355: 			{ 
 8356: 				struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 8357: 				dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 8358: 				if ( IO_TRACE_START_FRAM == dataset->trace.start )
 8359: 				{
 8360: 					dataset->trace.active = true;
 8361: 				}
 8362: 			}
 8363: 
 8364: 			error_code = (* cmd_fram[index].cmd_fnc )( board_id, argc_new, argv_new );
 8365: 			break;
 8366: 		}
 8367: 		index++;
 8368: 	}
 8369: 	return error_code;
 8370: }
 8371: 
 8372: 
 8373: typedef enum
 8374: {
 8375: 	TEST_STATE_INIT 		= 0x000,
 8376: 	TEST_STATE_READY		= 0x100,
 8377: 	TEST_STATE_ACTIVE		= 0x200,
 8378: 	TEST_STATE_COMPLETE		= 0xF00,
 8379: 	TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR	= 0xF10,
 8380: 	TEST_STATE_QUIT_USER	= 0xF20,
 8381: 	TEST_STATE_QUIT			= 0xFFF
 8382: } TEST_STATE_ENUM;
 8383: 
 8384: 
 8385: 
 8386: 
 8387: 
 8388: 
 8389: 
 8390: 
 8391: 
 8400: int IDO_DOUT_ID_Get( int board_id, uint16_t * id )
 8401: {
 8402: 	uint8_t   	lsb, msb;
 8403: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
 8404: 	dataset = (struct board_dataset *) board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 8405: 
 8406: 	if ( MODE_JUMPERS_0 == dataset->mode_jumpers )
 8407: 	{ 
 8408: 		return -EC_MODE_LEGACY;
 8409: 	}
 8410: 
 8411: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, __LINE__, IDO_ID_LSB, &lsb );
 8412: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, __LINE__, IDO_ID_MSB, &msb );
 8413: 	*id = ( ((uint16_t) msb) << 8 ) | ((uint16_t) lsb);
 8414: #if defined( ID_ALWAYS_REPORT_AS_GOOD )
 8415: 	*id = ID_DOUT;
 8416: #endif
 8417: 	return SUCCESS;
 8418: }
 8419: 
 8427: BOOL IDO_DOUT_IsNotPresent( int board_id )
 8428: {
 8429: 	uint16_t id;
 8430: 	IDO_DOUT_ID_Get( board_id, &id );
 8431: 	if (ID_DOUT == id ) return 0;
 8432: 	return 1;
 8433: }
 8434: 
 8444: int IDO_DO_Channel_Get( int board_id, size_t channel, BOOL * value )
 8445: {
 8446: 	size_t 	group;
 8447: 	size_t 	bit;
 8448: 	uint8_t reg_value;
 8449: 
 8450: 	group = channel >> IDO_DO_SHIFT_RIGHT;
 8451: 	bit   = channel - group * IDO_DO_GROUP_SIZE;
 8452: 
 8453: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, __LINE__, IDO_DO_GROUP0 + group , &reg_value );
 8454: 
 8455: 	if ( 0 != ( reg_value & ( 0x01 << bit ) ) ) *value = true;
 8456: 	else                                        *value = false;
 8457: 
 8458: 	return SUCCESS;
 8459: }
 8460: 
 8470: int IDO_DO_Channel_Set( int board_id, size_t channel, BOOL value )
 8471: {
 8472: 	size_t 	group;
 8473: 	size_t 	bit;
 8474: 	uint8_t reg_value;
 8475: 	uint8_t mask;
 8476: 
 8477: 	group = channel >> IDO_DO_SHIFT_RIGHT;
 8478: 	bit   = channel - group * IDO_DO_GROUP_SIZE;
 8479: 
 8480: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, __LINE__, IDO_DO_GROUP0 + group , &reg_value );
 8481: 	mask = 0x01 << bit;
 8482: 	if ( true == value ) reg_value |=  mask;
 8483: 	else				 reg_value &= ~mask;
 8484: 
 8485: 	IO_Write_U8( board_id, __LINE__, IDO_DO_GROUP0 + group , reg_value );
 8486: 	return SUCCESS;
 8487: }
 8488: 
 8498: int IDO_DO_Group_Get( int board_id, size_t group, uint8_t * value )
 8499: {
 8500: 	IO_Read_U8( board_id, __LINE__, IDO_DO_GROUP0 + group , value );
 8501: 	return SUCCESS;
 8502: }
 8503: 
 8513: int IDO_DO_Group_Set( int board_id, size_t group, uint8_t value )
 8514: {
 8515: 	IO_Write_U8( board_id, __LINE__, IDO_DO_GROUP0 + group , value );
 8516: 	return SUCCESS;
 8517: }
 8518: 
 8519: 
 8523: static int Print_Byte_List(	const char * prefix_string,	
 8524: 							int			 argc,			
 8525: 							char ** 	 argv,			
 8526: 							size_t 		 list_count, 	
 8527: 							uint8_t * 	 list, 			
 8528: 							FILE * 		 out			
 8529: 						  )
 8530: {
 8531: 	enum { MODE_NONE = 0, MODE_BINARY = 1, MODE_HEX = 2, MODE_ALL = 3 } mode_out;
 8532: 	int		group;
 8533: 
 8534: 	mode_out = MODE_ALL;
 8535: 	if ( NULL == argv )
 8536: 	{
 8537: 		mode_out = MODE_ALL;
 8538: 	}
 8539: 	else
 8540: 	{
 8541: 		int index;
 8542: 		for ( index = 0; index < argc; index++ )
 8543: 		{
 8544: 			if      ( 0    == strcmpi( "binary", argv[index] ) ) mode_out |= MODE_BINARY;
 8545: 			else if ( 0    == strcmpi( "group",  argv[index] ) ) mode_out |= MODE_HEX;
 8546: 			else if ( 0    == strcmpi( "hex",    argv[index] ) ) mode_out |= MODE_HEX;
 8547: 			else                                                 mode_out |= MODE_ALL;
 8548: 		}
 8549: 	}
 8550: 
 8551: 	if ( MODE_BINARY == ( mode_out & MODE_BINARY ) )
 8552: 	{ 
 8553: 		int		cp;
 8554: 		int 	channel;
 8555: 		uint8_t mask;
 8556: 		char  	message[64];
 8557: 
 8558: 		cp    = 0;
 8559: 		group = 0;
 8560: 		for ( group = 0; group < list_count; group++ )
 8561: 		{
 8562: 			mask = 0x01;
 8563: 			for ( channel = 0; channel < 8; channel++ )
 8564: 			{
 8565: 				message[cp++] = !!(list[group] & mask) ? '1' : '0';
 8566: 				mask = mask << 1;
 8567: 			}
 8568: 			message[cp++] = ' ';
 8569: 		}
 8570: 		message[cp] = '\0';
 8571: 		fprintf( out, "%s: %s\n", prefix_string, message );
 8572: 	}
 8573: 
 8574: 	if ( MODE_HEX == ( mode_out & MODE_HEX ) )
 8575: 	{
 8576: 		fprintf( out, "%s:", prefix_string );
 8577: 		for ( group = 0; group < list_count; group++ ) fprintf( out, " %02X", list[group] );
 8578: 		fprintf( out, "\n" );
 8579: 	}
 8580: 
 8581: 	return SUCCESS;
 8582: }
 8583: 
 8584: #if ( IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY == IDI_DIN_GROUP_QTY )
 8585: 
 8586: 
 8587: 
 8591: static int IDO48_IDI48_Loopback_Test( int di_id, int do_id, uint8_t * di_list, uint8_t * do_list, size_t count )
 8592: {
 8593: 	int group;
 8594: 	for( group = 0; group < count; group++ )
 8595: 	{
 8596: 		IDO_DO_Group_Get(  do_id, group, &(do_list[group]) );
 8597: 		IDI_DIN_Group_Get( di_id, group, &(di_list[group]) );
 8598: 		if ( di_list[group] != do_list[group] ) return -group;
 8599: 	}
 8600: 	return SUCCESS;
 8601: }
 8602: 
 8605: static int CMD__IDO48_IDI48_Loopback( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8606: {
 8607: 	int				error_code;
 8608: 	struct  ido_dataset *  dataset;
 8609: 	FILE * 			out;
 8610: 	char * 			file_name;
 8611: 	TEST_STATE_ENUM state;
 8612: 	size_t			group;
 8613: 	size_t			channel;
 8614: 	BOOL			di_value;
 8615: 	BOOL			do_value;
 8616: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8617: 	size_t			wait_ms;
 8618: #endif
 8619: 	uint8_t			do_list[IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY];
 8620: 	uint8_t			di_list[IDI_DIN_GROUP_QTY];
 8621: 	uint8_t			dog[IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY];
 8622: 	char * 			mode_string[] = { "binary" };
 8623: 	char 			out_default[] = { "stdout" };
 8624: 	char *			msg; 
 8625: 
 8626: 	state = TEST_STATE_INIT;
 8627: 	dataset = NULL;
 8628: 	switch( board_id )
 8629: 	{
 8630: 		case ID_IDO48:
 8631: 			dataset = ( struct ido_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
 8632: 			break;
 8633: 		default:
 8634: 			return -EC_BOARD_TYPE;
 8635: 	}
 8636: 
 8637: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8638: 	wait_ms = 100; 
 8639: #endif
 8640: 	out       = stdout;
 8641: 	file_name = out_default;
 8642: 	if ( argc > 0 )
 8643: 	{
 8644: 		size_t  wi;		
 8645: 		char 	open_method[4];
 8646: 		wi = 0;
 8647: 		strcpy( open_method, "wt" );
 8648: 		if (  ( 0 == strcmpi( "--a",      argv[wi] ) )  ||
 8649: 			  ( 0 == strcmpi( "--append", argv[wi] ) )   )
 8650: 		{
 8651: 			wi++;
 8652: 			strcpy( open_method, "at" );
 8653: 		}
 8654: 
 8655: 		if ( argc > wi )
 8656: 		{
 8657: 			out = fopen( argv[wi], open_method );
 8658: 			file_name = argv[wi];
 8659: 		}
 8660: 	}
 8661: 
 8662: 
 8666: 
 8667: 	msg = &(dataset->message[0]);
 8668: 	sprintf( msg, "======================================= " );
 8669: 	Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8670: 	Time_Current_String( msg, MESSAGE_SIZE );
 8671: 	Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8672: 
 8673: 	sprintf( msg, "\nIDO48-IDI48 loopback test: %s", file_name );
 8674: 	Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8675: 
 8676: 	
 8677: 	for( group = 0; group < IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY; group++ )
 8678: 	{
 8679: 		do_list[group] = 0x00; 
 8680: 		IDO_DO_Group_Set(  board_id, group, do_list[group]    );
 8681: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8682: 		delay( wait_ms );
 8683: #endif
 8684: 		IDI_DIN_Group_Get( ID_IDI48, group, &(di_list[group]) );
 8685: 	}
 8686: 	error_code =  IDO48_IDI48_Loopback_Test( ID_IDI48, board_id, di_list, do_list, IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY );
 8687: 	if ( error_code < 0 )
 8688: 	{
 8689: 		state = TEST_STATE_QUIT;
 8690: 	}
 8691: 
 8692: 	state = TEST_STATE_ACTIVE;
 8693: 	channel = 0;
 8694: 	while ( TEST_STATE_ACTIVE == state )
 8695: 	{
 8696: 
 8697: 		
 8698: 		do_value = true;
 8699: 		IDO_DO_Channel_Set(  board_id, channel, do_value  );
 8700: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8701: 		delay( wait_ms );
 8702: #endif
 8703: 		IDI_DIN_Channel_Get( ID_IDI48, channel, &di_value );
 8704: 
 8705: 		if ( do_value != di_value )
 8706: 		{
 8707: 			state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR;
 8708: 		}
 8709: 		error_code =  IDO48_IDI48_Loopback_Test( ID_IDI48, board_id, di_list, do_list, IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY );
 8710: 		if ( error_code < 0 )
 8711: 		{
 8712: 			state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR;
 8713: 		}
 8714: 
 8715: 		
 8716: 		do_value = false;
 8717: 		IDO_DO_Channel_Set(  board_id, channel, do_value  );
 8718: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8719: 		delay( wait_ms );
 8720: #endif
 8721: 		IDI_DIN_Channel_Get( ID_IDI48, channel, &di_value );
 8722: 
 8723: 		if ( do_value != di_value )
 8724: 		{
 8725: 			state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR;
 8726: 		}
 8727: 		error_code =  IDO48_IDI48_Loopback_Test( ID_IDI48, board_id, di_list, do_list, IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY );
 8728: 		if ( error_code < 0 )
 8729: 		{
 8730: 			state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR;
 8731: 		}
 8732: 
 8733: 
 8734: 		{ 
 8735: 			size_t index;
 8736: 			uint8_t	do_group[IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY];
 8737: 
 8738: 			for ( index = 0; index < IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY; index++ )
 8739: 			{
 8740: 				do_group[index] = 0xFF;
 8741: 				IDO_DO_Group_Set( board_id, index, do_group[index] );
 8742: 			}
 8743: 	#if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8744: 		delay( wait_ms );
 8745: 	#endif
 8746: 			error_code =  IDO48_IDI48_Loopback_Test( ID_IDI48, board_id, di_list, do_list, IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY );
 8747: 			if ( error_code < 0 )
 8748: 			{
 8749: 				sprintf( msg, "All high fail" );
 8750: 				Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8751: 				state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR;
 8752: 			}
 8753: 			else
 8754: 			{
 8755: 				for ( index = 0; index < IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY; index++ )
 8756: 				{
 8757: 					do_group[index] = 0x00;
 8758: 					IDO_DO_Group_Set( board_id, index, do_group[index] );
 8759: 				}
 8760: 			}
 8761: 		}
 8762: 
 8763: 
 8764: 		if ( true == Character_Get( NULL ) ) state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_USER;
 8765: 
 8766: 		if ( TEST_STATE_ACTIVE == state )
 8767: 		{
 8768: 			channel++;
 8769: 			sprintf( msg, "." );
 8770: 			Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8771: 			if ( channel >= IDO_DO_QTY ) state = TEST_STATE_COMPLETE;
 8772: 		}
 8773: 	}
 8774: 
 8775: 
 8776: 	sprintf( msg, "[PATTERN_INVERT]" );
 8777: 	Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8778: 	channel = 0;
 8779: 	if ( TEST_STATE_COMPLETE == state )  state = TEST_STATE_ACTIVE;
 8780: 	while ( TEST_STATE_ACTIVE == state )
 8781: 	{
 8782: 		{ 
 8783: 			size_t index;
 8784: 
 8785: 			for ( index = 0; index < IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY; index++ )
 8786: 			{
 8787: 				IDO_DO_Group_Set( board_id, index, 0xFF );
 8788: 			}
 8789: 	#if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8790: 		delay( wait_ms );
 8791: 	#endif
 8792: 			error_code =  IDO48_IDI48_Loopback_Test( ID_IDI48, board_id, di_list, do_list, IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY );
 8793: 			if ( error_code < 0 )
 8794: 			{
 8795: 				sprintf( msg, "All high fail" );
 8796: 				Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8797: 				state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR;
 8798: 			}
 8799: 		}
 8800: 
 8801: 		
 8802: 		do_value = false;
 8803: 		IDO_DO_Channel_Set(  board_id, channel, do_value  );
 8804: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8805: 		delay( wait_ms );
 8806: #endif
 8807: 		IDI_DIN_Channel_Get( ID_IDI48, channel, &di_value );
 8808: 
 8809: 		if ( do_value != di_value )
 8810: 		{
 8811: 			state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR;
 8812: 		}
 8813: 		error_code =  IDO48_IDI48_Loopback_Test( ID_IDI48, board_id, di_list, do_list, IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY );
 8814: 		if ( error_code < 0 )
 8815: 		{
 8816: 			state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR;
 8817: 		}
 8818: 
 8819: 		
 8820: 		do_value = true;
 8821: 		IDO_DO_Channel_Set(  board_id, channel, do_value  );
 8822: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8823: 		delay( wait_ms );
 8824: #endif
 8825: 		IDI_DIN_Channel_Get( ID_IDI48, channel, &di_value );
 8826: 
 8827: 		if ( do_value != di_value )
 8828: 		{
 8829: 			state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR;
 8830: 		}
 8831: 		error_code =  IDO48_IDI48_Loopback_Test( ID_IDI48, board_id, di_list, do_list, IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY );
 8832: 		if ( error_code < 0 )
 8833: 		{
 8834: 			state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR;
 8835: 		}
 8836: 
 8837: 		if ( true == Character_Get( NULL ) ) state = TEST_STATE_QUIT_USER;
 8838: 
 8839: 		if ( TEST_STATE_ACTIVE == state )
 8840: 		{
 8841: 			channel++;
 8842: 			sprintf( msg, "." );
 8843: 			Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8844: 			if ( channel >= IDO_DO_QTY ) state = TEST_STATE_COMPLETE;
 8845: 		}
 8846: 	}
 8847: 
 8848: 
 8849: 	{ 
 8850: 		size_t index;
 8851: 		for ( index = 0; index < IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY; index++ )
 8852: 		{
 8853: 			IDO_DO_Group_Set( board_id, index, 0x00 );
 8854: 		}
 8855: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8856: 	delay( wait_ms );
 8857: #endif
 8858: 	}
 8859: 
 8860: 
 8861: 	sprintf( msg, "\n" );
 8862: 	Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8863: 	switch( state )
 8864: 	{
 8865: 		case TEST_STATE_COMPLETE:
 8866: 			sprintf( msg, "PASS\n" );
 8867: 			Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8868: 			error_code = SUCCESS;
 8869: 			break;
 8870: 		case TEST_STATE_QUIT_ERROR:
 8871: 			sprintf( msg, "FAIL at channel %d\n", (int) channel );
 8872: 			Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8873: 			error_code = EC_TEST_FAIL;
 8874: 			
 8875: 			for( group = 0; group < IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY; group++ )
 8876: 			{
 8877: 				IDO_DO_Group_Get( board_id, group, &(dog[group]) );
 8878: 			}
 8879: 			Print_Byte_List( "DO:",				
 8880: 							 1,					
 8881: 							 mode_string,		
 8882: 							 IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY,	
 8883: 							 dog,				
 8884: 							 stdout				
 8885: 						   );
 8886: 
 8887: 			if ( out != stdout )
 8888: 			{
 8889: 				Print_Byte_List( "DO:",				
 8890: 								 1,					
 8891: 								 mode_string,		
 8892: 								 IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY,	
 8893: 								 dog,				
 8894: 								 out				
 8895: 							   );
 8896: 			}
 8897: 			break;
 8898: 		case TEST_STATE_QUIT_USER:
 8899: 			sprintf( msg, "CANCEL BY USER at channel %d\n", (int) channel );
 8900: 			Print_Multiple( msg, out );
 8901: 			error_code = EC_TEST_FAIL;
 8902: 			break;
 8903: 		default: 
 8904: 			break;
 8905: 	}
 8906: 	if ( out != stdout ) fclose( out );
 8907: 	return error_code;
 8908: }
 8909: 
 8910: #endif
 8911: 
 8915: static int CMD__IDO48_DOUT_Test_Alternate( int board_id, int argc, char * argv[] )
 8916: {
 8917: 	TEST_STATE_ENUM state;
 8918: 	size_t			group;
 8919: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8920: 	size_t			delay_normal_ms;
 8921: 	size_t			delay_inverted_ms;
 8922: #endif
 8923: 	uint8_t			pattern;
 8924: 	uint8_t			dog[IDO_DO_GROUP_QTY];
 8925: 	char *			mode_string[] = { "binary" };
 8926: 
 8927: 	state = TEST_STATE_INIT;
 8928: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
 8929: 	delay_normal_ms  = 100;			
 8930: 	delay_inverted_ms =  20;			
 8931: #endif
 8932: 	pattern		 = 0x55;		
 8933: 
 8934: 	if ( argc > 0 )
 8935: 	{
 8936: 		pattern = (uint8_t) strtol( argv[0], NULL, 0 );
 8937: 	}
 8938:
