11927: 	(void) 	argc;
11928: 	(void) 	argv;
11929: 
11930: 	global_loop_space = true;
11931: 	return SUCCESS;
11932: }
11933: 
11937: static struct command_line  cmd_loop[] =
11938: {
11939: 	{	NULL,	Command_Line_Loop_Count,			"count",	"loop for N counts"								},
11940: 	{	NULL,	Command_Line_Loop_Delay,			"delay",	"loop with delay <milliseconds>"				},
11941: 	{	NULL,	Command_Line_Loop_Space,			"space",	"loop each time space bar pressed"				},
11942: 	{	NULL,	NULL,								NULL,		NULL											},
11943: 
11944: };
11945: 
11949: static int Command_Line_Prefix_Loop( int   argc,   	
11950: 									 char* argv[] 	
11951: 								   )
11952: {
11953: 	int 	error_code;
11954: 	int     index;
11955: 	int		ai;
11956: 	
11957:     int     argc_new;
11958:     char ** argv_new;
11959: 
11960:     global_loop_command = true;
11961: 	
11962: 	index     = 0;
11963: 	ai		  = 0;
11964: 	while ( NULL != cmd_loop[index].cmd_fnc )
11965: 	{
11966: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( cmd_loop[index].name, argv[ai] )  )
11967: 		{
11968: 			
11969: 			argv_new = &(argv[ai + 1]);
11970: 			argc_new = argc - (ai + 1);
11971: 			if ( 0 == argc_new ) argv_new = NULL;
11972: 			error_code = (* cmd_loop[index].cmd_fnc )( argc_new, argv_new );
11973: 			if ( error_code < 0 ) goto COMMAND_LINE_PREFIX_LOOP_TERMINATE;
11974: 			else ai += 1 + error_code;
11975: 			index = 0;
11976: 		}
11977: 		else
11978: 		{
11979: 			index++;
11980: 		}
11981: 	}
11982: 	return ai;
11983: COMMAND_LINE_PREFIX_LOOP_TERMINATE:
11984: 	return error_code;
11985: }
11986: 
11990: static int Command_Line_Prefix_Irq( int   argc,    
11991: 									char* argv[] 
11992: 							      )
11993: {
11994: 	(void)  argc;
11995: 	(void)  argv;
11996: 
11997: 	global_irq_please_install_handler_request = true;
11998: #if(0)
11999: 	switch( board_id )
12000: 	{
12001: 		case ID_IDI48:
12002: 			( ( struct idi_dataset * ) board_definition[board_id].dataset)->irq_please_install_handler_request = true;
12003: 			break;		
12004: 		default:
12005: 			return -EC_BOARD_TYPE;
12006: 	}
12007: #endif
12008: 
12009: 	return 0;
12010: }
12011: 
12015: static int Command_Line_Prefix_Trace( 	int   argc,    
12016: 							   	   	   char* argv[] 
12017: 							 	 	 )
12018: {
12019: 	(void) argc;
12020: 	(void) argv;
12021: 	global_io_trace_enable = true;
12022: 	return SUCCESS;
12023: }
12024: 
12028: static struct command_line  cmd_prefix[] =
12029: {
12030: 	{	NULL,		Command_Line_Prefix_Irq,			"irq",		"allows commands to handle interrupts"				},
12031: 	{	cmd_loop,	Command_Line_Prefix_Loop,			"loop",		"any command loops until key pressed"				},
12032: 	{	NULL,		Command_Line_Prefix_Trace,			"trace",	"enable trace functionality"						},
12033: 	{	NULL,		NULL,								NULL,		NULL												},
12034: };
12035: 
12041: int Command_Line_Prefix( int argc, char* argv[] )
12042: {
12043: 	int 		error_code;
12044: 	int			index;
12045: 	int			ai;    	
12046:     int     	argc_new;
12047:     char ** 	argv_new;
12048: 
12049:     if ( argc < 1 ) return 0; 
12050: 
12051: 	index     = 0;
12052: 	ai        = 0;
12053: 	while ( NULL != cmd_prefix[index].cmd_fnc )
12054: 	{
12055: 		if ( 0 == strcmpi( cmd_prefix[index].name, argv[0] )  )
12056: 		{
12057: 			argv_new = &(argv[1]);
12058: 			argc_new = argc - 1;
12059: 			if ( 0 == argc_new ) argv_new = NULL;
12060: 			error_code = (* cmd_prefix[index].cmd_fnc )( argc_new, argv_new );
12061: 			if ( error_code < 0 ) goto COMMAND_LINE_PREFIX_TERMINATE;
12062: 			else ai = 1 + error_code; 
12063: 			break;
12064: 		}
12065: 		index++;
12066: 	}
12067: 	return ai;
12068: COMMAND_LINE_PREFIX_TERMINATE:
12069: 	return error_code;
12070: }
12071: 
12072: 
12073: 
12074: 
12075: 
12076: 
12077: 
12078: 
12079: 
12080: 
12081: 
12082: 
12083: 
12084: 
12086: 
12087: 
12092: static int IDI_Termination( struct idi_dataset * dataset )
12093: {
12094: 	FILE * fd;
12095: 
12096: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12097: printf( "Main:  IDI_Termination\n" );
12098: #endif
12099: 
12100: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12101: 	IOKern_Resource_Termination();
12102: #endif
12103: 	if ( dataset->irq_handler_active )
12104: 	{
12105: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12106: 		printf( " --> irq %u: count = %d\n", dataset->irq_number, dataset->irq_count );
12107: #else
12108: 		printf( " --> irq %u: count = %lu\n", dataset->irq_number, dataset->irq_count );
12109: #endif
12110: 	}
12111: 	dataset->irq_handler_active = false;
12112: 	dataset->irq_please_install_handler_request = false;
12113: 
12114: 	
12115: 	fd = fopen( IDI_BOARD_INIT_FILE_NAME, "wb" );
12116: 	if ( NULL == fd )
12117: 	{ 
12118: 
12119: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12120: 		printf("IDI_Termination: fopen() error: %d (%s)\n", errno, strerror(errno) );
12121: #endif
12122: 		return -EC_INIT_FILE;
12123: 	}
12124: 	else
12125: 	{ 
12126: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12127: printf( "IDI_Termination:  sizeof( struct idi_dataset ) = " );
12128: # if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12129:    printf( "%u\n", sizeof( struct idi_dataset ) );
12130: # else
12131:    printf( "%lu\n", sizeof( struct idi_dataset ) );
12132: # endif
12133: #endif
12134: 		fwrite( dataset, sizeof( struct idi_dataset ), 1, fd );
12135: 		fclose( fd );
12136: 	}
12137: 	return SUCCESS;
12138: }
12139: 
12144: static int IDO_Termination( struct ido_dataset * dataset  )
12145: {
12146: 	FILE * fd;
12147: 
12148: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12149: printf( "Main:  IDO_Termination\n" );
12150: #endif
12151: 
12152: 	
12153: 	fd = fopen( IDO_BOARD_INIT_FILE_NAME, "wb" );
12154: 	if ( NULL == fd )
12155: 	{ 
12156: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12157: 		printf("IDO_Termination: fopen() error: %d (%s)\n", errno, strerror(errno) );
12158: #endif
12159: 		return -EC_INIT_FILE;
12160: 	}
12161: 	else
12162: 	{ 
12163: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12164: printf( "IDO_Termination:  sizeof( struct ido_dataset ) = " );
12165: # if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12166:    printf( "%u\n", sizeof( struct ido_dataset ) );
12167: # else
12168:    printf( "%lu\n", sizeof( struct ido_dataset ) );
12169: # endif
12170: #endif
12171: 		fwrite( dataset, sizeof( struct ido_dataset ), 1, fd );
12172: 		fclose( fd );
12173: 	}
12174: 	return SUCCESS;
12175: }
12176: 
12184: int Termination( int board_id )
12185: {
12186: 	int 	error_code;
12187: 
12188: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12189: printf( "Main:  Termination\n" );
12190: #endif
12191: 
12192: 	error_code = IO_Trace_Dump( board_id );
12193: 	switch( board_id )
12194: 	{
12195: 		case ID_IDI48:
12196: 			error_code = IDI_Termination( (struct idi_dataset *) board_definition[board_id].dataset );
12197: 			break;
12198: 		case ID_IDO48:
12199: 			error_code = IDO_Termination( (struct ido_dataset *) board_definition[board_id].dataset );
12200: 			break;
12201: 	}
12202: 	return error_code;
12203: }
12204: 
12208: void IDI_Dataset_Defaults( struct idi_dataset * ds )
12209: {
12210: 	int index;
12211: 
12212: 	printf( "Warning - using main IDI48 dataset defaults\n" );
12213: 	
12214: 	memset( ds, 0, sizeof(struct idi_dataset) );
12215: 	
12216: 	ds->base_address        = 0x0110;
12217: 	
12218: 
12219: 	for ( index = 0; index < REGS_INIT_QTY; index++ )
12220: 	{
12221: 		ds->reg_init[index].used     = false;
12222: 		ds->reg_init[index].address  = 0;
12223: 		ds->reg_init[index].location = IDI_UNDEFINED;
12224: 		ds->reg_init[index].value    = 0x00;
12225: 	}
12226: }
12227: 
12231: void IDO_Dataset_Defaults( struct ido_dataset * ds )
12232: {
12233: 	int index;
12234: 
12235: 	printf( "Warning - using main IDO48 dataset defaults\n" );
12236: 	
12237: 	memset( ds, 0, sizeof(struct ido_dataset) );
12238: 	
12239: 	ds->base_address        = 0x0130;
12240: 	
12241: 
12242: 	for ( index = 0; index < REGS_INIT_QTY; index++ )
12243: 	{
12244: 		ds->reg_init[index].used     = false;
12245: 		ds->reg_init[index].address  = 0;
12246: 		ds->reg_init[index].location = IDO_UNDEFINED;
12247: 		ds->reg_init[index].value    = 0x00;
12248: 	}
12249: }
12250: 
12254: void Signal_Handler( int signal )
12255: {
12256: 	struct board_dataset * dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[global_board_id].dataset;
12257: 	(void) signal;
12258: 	dataset->quit_application = true;
12259: 	if ( true == global_io_trace_enable )
12260: 	{
12261: 		if ( IO_TRACE_STOP_CTRLC == dataset->trace.stop ) dataset->trace.active = false;
12262: 	}
12263: }
12264: 
12265: 
12270: static void IDI_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load( struct idi_dataset * dataset )
12271: {
12272: 	FILE * 	fd;
12273: 	size_t	file_size;
12274: 	
12275: 	fd = fopen( IDI_BOARD_INIT_FILE_NAME, "rb" );
12276: 	if ( NULL == fd )
12277: 	{ 
12278: 		IDI_Dataset_Defaults( dataset );
12279: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12280: printf( "IDI_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load - fd null -> using defaults\n" );
12281: #endif
12282: 	}
12283: 	else
12284: 	{   
12285: 		fseek( fd, 0L, SEEK_END );
12286: 		file_size = (size_t) ftell( fd );
12287: 		fseek( fd, 0L, SEEK_SET );
12288: 		if ( file_size != sizeof( struct idi_dataset ) )
12289: 		{
12290: 			IDI_Dataset_Defaults( dataset );
12291: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12292: printf( "IDI_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load - file_size=" );
12293: # if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12294:    printf( "%u, sizeof(struct idi_dataset)=%u\n", file_size, sizeof( struct idi_dataset ) );
12295: # else
12296:    printf( "%lu, sizeof(struct idi_dataset)=%lu\n", file_size, sizeof( struct idi_dataset ) );
12297: # endif
12298: #endif
12299: 		}
12300: 		else
12301: 		{	
12302: 			fread( dataset, sizeof( struct idi_dataset ), 1, fd );
12303: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12304: printf( "IDI_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load - file_size=" );
12305: # if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12306:    printf( "%u\n", file_size );
12307: # else
12308:    printf( "%lu\n", file_size );
12309: # endif
12310: #endif
12311: 		}
12312: 		fclose( fd );
12313: 	}
12314: 	dataset->svn_revision_string 				= svn_revision_string;
12315: 	dataset->irq_handler_active 				= false;
12316: 	dataset->irq_please_install_handler_request = false;
12317: 	dataset->irq_count          				= 0;
12318: 	dataset->irq_count_previous 				= 0;
12319: 	dataset->spi_is_present						= false;
12320: 	
12321: 	dataset->bank_previous      				= IDI_BANK_UNDEFINED;
12322: 	dataset->quit_application                   = false;
12323: 	dataset->board_id							= ID_IDI48;
12324: }
12325: 
12330: static void IDO_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load( struct ido_dataset * dataset )
12331: {
12332: 	FILE * 	fd;
12333: 	size_t	file_size;
12334: 	
12335: 	fd = fopen( IDO_BOARD_INIT_FILE_NAME, "rb" );
12336: 	if ( NULL == fd )
12337: 	{ 
12338: 		IDO_Dataset_Defaults( dataset );
12339: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12340: printf( "IDO_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load - fd null -> using defaults\n" );
12341: #endif
12342: 	}
12343: 	else
12344: 	{   
12345: 		fseek( fd, 0L, SEEK_END );
12346: 		file_size = (size_t) ftell( fd );
12347: 		fseek( fd, 0L, SEEK_SET );
12348: 		if ( file_size != sizeof( struct ido_dataset ) )
12349: 		{
12350: 			IDO_Dataset_Defaults( dataset );
12351: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12352: printf( "IDO_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load - file_size=" );
12353: # if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12354:    printf( "%u, sizeof(struct ido_dataset)=%u\n", file_size, sizeof( struct ido_dataset ) );
12355: # else
12356:    printf( "%lu, sizeof(struct ido_dataset)=%lu\n", file_size, sizeof( struct ido_dataset ) );
12357: # endif
12358: #endif
12359: 		}
12360: 		else
12361: 		{	
12362: 			fread( dataset, sizeof( struct ido_dataset ), 1, fd );
12363: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12364: printf( "IDO_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load - file_size=" );
12365: # if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12366:    printf( "%u\n", file_size );
12367: # else
12368:    printf( "%lu\n", file_size );
12369: # endif
12370: #endif
12371: 		}
12372: 		fclose( fd );
12373: 	}
12374: 	dataset->svn_revision_string 				= svn_revision_string;
12375: 	dataset->irq_handler_active 				= false;
12376: 	dataset->irq_please_install_handler_request = false;
12377: 	dataset->irq_count          				= 0;
12378: 	dataset->irq_count_previous 				= 0;
12379: 	dataset->spi_is_present						= false;
12380: 	
12381: 	dataset->bank_previous      				= IDO_BANK_UNDEFINED;
12382: 	dataset->quit_application                   = false;
12383: 	dataset->board_id							= ID_IDO48;
12384: }
12385: 
12390: static void IDI_Initialization_Register( int board_id, struct idi_dataset * dataset )
12391: {
12392: 	int index;
12393: 
12394: 	for ( index = 0; index < REGS_INIT_QTY; index++ )
12395: 	{
12396: 		if ( dataset->reg_init[index].used )
12397: 		{
12398: 			if ( IDI_UNDEFINED != dataset->reg_init[index].location )
12399: 			{
12400: 				IO_Write_U8( board_id, __LINE__, dataset->reg_init[index].location, dataset->reg_init[index].value );
12401: 			}
12402: 			else
12403: 			{
12404: 				IO_Write_U8_Port( 	(struct board_dataset *) dataset,
12405: 									__LINE__,
12406: 									dataset->reg_init[index].address,
12407: 									dataset->reg_init[index].value
12408: 								);
12409: 			}
12410: 		}
12411: 	}
12412: }
12413: 
12418: static void IDO_Initialization_Register( int board_id, struct ido_dataset * dataset )
12419: {
12420: 	int index;
12421: 
12422: 	for ( index = 0; index < REGS_INIT_QTY; index++ )
12423: 	{
12424: 		if ( dataset->reg_init[index].used )
12425: 		{
12426: 			if ( IDO_UNDEFINED != dataset->reg_init[index].location )
12427: 			{
12428: 				IO_Write_U8( board_id, __LINE__, dataset->reg_init[index].location, dataset->reg_init[index].value );
12429: 			}
12430: 			else
12431: 			{
12432: 				IO_Write_U8_Port( 	(struct board_dataset *) dataset,
12433: 									__LINE__,
12434: 									dataset->reg_init[index].address,
12435: 									dataset->reg_init[index].value
12436: 								);
12437: 			}
12438: 		}
12439: 	}
12440: }
12441: 
12442: 
12452: int Initialization( int board_id )
12453: {
12454: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
12455: 	(void) board_id;
12456: 
12457: 	dataset = (struct board_dataset *) board_definition[ID_IDI48].dataset;
12458: 	dataset->quit_application = false;
12459: 	IDI_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load( (struct idi_dataset *) dataset );
12460: 	dataset = (struct board_dataset *) board_definition[ID_IDO48].dataset;
12461: 	dataset->quit_application = false;
12462: 	IDO_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load( (struct ido_dataset *) dataset );
12463: 
12464: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12465: 	IOKern_Resource_Initialization();
12466: #endif
12467: 	dataset = (struct board_dataset *) board_definition[ID_IDI48].dataset;
12468: 	IDI_Initialization_Register( ID_IDI48, (struct idi_dataset *) dataset );
12469: 	dataset = (struct board_dataset *) board_definition[ID_IDO48].dataset;
12470: 	IDO_Initialization_Register( ID_IDO48, (struct ido_dataset *) dataset );
12471: 
12472: 	
12473: 	signal( SIGINT, Signal_Handler );
12474: 
12475: 	IO_Trace_Initialize( ID_IDI48 );
12476: 	IO_Trace_Initialize( ID_IDO48 );
12477: 
12478: #if(0)
12479: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
12480: 	dataset = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
12481: 
12482: 	
12483: 	switch( board_id )
12484: 	{
12485: 		case ID_IDI48:
12486: 			IDI_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load( (struct idi_dataset *) dataset );
12487: 			break;
12488: 		case ID_IDO48:
12489: 			IDO_Initialization_Data_Structure_Load( (struct ido_dataset *) dataset );
12490: 			break;
12491: 		default:
12492: 			return -EC_BOARD_TYPE;
12493: 	}
12494: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12495: 	IOKern_Resource_Initialization();
12496: #endif
12497: 	
12498: 	switch( board_id )
12499: 	{
12500: 		case ID_IDI48:
12501: 			IDI_Initialization_Register( board_id, (struct idi_dataset *) dataset );
12502: 			break;
12503: 		case ID_IDO48:
12504: 			IDO_Initialization_Register( board_id, (struct ido_dataset *) dataset );
12505: 			break;
12506: 		default:
12507: 			return -EC_BOARD_TYPE;
12508: 	}
12509: 
12510: 	
12511: 	dataset->quit_application = false;
12512: 	signal( SIGINT, Signal_Handler );
12513: #endif
12514:     return SUCCESS;
12515: }
12516: 
12517: 
12521: int IDI_Main_Loop_Testing( struct idi_dataset * dataset )
12522: {
12523: 	if ( dataset->irq_handler_active )
12524: 	{
12525: 		if ( dataset->irq_count != dataset->irq_count_previous )
12526: 		{
12527: 
12528: 			dataset->irq_count_previous = dataset->irq_count;
12529: 
12530: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12531: 			printf( " --> irq %u: count = %d\n", dataset->irq_number, dataset->irq_count );
12532: #else
12533: 			printf( " --> irq %u: count = %lu\n", dataset->irq_number, dataset->irq_count );
12534: #endif
12535: 			if ( dataset->irq_count_previous >= dataset->irq_quantity )
12536: 			{
12537: 				return -1; 
12538: 			}
12539: 		}
12540: 	}
12541: 	return 0;
12542: }
12543: 
12547: static void Main_Versalogic( void )
12548: {
12549: 
12550: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12551: 
12552: 	outportb( 0x00E2, 2 );
12553: #endif
12554: }
12555: 
12556: 
12568: int main( int argc, char* argv[] )
12569: {
12570: 	
12571:     
12572: 	int		board_id;
12573: 	int 	error_code;
12574: 	int     index;
12575:     int     argc_new;
12576:     char ** argv_new;
12577: 	struct board_dataset *  dataset;
12578: 	
12579: 
12580: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12581: printf( "Main:  Entry\n" );
12582: #endif
12583: #if defined( SPI_PRINT_XFR_DEBUG )
12584: global_internal_tx_byte_count = 0;
12585: global_internal_rx_byte_count = 0;
12586: #endif
12587: 
12588: 
12589: 
12590: 
12591: # if(1)
12592:     setvbuf(stdout, NULL, _IONBF, 0);
12593:     setvbuf(stderr, NULL, _IONBF, 0);
12594: # endif
12595: 
12596: 
12597: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12598: printf( "Main:  1\n" );
12599: #endif
12600: 
12601: #if(0)
12602:     {
12603:     	char buf[80];
12604: 		int count = argc;
12605: 		int index = 0;     
12606: 		while ( count > 0 )
12607: 		{
12608: 			printf( "index = %d, str = <%s>\n", index, argv[index] );
12609: 			index++;
12610: 			count--;
12611: 		}
12612: 		Time_Current_String( buf, 80 );
12613: 		printf( "Current time is:  %s", buf );
12614:     }
12615: #endif
12616: 
12617:     
12618:     Main_Versalogic();
12619: 
12620: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12621: printf( "Main:  2\n" );
12622: #endif
12623: 
12624:     error_code				= SUCCESS;
12625:     board_id        		= ID_BOARD_UNKNOWN;
12626:     global_board_id 		= board_id;
12627: 
12628:     global_loop_space		= false;
12629: 
12630:     global_io_trace_enable 	= false;
12631: 
12632:    	index = 1;
12633:    	if ( argc > 1 )
12634:     {
12635: 
12636: 
12637: 
12638: 
12639: 
12640: 
12641: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12642: printf( "Main:  3\n" );
12643: #endif
12644: 
12645:    		
12646: 		argv_new   = &(argv[index]);
12647: 		argc_new   = argc - index;
12648: 		error_code = Command_Line_Prefix( argc_new, argv_new );
12649: 		if ( error_code < 0 )  goto Main_Termination_Skip_Termination;
12650: 		else                   index += error_code;
12651: 
12652: 
12653: 
12654: 			
12655: 			switch( Command_Line_Main__Board_Type_Status( argv[index], &board_id ) )
12656: 			{
12657: 				case CLM_BTS_NORMAL:	
12658: 					break;
12659: 				case CLM_BTS_IMPLIED:
12660: 					global_board_id = board_id;
12661: 					goto Main_Initialization_Start;
12662: 				case CLM_BTS_NOT_REQUIRED:
12663: 					goto Main_Loop_Start;
12664: 			}
12665: 
12666: 			
12667: 			if       ( 0 == strcmpi( "idi", argv[index]) )
12668: 			{
12669: 				board_id 		= ID_IDI48;
12670: 				global_board_id = board_id;
12671: 				index++;
12672: 			}
12673: 			else if  ( 0 == strcmpi( "ido", argv[index]) )
12674: 			{
12675: 				board_id        = ID_IDO48;
12676: 				global_board_id = board_id;
12677: 				index++;
12678: 			}
12679: 			else
12680: 			{
12681: 				error_code = -EC_BOARD_TYPE;
12682: 				goto Main_Termination_Error_Codes_Skip_Termination;
12683: 			}
12684: 
12685: 
12686: Main_Initialization_Start:
12687: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12688: printf( "Main:  Main_Initialization_Start\n" );
12689: #endif
12690:    	    error_code = Initialization( board_id );
12691:    	    if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) goto Main_Termination;
12692: 
12693:    	    dataset    = ( struct board_dataset * )  board_definition[board_id].dataset;
12694:    	 	
12695: 
12696: Main_Loop_Start:
12697: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12698: printf( "Main:  Main_Loop_Start\n" );
12699: #endif
12700: 		do
12701: 		{ 
12702: 			argv_new = &(argv[index]);
12703: 			argc_new = argc - index;
12704: 			error_code = Command_Line_Main( board_id, argc_new, argv_new );
12705: 			if ( SUCCESS != error_code ) goto Main_Termination_Error_Codes;
12706: 
12707: 			switch( board_id )
12708: 			{
12709: 				case ID_IDI48:
12710: 					if ( -1 == IDI_Main_Loop_Testing( (struct idi_dataset *) dataset ) )
12711: 					{
12712: 						goto Main_Termination;
12713: 					}
12714: 					break;
12715: 			}
12716: 
12717: 			if ( global_loop_command )
12718: 			{
12719: 				if ( global_loop_delay_ms > 0 )
12720: 				{
12721: #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
12722: 					delay( global_loop_delay_ms );
12723: #endif
12724: 				}
12725: 
12726: 				if ( global_loop_count > 0 )
12727: 				{
12728: 					global_loop_count_counter--;
12729: 					if ( 0 == global_loop_count_counter ) global_loop_command = false;
12730: 				}
12731: 
12732: 				if ( true == global_loop_space )
12733: 				{ 
12734: 					int  character;
12735: 					BOOL not_done;
12736: 
12737: 					not_done = true;
12738: 					do
12739: 					{
12740: 						if ( Character_Get( &character ) )
12741: 						{
12742: 							if ( ' ' == ( (char) character) )
12743: 							{ 
12744: 								not_done = false;
12745: 							}
12746: 							else
12747: 							{ 
12748: 								not_done            = false;
12749: 								global_loop_command = false;
12750: 							}
12751: 						}
12752: 					} while( true == not_done );
12753: 				}
12754: 				else
12755: 				{
12756: 					if ( Character_Get( NULL ) ) global_loop_command = false;
12757: 				}
12758: 
12759: 				
12760: 			}
12761: 
12762: 		} while ( global_loop_command );
12763:     }
12764:    	else
12765:    	{ 
12766:    		Help( false , stdout );
12767:    		goto Main_Termination_Skip_Termination;
12768:    	}
12769: 
12770: Main_Termination:
12771: 
12772: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12773: printf( "Main:  Main_Termination\n" );
12774: #endif
12775:    	Termination( board_id );
12776: 
12777: Main_Termination_Skip_Termination:
12778: 
12779: #if defined( MAIN_DEBUG )
12780: printf( "Main:  Main_Termination_Skip_Termination\n" );
12781: #endif
12782: 
12783:    	return error_code;
12784: 
12785: Main_Termination_Error_Codes:
12786: 
12787: 	Termination( board_id );
12788: 
12789: Main_Termination_Error_Codes_Skip_Termination:
12790: 	printf( "ERROR: %d, %s\n",  error_code, EC_Code_To_Human_Readable( error_code ) );
12791: 	return error_code;
12792: }
Enumerations
 
Name 
Description 
 
CLM_BTS 
brief 
 
IO_TRACE_ENUM 
 
 
IO_TRACE_START_ENUM 
 
 
IO_TRACE_STOP_ENUM 
 
 
irqreturn 
The following code is directly from irqreturn.h from the Linux kernel tree. This is being used by the simulator and DOS to emulate Linux driver behavior and specifically resource allocations.
*
  • enum irqreturn
  • @IRQ_NONE interrupt was not from this device
  • @IRQ_HANDLED interrupt was handled by this device
  • @IRQ_WAKE_THREAD handler requests to wake the handler thread

IDI_REG_ENUM 
brief Once the register location (i.e. logical_address or row) is known, then all other parameters associated with that register can be looked up including physical_offset, bank and legal read/write access.

Command_Line_IO_Read 
brief used to read one or more values from registers sequentially.
b [prefix commands] [x] [c ]
 
 
Command_Line_IO_Write 
brief Used to write to one or more registers in sequence. Can write values to the same register by using the 'x' to toggle auto-indexing from initially on to the off position.

Command_Line_Register_Transaction 
brief
Either reads or writes a register using the form: idi [
]
If
is not include, then it is assumed to be a read. If value is included, then a write to the specified register is made.
This function uses the definitions[] array which is global and built from IDI_REGISTER_SET_DEFINITION macro which is a nicely organized register list.
param[in] argc number of arguments including the executable file name param[in] argv list of string arguments lex'd from the command line

FRAM__Chip_Select_Route_Override 
brief FRAM SPI chip select over-ride mechanism. Temporarily used to set the chip select channel to what we need based on "set framcs".
 
 
FRAM__Chip_Select_Route_Restore 
brief FRAM SPI chip select restore mechanism. Returns the chip select to original SPI configuration settings.
 
 
FRAM__Memory_Read 
brief Reads data from FRAM memory to the output buffer.
param[in] address Starting FRAM address param[in] count Number of bytes to transfer param[out] buffer Destination buffer in which to store the data  
 
FRAM__Memory_Write 
brief Writes data from buffer to FRAM memory.
param[in] address Starting FRAM address param[in] count Number of bytes to transfer param[out] buffer Source buffer from which data will be transfered to FRAM  
 
FRAM__Read_ID 
brief
param[out] id The 32-bit ID register read from the FRAM. This appears to be only available with Fujistu parts.  
 
FRAM__Read_Status_Register 
brief Read the FRAM status register and output the value.
 
 
FRAM__Write_Disable

FRAM__Write_Enable_Latch_Set 
brief FRAM Write Enable Latch Set command (WREN)
 
 
FRAM__Write_Status_Register

param[in] FRAM status value to be written.

FRAM_Set 
This function will be used when creating a memory pool so that as blocks are allocated one can determine if we have an issue outside of any allocated space (i.e. overflows and so on).
param[in] cfg pass in the configuration to be written to hardware. return a nonzero if successful, else return zero.

Initialization 
brief Runs upon application startup. It restores the idi_dataset data structure or if the file cannot be found it will simply initialize those parameters to default values.
 
 
IO_Direction_IsNotValid 
brief Looks up in the register definitions list for the ports possible read/write directions.
param[in] location the enumerated register symbol. The enumerated symbol is composed of offset and bank information used to determine the final address information. param[in] direction The desired direction that is to run  
 
IO_Get_Symbol_Name 
brief Translates a register enumerated symbol into a string that is the same as the enumerated symbol used throughout this code base.
param[in] location The enumerated symbol representing the register.  
 
IO_Read_U16_Address_Fixed 
brief Reads uint16_t from I/O ports in a uint8_t succession to the same address location. Macros are used to guide the target implementation. In this case, bus width (which we typcially refer to the port width, which is different than register width) is assumed to be byte (uint8_t) wide.
param[in] location the enumerated register symbol. The enumerated symbol is composed of offset and bank information used to determine the final address information. param[in] value The pointer to the destination of the read uint16_t value.  
 
IO_Read_U16_Address_Increment 
brief Reads uint16_t from I/O ports in a uint8_t succession incrementing the offset address. Macros are used to guide the target implementation. In this case, bus width (which we typcially refer to the port width, which is different than register width) is assumed to be byte (uint8_t) wide.
param[in] location the enumerated register symbol. The enumerated symbol is composed of offset and bank information used to determine the final address information. param[in] value The pointer to the destination of the read uint16_t value.  
 
IO_Read_U8 
brief Reads uint8_t from I/O port. Macros are used to guide the target implementation.
param[in] location the enumerated register symbol. The enumerated symbol is composed of offset and bank information used to determine the final address information. param[in] value The pointer to the destination of the read uint8_t value.  
 
IO_Read_U8_Port 
brief

IO_Write_U16_Address_Fixed 
brief Writes uint16_t to I/O ports in a uint8_t succession to the same address location. Macros are used to guide the target implementation. In this case, bus width (which we typcially refer to the port width, which is different than register width) is assumed to be byte (uint8_t) wide.
param[in] location the enumerated register symbol. The enumerated symbol is composed of offset and bank information used to determine the final address information. param[in] value The uint16_t value to be written to the I/O register  
 
IO_Write_U16_Address_Increment 
brief Writes uint16_t to I/O ports in a uint8_t succession incrementing the offset address. Macros are used to guide the target implementation. In this case, bus width (which we typcially refer to the port width, which is different than register width) is assumed to be byte (uint8_t) wide.
param[in] location the enumerated register symbol. The enumerated symbol is composed of offset and bank information used to determine the final address information. param[in] value The uint16_t value to be written to the I/O register  
 
IO_Write_U8 
brief Writes uint8_t to I/O port. Macros are used to guide the target implementation.
param[in] board_id software level board selector or descriptor. param[in] location the enumerated register symbol. The enumerated symbol is composed of offset and bank information used to determine the final address information. param[in] value The data to be written out.

Signal_Handler 
brief 
 
SPI_Calculate_Clock 
brief Computes the SPI clock half clock register value given a requested SPI clock frequency. It will also produce a 'report' indicating the actual value (due to integer resolution) as well as a computed error between requested and actual. The eror can be used to determine whether timing constraints are met.
param[in] clock_request_hz Request clock frequency in Hertz. Example: 1.0e6 is 1MHz. param[in] clock_actual_hz Actual computed frequency. If this pointer is NULL, then it is not output. param[out] error Error between requested and actual. If this pointer is NULL, then it is not output. param[out] hci Half clock register value... more 
 
SPI_Calculate_End_Cycle_Delay 
brief Computes the time delay at the end of each byte transmitted. It will only output the parameters whose pointers are not NULL.
param[in] spi_half_clock_interval_sec Computed half clock interval in seconds param[in] delay_request_sec Requested time delay in seconds param[out] delay_actual_sec Pointer to actual time delay computed, if not NULL. param[out] error Pointer to error value computed, if not NULL. param[out] ecd Pointer to the computed end-cycle-delay, if not NULL.  
 
SPI_Calculate_Half_Clock 
brief Computes the half clock register value given a requested time interval. It will also produce a 'report' indicating the actual value (due to integer resolution) as well as a computed error between requested and actual. The error can be used to determine whether timing constraints are met.
param[in] half_clock_request_sec Request time interval in seconds. Example: 20.0e-6 is 20uS. param[in] half_clock_actual_sec Actual computed time. If this pointer is NULL, then it is not output. param[out] error Error between requested and actual. If this pointer is NULL, then it is not output. param[out] hci Half clock register value computed. If this... more 
 
SPI_Calculate_Half_Clock_Interval_Sec 
brief Computes the half clock interval in seconds given the value from the half clock interval register.
param[in] half_clock_interval Half clock interval register value  
 
SPI_Commit 
brief Sets/Clears the chip select or used to commit the transmit/write FIFO to the spi interface. The mode of operation is dependent on the chip_select_behavior.
param[in] commit Used to write to the SCS_COMMIT bit. Its behavior is dependent on the chip_select_behavior.  
 
SPI_Commit_Get 
brief Sets/Clears the chip select or used to commit the transmit/write FIFO to the spi interface. The mode of operation is dependent on the chip_select_behavior.
param[out] commit Used to write to the SCS_COMMIT bit. Its behavior is dependent on the chip_select_behavior.

SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Behavior_Get 
brief Extracts the chip select behavior from the SPI configuration register.
param[out] chip_select_behavior pointer to the destination of the value obtained.  
 
SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Behavior_Set 
brief Sets the chip select behavior to the SPI configuration register.
param[in] chip_select_behavior enumerated value to be written to the register.  
 
SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Route_Get 
brief Sets which hardware chip select line is to be used, either CS0 (channel 0) or CS1 (channel 1).
param[out] chip_select_behavior pointer to the destination of the value obtained.  
 
SPI_Configuration_Chip_Select_Route_Set 
brief Sets which hardware chip select line is to be used, either CS0 (channel 0) or CS1 (channel 1).
param[in] cs_to_channel1 true if CS to route to channel 1 (CS1), othwerwise channel 0 (CS0).

param[out] cfg SPI configuration data structure or data set

param[in] cfg The software configuration data structure to be committed to hardware  
 
SPI_Data_Read 
Special case of Write/Read that has a function signature same as fread() or fwrite().
param[in] cfg pass in the configuration to be written to hardware. return a nonzero if successful, else return zero.
 
 
SPI_Data_Write 
Special case of Write/Read that has a function signature same as fread() or fwrite().
param[in] cfg pass in the configuration to be written to hardware. return a nonzero if successful, else return zero.
 
 
SPI_Data_Write_Read 
brief
If CSB = software. Stuff as fast as you can.
If CSB == buffer. if object size = 1, then stuff as fast as you can. The chip select will go active and only go inactive when done transmitting. This is best used for objects whos size is less than SPI_FIFO_SIZE. if object size != 1, then stuff only that quantity and wait until buffers are empty in order to have the chip select wrap around the data.
If CSB == uint8_t Stuff as fast as you can.
If CSB == uint16_t Stuff two bytes at a time as... more 
 
SPI_Data_Write_Read_Helper_Commit 
brief
returns true if user wishes to break. 
 
SPI_Data_Write_Read_Helper_Read 
brief 
 
SPI_Data_Write_Read_Helper_Write 
brief 
 
SPI_FIFO_Read 
brief Reads from the SPI receive/read data FIFO. It does not attempt to correlate the number of transmit bytes with receive bytes. Its purpose is more for low level hardware testing. Note that this function has a signature identical to the fread() function (i.e. make use of function pointers to guide sourcing of data).
param[in] buffer Buffer for the data destination. param[in] size Size of objects in bytes. param[in] count Number of objects to be read param[out] fd_log Optional log file to write the buffer too. If NULL, then no logging.  
 
SPI_FIFO_Write 
brief Writes specifically to the SPI transmit/write data FIFO. It does not attempt to correlate the number of transmit bytes with receive bytes. Its purpose is more for low level hardware testing. Note that this function has a signature identical to the fwrite() function (i.e. make use of function pointers to guide destination of data).
param[in] buffer Buffer containing the data to be written. param[in] size Size of objects in bytes. param[in] count Number of objects to be written param[out] fd_log Optional log file to write the buffer too. If NULL, then no logging.  
 
SPI_ID_Get 
This is function SPI_ID_Get. 
 
SPI_ID_Get_Helper 
brief Retrieves the SPI ID register value.
param[out] id The SPI component ID value.  
 
SPI_IsNotPresent 
brief Reports if the SPI component is available within the register space by matching a known ID. The SPI register map is only enabled within the hardware if the hardware mode is not zero (i.e. M1 and M0 jumpers on the board provide a nonzero value).
 
 
SPI_Report_Configuration_Text 
brief Creates a human readable report of the SPI configuration data structure.
param[in] cfg SPI configuration data structure pointer parm[out] out File destination descriptor  
 
SPI_Report_Status_Text 
brief Produces a human readable report of the SPI status data structure.
param[in] status SPI status data structure pointer parm[out] out File destination descriptor  
 
SPI_Status_Read 
brief Builds a detailed status data structure of the receive/read incoming SPI data FIFO. Reports the quantity of bytes currently in the receive FIFO, full flag, empty flag, the total size of the FIFO in bytes, and sets tx_status to false indicating that this is status specific to the receive FIFO.
The status register has the following format: status[7] full status[6] empty status[5] not used (future size expansion) status[4:0] number of bytes currently in the FIFO
param[out] status Pointer to status data structure to be updated.  
 
SPI_Status_Read_FIFO_Is_Not_Empty 
brief Returns the receive/read FIFO empty status flag. This function is typically used to determine if the FIFO is empty.
 
 
SPI_Status_Read_FIFO_Status 
brief Returns the complete read/receive FIFO status.
The status register has the following format: status[7] full status[6] empty status[5] not used (future size expansion) status[4:0] number of bytes currently in the FIFO
param[out] empty FIFO empty flag param[out] bytes_available a count of the number of bytes in the FIFO  
 
SPI_Status_Write 
brief Builds a detailed status data structure of the transmit/write outgoing SPI data FIFO. Reports the quantity of bytes currently in the transmit FIFO, full flag, empty flag, the total size of the FIFO in bytes, and sets tx_status to true indicating that this is status specific to the transmit FIFO.
The status register has the following format: status[7] full status[6] empty status[5] not used (future size expansion) status[4:0] number of bytes currently in the FIFO
param[out] status Pointer to status data structure to be updated.  
 
SPI_Status_Write_FIFO_Is_Full 
brief Returns the transmit/write FIFO full status flag. It is preferable to use the SPI_Status_Write() or SPI_Status_Write_FIFO_Status() because all status is retrieved at one time.
 
 
SPI_Status_Write_FIFO_Is_Not_Empty 
brief Returns the transmit/write FIFO empty status flag. This function is typically used to wait for the transmit/write FIFO to become empty.
 
 
SPI_Status_Write_FIFO_Status 
brief Returns the complete write/transmit FIFO status.
The status register has the following format: status[7] full status[6] empty status[5] not used (future size expansion) status[4:0] number of bytes currently in the FIFO
param[out] full FIFO full flag param[out] empty FIFO empty flag param[out] bytes_in_fifo a count of the number of bytes in the FIFO  
 
String_To_Bool 
brief General function used to convert a string into a boolean equivalent value.
param[in] str string input for conversion.  
 
Termination 
brief Runs upon application exit. It saves the idi_dataset data structure.
 
 
Time_Current_String 
brief Obtains the current time and date. This is exerpetted from AES Universal Library/Driver.
Excerpt from AES advanced Linux library/driver. COPYRIGHT NOTICE Copyright (c) 2012 by Apex Embedded Systems.
param[out] buf resulting date-time string. param[in] buf_size the character size of the buffer including null terminating character.

REG_LOCATION_CHANNEL_GET 
This is macro REG_LOCATION_CHANNEL_GET. 
REG_LOCATION_LOGICAL_GET 
 
REG_LOCATION_SET 
brief 'Index' is the row number, in this case it is the 'logical address' column in the register definition x-macros. The 'channel' is an index for channel information which in this case we are setting to zero as it is not required since that information is already embodied within the logical address for the specific register definition.
